column1: nr;RomName78;RomName;Game;Description

Agent 005 brings new cash collections to you. His mission is to deliver secret attache cases to an awaiting helicopter. Through wily street chases and the shadows of warehouse darkness to slippery skating rink maneuvers and the blazing aerial getaway fight. Agent 005 steels the scene and delivers customers to you. Fun-filled music attracts them. Four thrilling escape scenes challenge them and the continuous fun keeps them playing and playing. The unique audio and video excitement matches every players skill level.

And 005 is a RasterScan Convert, a Game which can later be converted to a brand new top earning game at a substantial savings.

Put Agent 005 on your side and win the chase for higher profits. For more information on the latest in video-game action, call your nearest Sega/Gremlin distributor.

The chase is on. Agent 005 makes away with an attache case. A hovering helicopter awaits his arrival, but first... Enemy guards pound the street in pursuit. 005 must duck into a new scene.

Inside a warehouse. Avoid being caught in the guard's flashlight beams... once 005 is detected, the chase quickens to super fast. Blast the guards with stun-gas and score valuable points.

Slip into a skate rink. And slip you will. There is no stopping on ice and the same goes for the thrills. Sliding and firing... firing and sliding. 005 can call his helicopter to escape.

The final flight fight. High flying aerial excitement. 005 has reached his helicopter in all other scenes and now finds his high scoring, high soaring getaway copter in a new test balloon and parachute bombs close in from all sides. 005 blast away to score points and to escape. Then the final challenge is thrown at his skill - a blazing battle with the enemy copter. Win now and you win big.

It's free-wheeling fun with fun-filled music and sound. Its stealth and pursuit is like no other video game. Everybody's after Agent 005. You should be, too. Call your nearest Sega/Gremlin distributor today and make sure 005 is on your side.

4;1942;1942a;1942 (c) 1984 Capcom.
;"1942"" is a vertically-scrolling shoot-em-up set in the Pacific theatre during World War II
column2: in which the goal is to reach Tokyo and destroy the entire Japanese air fleet.

column1: The player pilots a plane dubbed the ""Super Ace"" (its appearance is that of a Lockheed P-38 Lightning) and has to shoot down waves of enemy planes while avoiding incoming enemy fire. The 'Super Ace' can perform a limited number of rolls or 'loop-the-loops' to evade enemy planes and shots.
During the game
column2: waves of red enemy planes periodically appear. If the player manages to destroy a red wave
column3: a power-up
column4: in the form of a 'POW' symbol
column5: will be dropped and can be picked up. The power-up will award either increased fire-power (doubling the player's guns from two to four)
column6: a smart bomb that destroys all on-screen enemy planes the instant it's collected
column7: two wingmen planes that flank the Super Ace and increase fire power
column8: or simply extra points.

column1: At the end of each stage the 'Super Ace' lands on an aircraft carrier and bonus points are awarded based on player performance. ""1942"" differs from other games in that its levels are numbered in reverse order
column2: so the game begins at stage 32 and ends at stage 1."

column1: 22;3kokushi;3kokushi;"?Shikou Puzzle Game! SANKOKUSHI (c) 1996 Mitchell.
;Sankokushi is an adult Shanghai solitaire game. Unlike in a standard mahjong solitaire game
column2: tiles are removed in groups of three.  These groups may be made up of three matching tiles
column3: or the number sets
column6: or 7-9. The objective is to find the four
column7: three-tile sets shown at the start of the stage and remove them from the game board before the timer runs out.

column1: When a tile is selected
column2: other tiles are lit up.  Tiles within the number sequence are shown in pink
column3: and matching tiles are shown in orange.  The player may request hints by selecting the help button on screen
column4: which will light up all tiles that can be removed from the board at that time.  There is also a back button
column5: which the player may select to return tiles to the screen.

column1: The background image in each stage is an image of a girl.  Each girl has two background images
column2: with the second image showing the girl topless. Once a player removes the four tile sets for the stage
column3: the board is cleared and the player may see the entire image.

column1: After completing a stage the player may use the points he has earned to buy power-ups
column2: such as extra hints or a faster cursor.

column1: The game is over once the timer has run out or if the player cannot legally remove any more tiles and the board is 'deadlocked'.  Upon continuing the player may select to play the same board or play a different one."

;Idol Janshi Suchie-Pai II is a strip mahjong game featuring seven opponents in eight stages (the final boss
column2: having two costumes).  The player's character is Suchi-Pai. At the start of the game
column3: the player selects their first opponent out of the other Mahjong Pies.  The remaining Pies are played in a random sequence before moving on to the final three stages
column4: all played in order.

column1: As in the original game
column2: stages are completed by removing all the tiles from a matching game played between rounds of mahjong
column3: or by completely wiping out an opponents betting funds. Once a girl is defeated
column4: the player is shown that girls strip sequence.

column1: Matching tiles in the matching game reward the player with bonus items that are used to cheat during following hands of mahjong.  Some tiles are used to fill up a meter instead of giving an item.  Once the meter is full
column2: a revealing animated sequence is played of a defeated Mahjong Pie
column3: who then joins Suchi-Pai in assisting the player.

column1: If the player loses all of their betting funds
column2: then the game is over."

;A strange deep space shoot them up, which apparently has a 4th dimension. The game is a side scrolling shooter in which you take control of a jetpack propelled space warrior who travels between parallel universes and worm holes throughout the game. By flying over the top of the play field, you end up in an alternate universe. You travel back and forth defeating enemies until you reach a boss creature. On some occasions a worm hole will appear in the middle of the play field and you are taken to even stranger worlds...

column1: 32;4in1boot;4in1boot;"Puzzle King (c) 2002 K1soft.
;600 is a maze game where the player is a turtle trying to bring baby turtles
column2: called 'kidturtles' to their homes while avoiding beetles. Scattered throughout the maze are boxes with question marks on them. When the player walks over a question mark
column3: a baby turtle will crawl onto the main turtle's back
column4: a house will appear at a random location on the map
column5: and the player will have to bring the baby turtle to its house while avoiding beetles.

column1: Other times
column2: beetles will come out of the boxes
column3: which the player will have to quickly run away from. The player's only offensive move is the ability to drop ""smart bombs"" to temporarily stun the beetles. The player's smart bombs can be refilled by grabbing the smart bombs in the middle of the maze. However
column4: unlike actual smart bombs
column5: the player's bombs do not move and stay in a single place until a beetle runs over it.

column1: You have eight floors to deal with the beetles
column2: then you'll go to the roof to get your baby turtles
column3: after you go get them
column4: you walk home with the rest of the baby turtles you collected. The game pattern is endless."

;720° is a one or two-player arcade game with players taking on the role of a skateboarder
column2: and must perform various tricks and maneuvers to earn the points and tickets needed to compete for medals in the game's numerous skate parks.

column1: The bulk of the action takes place in a 'Skate City'
column2: a small urban area made up of ramps
column3: jumps and hazards. Players can skate anywhere they wish as they perform the tricks and jumps needed to reach the score thresholds that will earn them entry tickets to Skate City's skate parks to compete for medals and cash prizes.

column1: Each score threshold must be reached and a park entered within a tight time limit. Failure to do so sees the skater persued by a swarm of bees and the words SKATE OR DIE appear. Should the bees touch the skater before he enters a park
column2: the game ends. Skate City's roads and pavements are populated with moving traffic and pedestrians and any collision with them will result in the skater being knocked from his board
column3: costing the player precious seconds.

column1: The parks themselves each feature one of four different disciplines: Slalom
column2: Jump
column3: Downhill and Ramp. Each park has a timer and players can earn either a bronze
column4: silver or gold medal - together with a cash prize - depending on how quickly the park is completed. If the park target score or finish line is not reached before the timer expires
column5: no medal or money is awarded.

column1: Money won can be used to buy equipment upgrades from the stalls that litter Skate City. Players can buy upgraded boards
column2: helmets
column3: pads and shoes. Boards give faster speed; helmets allow for more risky maneuvers; pads give a faster recovery from falls and shoes provide more height on jumps
column4: as well as giving a quicker standing start.

column1: At the start of each new game
column2: players can select from one of two play modes. 'Training Level' is available for beginners and gives players numerous playing hints and tips. 'Experienced Level' is more challenging as well as offering fewer hints. It does
column3: however
column4: include the 'add-a-coin' feature
column5: which allows for awards and items already won to be carried over to a new game.

column1: The main objective is to compete in as many skate parks as possible. There are numerous city hazards to be avoided
column2: such as BMX riders
column3: cars
column4: Frisbee throwers and other skaters. To guide the player around Skate City are map tiles. Riding over one of these will temporaily pause the action and display the layout of the city
column5: including the locations of the skate parks and equipment stalls.

column1: 720° features ten 'class levels' which determine the degree of difficulty in the skate parks and the timer in the city streets. Each of the four skate parks is graded in difficulty
column2: ranging from 1 (easiest) to 4 (hardest).

column1: By using the add-a-coin option available in the 'Advanced' game mode
column2: players can keep any special skate equipment they have acquired in the previous game
column3: as well as all accumulated cash
column4: tickets
column5: points and medals.

column1: From Atari Games
THE ULTIMATE AERIAL EXPERIENCE!
* Superior graphics and animation for more player involvement.
* Realistic skateboard action lets players attempt daring maneuvers.
* Players select where they want to skate
column2: making each game a different experience.

column1: * New rotary controller allows full directional and circular motions.
* Contemporary cabinet design with new 25"" higher-resolution monitor.
* 8"" audio speakers to highlight the custom music scores
column2: sound effects
column3: and speech.

column1: * Add-a-Coin feature keeps players in the action.
720° has all the thrills and skills of real skateboarding with both freestyle and competitive action. A totally unique game format challenges players to become champion of the skating world.
* Start by skating to a skatepark to select difficulty.
* Perform skate maneuvers in the city to earn tickets to get into a skatepark.
* The ""Ramp"" is one of over 20 skateparks.
By definition
column2: a 720° is one of the most daring moves attempted only by the best
column3: where the skater does a full 720-degree twist while soaring through the air. In 720°
column4: the game
column5: players can attempt to perform this move without bodily injury. This is only part of the fantasy world of 720°...

column1: * Unique Action and Game Format.

The player portrays the skater who must earn the right to compete in the skateparks of the city and ultimately win the title of champion of the skating world. The action starts with the player in the middel of ""Skate City""
column2: where all surfaces are skateable - a skateboarder's dream world! The player earns tickets by performing skillful skate maneuvers in the city.

column1: These tickets allow him to enter the skateparks where he competes against the clock fot gold
column2: silver or bronze medals. ""Cash"" prizes are awarded to the skater if he qualifies for a medal. After the skatepark competition
column3: the game continues back in the city for more freestyle action. Numerous hazards and obstacles create a busy scenario in the city
column4: and the skater has a limited time to get to another skatepark.

column1: Players can use their ""cash"" winnings to buy skating equipment from various skate shops though-out the city.
- BOARDS will give the player faster speed.
- HELMETs allow more risk-taking for successful maneuvers.
- PADS give faster recovery from falls.
- SHOES provide better height on jumps and quicker starts.
* New Controls
Players controls consist of a rotary controller which allows full circular and directional movement. A kick button keeps the player skating
column2: and a jump button is used to ""catch air"" for higher points. Anything goes in this game
column3: as players learn to make incredible skate maneuvers.

column1: * More Visual and Audio Entertainment.
720° has a new 25"" higher-resolution monitor for better graphics and animation than ever before. Plus
column2: 8"" speakers highlight the custom music
column3: sound effects and speech
column4: making the player feel like he's tight there in the action.

column1: * Operator Features
720° is equipped with the comprehensive self-test and statistics package on all recent Atari Games products. Operator difficulty adjustments are also provided by four different option switches.
* Special Game Features

- In 720° players create their own game action as they select where they want to skate. PLayers will find map areas in the city which will momentarily display the layout of the city and the skatepark locations.
- Players can select the class level in which they want to compete. At the start of each game
column2: players skate towards one of four skateparks which very in difficulty from ""novice"" to ""pro"". As the game progresses players automatically advance to the next level.

column1: - Players can compete on over 20 skateparks
column2: each requires a different skill. There are variations of a half-pipe ramp
column3: a downhill
column4: a slalom and a jump park.

column1: - The city is filled with hazards which the player must avoid
column2: including: street traffic
column3: BMX bikers
column4: skater gangs
column5: and frisbee throwers/

column1: - An Add-a-Coin feature lets players stay in the action and keep any special skate equipment acquired."

column1: From Atari Games
THE ULTIMATE AERIAL EXPERIENCE!
* Superior graphics and animation for more player involvement.
* Realistic skateboard action lets players attempt daring maneuvers.
* Players select where they want to skate
column2: making each game a different experience.

column1: * New rotary controller allows full directional and circular motions.
* Contemporary cabinet design with new 25"" higher-resolution monitor.
* 8"" audio speakers to highlight the custom music scores
column2: sound effects
column3: and speech.

column1: * Add-a-Coin feature keeps players in the action.
720° has all the thrills and skills of real skateboarding with both freestyle and competitive action. A totally unique game format challenges players to become champion of the skating world.
* Start by skating to a skatepark to select difficulty.
* Perform skate maneuvers in the city to earn tickets to get into a skatepark.
* The ""Ramp"" is one of over 20 skateparks.
By definition
column2: a 720° is one of the most daring moves attempted only by the best
column3: where the skater does a full 720-degree twist while soaring through the air. In 720°
column4: the game
column5: players can attempt to perform this move without bodily injury. This is only part of the fantasy world of 720°...

column1: * Unique Action and Game Format.

The player portrays the skater who must earn the right to compete in the skateparks of the city and ultimately win the title of champion of the skating world. The action starts with the player in the middel of ""Skate City""
column2: where all surfaces are skateable - a skateboarder's dream world! The player earns tickets by performing skillful skate maneuvers in the city.

column1: These tickets allow him to enter the skateparks where he competes against the clock fot gold
column2: silver or bronze medals. ""Cash"" prizes are awarded to the skater if he qualifies for a medal. After the skatepark competition
column3: the game continues back in the city for more freestyle action. Numerous hazards and obstacles create a busy scenario in the city
column4: and the skater has a limited time to get to another skatepark.

column1: Players can use their ""cash"" winnings to buy skating equipment from various skate shops though-out the city.
- BOARDS will give the player faster speed.
- HELMETs allow more risk-taking for successful maneuvers.
- PADS give faster recovery from falls.
- SHOES provide better height on jumps and quicker starts.
* New Controls
Players controls consist of a rotary controller which allows full circular and directional movement. A kick button keeps the player skating
column2: and a jump button is used to ""catch air"" for higher points. Anything goes in this game
column3: as players learn to make incredible skate maneuvers.

column1: * More Visual and Audio Entertainment.
720° has a new 25"" higher-resolution monitor for better graphics and animation than ever before. Plus
column2: 8"" speakers highlight the custom music
column3: sound effects and speech
column4: making the player feel like he's tight there in the action.

column1: * Operator Features
720° is equipped with the comprehensive self-test and statistics package on all recent Atari Games products. Operator difficulty adjustments are also provided by four different option switches.
* Special Game Features

- In 720° players create their own game action as they select where they want to skate. PLayers will find map areas in the city which will momentarily display the layout of the city and the skatepark locations.
- Players can select the class level in which they want to compete. At the start of each game
column2: players skate towards one of four skateparks which very in difficulty from ""novice"" to ""pro"". As the game progresses players automatically advance to the next level.

column1: - Players can compete on over 20 skateparks
column2: each requires a different skill. There are variations of a half-pipe ramp
column3: a downhill
column4: a slalom and a jump park.

column1: - The city is filled with hazards which the player must avoid
column2: including: street traffic
column3: BMX bikers
column4: skater gangs
column5: and frisbee throwers/

column1: - An Add-a-Coin feature lets players stay in the action and keep any special skate equipment acquired."
;720° is a one or two-player arcade game with players taking on the role of a skateboarder
column2: and must perform various tricks and maneuvers to earn the points and tickets needed to compete for medals in the game's numerous skate parks.

column1: The bulk of the action takes place in a 'Skate City'
column2: a small urban area made up of ramps
column3: jumps and hazards. Players can skate anywhere they wish as they perform the tricks and jumps needed to reach the score thresholds that will earn them entry tickets to Skate City's skate parks to compete for medals and cash prizes.

column1: Each score threshold must be reached and a park entered within a tight time limit. Failure to do so sees the skater persued by a swarm of bees and the words SKATE OR DIE appear. Should the bees touch the skater before he enters a park
column2: the game ends. Skate City's roads and pavements are populated with moving traffic and pedestrians and any collision with them will result in the skater being knocked from his board
column3: costing the player precious seconds.

column1: The parks themselves each feature one of four different disciplines: Slalom
column2: Jump
column3: Downhill and Ramp. Each park has a timer and players can earn either a bronze
column4: silver or gold medal - together with a cash prize - depending on how quickly the park is completed. If the park target score or finish line is not reached before the timer expires
column5: no medal or money is awarded.

column1: Money won can be used to buy equipment upgrades from the stalls that litter Skate City. Players can buy upgraded boards
column2: helmets
column3: pads and shoes. Boards give faster speed; helmets allow for more risky maneuvers; pads give a faster recovery from falls and shoes provide more height on jumps
column4: as well as giving a quicker standing start.

column1: At the start of each new game
column2: players can select from one of two play modes. 'Training Level' is available for beginners and gives players numerous playing hints and tips. 'Experienced Level' is more challenging as well as offering fewer hints. It does
column3: however
column4: include the 'add-a-coin' feature
column5: which allows for awards and items already won to be carried over to a new game.

column1: The main objective is to compete in as many skate parks as possible. There are numerous city hazards to be avoided
column2: such as BMX riders
column3: cars
column4: Frisbee throwers and other skaters. To guide the player around Skate City are map tiles. Riding over one of these will temporaily pause the action and display the layout of the city
column5: including the locations of the skate parks and equipment stalls.

column1: 720° features ten 'class levels' which determine the degree of difficulty in the skate parks and the timer in the city streets. Each of the four skate parks is graded in difficulty
column2: ranging from 1 (easiest) to 4 (hardest).

63;aburner;aburner;"After Burner (c) 1987 Sega.
;Another 3-D Sega game rendered with their superb sprite-scaling technology; this time putting the player into the seat of a powerful jet fighter.
A number of colorful
column2: fast-moving environments await the player
column3: as he or she takes on the hordes of enemy planes intent on the player's destruction.

column1: At the end of every 2nd stage
column2: the player's jet fighter is re-fueled and re-armed
column3: either by the appearance of a large support plane
column4: or by landing on a military airstrip.

column1: After Burner's straightforward shoot'em up game-play is unremarkable and repetitive
column2: but fun - largely down to the game's incredible visuals."

column1: 64;aburner2;aburner2;"After Burner II (c) 1987 Sega.
;After Burner is another Sega game rendered with their then-ubiquitous 3-D sprite-scaling technology; this time putting the player into the seat of a powerful F14 Tomcat jet fighter.
Players must fight their way through 21 colourful
column2: fast-moving stages
column3: shooting down waves of enemy fighters while avoiding the enemy's incoming missiles. The F14 is equipped with a machine gun and a limited number of homing missiles. The gun has infinite ammunition and targeting is achieved by maneuvering the Tomcat so that the targeting cursor situated just in front of the jet is placed over an enemy fighter.

column1: To deploy missiles
column2: the player must first 'lock-on' to the target
column3: a sound will indicate that the lock has taken place and missiles should then be fired
column4: these will home in on and destroy the locked-on enemy fighter.

column1: Missile stocks are replenished at the end of every 2nd stage
column2: either by the appearance of a large support plane that automatically links up with the player's jet fighter
column3: or by landing on a military airstrip - which again happens automatically.

column1: After Burner's straightforward shoot-em-up gameplay is simple and repetitive
column2: but the game's incredible visuals ensured its success."

69;acrobatm;acrobatm;Acrobat Mission (c) 1991 Taito Corp.
;A great vertical scrolling shoot'em up game.

At the year 2100 A.D. Humans were exterminated by their own self-destructive nature leaving behind the consequences of environmental degradation on earth and were forced to escape to Mars leaving a bio-computer for environmental recuperation of earth to preparing the blue planet for future recolonization. But one day a half a century after humans arrived
column2: mars was attacked by strange flying objects. To fight these enemies
column3: the director general of the Defence Agency organized the task force army and started quickly the dogfight with invaders to neutralize the invasion.

column1: The operation was called 'Acrobat Mission' as it exceeded the technical limits of the pilots.
The players takes controls on one of two surviving fighters pilots
column2: 'Jet' a male pilot and 'Nova' a female pilot and both flying the Icarus
column3: a fast and powerful space-fighter
column4: which comes equipped with a Standard laser. Two more weapons are available throughout the game - the wide shot (W) which spreads out in front of the ship and the Hurricane shot (H) which fires clusters of rotating balls of energy. Holding the fire button charges up a special attack and each weapon features a different energy blast and damage factor. The ships can also hold a maximum of two smart-bombs
column5: one under each wing - although they can be activated by the players
column6: they also do fall off easily and can be detonated by enemy shots. Interestingly
column7: the Icarus can't collide with other ships or any part of the scenery - instead
column8: it bounces off and only suffers damage from enemy shots. However
column9: once the shield is depleted
column10: the ship will fly out of control for a few seconds and grant the players a last chance to inflict damage to any remaining enemies before it explodes."

column4: a boat

column1: Different kinds of power ups can be obtained throughout the game. These include:
'3' 3-Way: Bullets fire forward
column2: right
column3: and left.

column1: 'L' Laser: Player can shoot double lasers.
'T' Triple: Missiles are fired that spread out three ways in front.
'V' Vulcan: Rapid bullets are fired in the directions controlled.
'B' Bomb: Air to ground missles which can be upgraded twice.
'O' Orbital: A small drone using the same weaponry as the helicopter which can be otained by clearing a special formation of little red fighters.
There is an additional super weapon that destroys all the enemies on the screen at once. However
column2: use of this weapon is limited.

column1: Ajax contains 2 different types of stages : 2-D and 3-D. In the 2-D stage
column2: the player controls a helicopter. In the 3-D stage
column3: the player commands a jet fighter.

column1: Ajax features some impressive graphics filled with rotation and scaling effects (some may get a little dizzy
column2: though!)
column3: a solid soundtrack and excellent game control. Highly recommended for any shoot'em up enthusiast!"

column1: 90;akiss;akiss;"Mahjong Angel Kiss (c) 1995 Jaleco.

;An adult mahjong game, Mahjong Angel Kiss is unique in that it features quite a few animated strip sequences per girl, instead of the standard three or four. Also unique is that the game does not give a set amount of betting funds for each girl, because of this the player cannot progress quicker through the game by depleting the girl's funds and must play a match for every strip sequence.
91;akkanvdr;akkanvdr;Akkanvader (c) 1995 Taito Corp.
92;alcon;alcon;Alcon (c) 1986 Taito America Corp.

;Vertical scrolling shoot-em-up. Shoot ground targets and collect stars which can be exchanged for various power-ups. Fly over hi-tech landscape. Features end of level bosses, good sound and graphics.
93;alexkida;alexkidd;Alex Kidd With Stella - The Lost Stars (c) 1986 Sega.

;Alex Kidd: The Lost Stars features Alex Kidd and Stella (controlled by player 2) searching for the twelve Zodiac signs. Alex's mission is to run through each level, knocking down enemies, and obtain the six miracle balls. These balls are hidden inside such unusual places as golden eggs, the Fantasy Zone ship out of action, clamshells, Christmas presents, pumpkins, and desk bells. Levels include Toy World, Machine World, the World of Make Believe, Water World, and Monster World.

column1: 95;alibaba;alibaba;"Ali Baba and 40 Thieves (c) 1982 Sega.

;Ali Baba and 40 Thieves is an arcade game in which the player must utilize a four-way joystick to take control of the eponymous Ali Baba who must fend off and kill the forty thieves as they try to steal his money; at the start of the game
column2: Ali Baba goes into the room at the top of the screen as that text ""Open Sesame"" appears above him
column3: grabs the seven bags of money and takes them down to the room at the bottom of the screen. He will now have to hit each of the forty thieves as they enter the room - but if one of them should make it to the room at the bottom of the screen he will pick up one of the seven bags of money then try to take it back up to the room at the top of the screen. If the thieves take all seven of the money bags up to the top of the screen
column4: it will cost Ali Baba a life; but
column5: if he ""hits"" all forty thieves without this happening (except the large and invulnerable red one)
column6: he will proceed to the next level."

102;aliensya;aliensyn2;Alien Syndrome (c) 1987 Sega.
;Alien Syndrome is a overhead-view run and gun game for one or two players in which a number of Mankind's space ships and bases have been overrun by an alien race
column2: who have taken the human inhabitants hostage.

column1: Players control two soldiers named Ricky and Mary and must fight their way through large eight-way scrolling levels to rescue their captured comrades. Once a set number of hostages have been rescued
column2: an exit opens and players can pass through it to fight the end-of-level guardian. Once the guardian is defeated
column3: play moves onto the next stage.

column1: A time-bomb is automatically set at the start of each stage
column2: which must then be completed before the bomb's timer runs down. Failure to finish the level in time results in the death of the player characters. Weapon upgrades and maps of the current level are available at certain points and are accessed via hatchways in the wall.

column1: Alien Syndrome consists of 6 full stages plus a 7th final mini-stage
column2: consisting solely of a fight to the death against the game's final
column3: massive guardian."

column1: 120;amatelas;amatelas;"Sei Senshi Amatelass (c) 1986 Nichibutsu.

;Become the Mighty Fighting Amazon and you will search jungles and deserts on the most dangerous island on earth. Your mission is to recapture the men. You desperately need to save the only race of giant womankind from extinction.
You will journey and must conquer 8 forbidden territories of death infested by hungry cannibals and defended by armies of bizarre creatures
column2: each lead by a giant hideous monster whom you must defeat to continue your quest.

column1: Beware
column2: there are many unknown dangers. Remember
column3: you must steal the air mobile cycle and become invincible to succeed against the giant evil that awaits you. Failure would mean the end of the Mighty Amazon forever!"

;A darts game with 5 different game variations including : Flash (A Bull's Eye Game), Sector Shoot-Out (a numbered target game), 301 (the traditional darts game), High Score, and Cricket (a game of innings/points).
125;amidar;amidar1;Amidar (c) 1981 Konami.

;Amidar is an abstract arcade game in which players must 'colour in' all of the rectangles on the screen. Each level has a number of patrolling enemies - or 'Amidars' - that must be avoided. Players are aided in their task with the inclusion of a JUMP button which
column2: when used
column3: causes all the on-screen enemies to jump; allowing the player time to escape from a close situation. There are only 3 'jumps' given per level
column4: however.

column1: On odd-numbered levels
column2: the player's character is a gorilla; on even-numbered levels
column3: it is a paint roller. The Amidar enemies are savages and pigs
column4: respectively.

column1: Filling the four corner boxes of the screen gives the player a short time in which to chase the Amidars and score extra points. In between levels
column2: there is a chance to earn 5
column3: 000 bonus points. Here
column4: a pig moves across the top of the screen. By pushing the jump button
column5: the pig traces a path across the boxes towards the bottom of the screen. If the savage or pig reaches a bunch of bananas
column6: a bonus is awarded."

133;andromed;andromed;Andromeda (c) 1979 IPM Corp.

;Exciting Space Game! Mysterious Enemies Attack The Earth! Players' Beam-Cannon can be moved from side to side by the lever. Beams to destroy 'ANDROMEDA-SHIPS' are fired by pressing the button. When all 'ANDRO-SHIPS' are destroyed, a new screen image of all ships will appear again. Bonus points shown at the bottom of the screen will be added to player's total points, as player resumes the game.
134;angelkds;angelkds;Angel Kids (c) 1988 Sega.

;A climbing game where players take turns controlling two kids holding a rope. Pull the two joysticks outwards and the rope gets taunt. When timed right this throws a third kid into balloons. Balloons are scrolled on screen, seven screens high. While the girl is in the air the screen goes split screen to cover the distance. You must push up to advance kids with the rope.
135;anteater;anteater;Anteater (c) 1982 Tago Electronics

;A maze game where you play an anteater that elongates his sticky tongue through maze-like anthills eating ants, other bugs and insects.
136;aodk;aodk;痛快GANGAN行進曲 (c) 1994 SNK Corp.
;(Tsuukai Gangan Koushinkyoku)
1-on-1 fighter featuring 8 selectable characters.
The game's major innovation is the ability to walk into the background
column2: in a similar manner to side-scrolling beat 'em ups such as ""Streets of Rage"" or ""Final Fight"" because of this
column3: unlike many other 2-D fighting games
column4: the game uses one action button to jump
column5: it also does not use the 'D' button
column6: (Which many of SNK's other fighters did)
column7: only 2 action buttons are used for attacking (punch and kick)
column8: instead grappling and grabbing opponents (Pressing the A & B buttons simultaneously) is the focus of the gameplay
column9: opponents can counter being grabbed
column10: as well as break free. Also featured is weapon play
column11: again similar to beat 'em ups
column12: weapons can be picked up and thrown
column13: or used in special & standard attacks. Weapons are thrown in by background crowd members who will step forward to toss them into the ring. Another (strange) innovation of the game is that characters start to sweat -graphically- after a while.

column1: Characters have unusually high health for the genre
column2: with multiple
column3: different coloured
column4: health bars in one bar similar to a method of health bars used for boss characters in games of the time
column5: in addition to this
column6: each character has a 'Crazy Meter' at the bottom of the screen
column7: which is built up as characters attack
column8: this gives the character a special
column9: often very bizarre
column10: attack that will kill the opponent outright
column11: known as the GanGan Attack in Japan
column12: and the Crazy Attack in the US.

column1: Battles are joined by irreverent
column2: sometimes humorous pre-fight banter from characters
column3: the dialog differs depending on whom each opponent is
column4: and a clashing of 2 small images of the characters eyes
column5: which clash in the center of the screen."

column1: 137;aof;aof;"龍虎の拳 (c) 1992 SNK Corp.
;(Ryuuko no Ken)

An early Neo-Geo martial arts fighting game with 2 selectable characters in 1-player mode and 8 selectable characters in 2-player mode which also features a long-nosed end boss. Progressive damage is shown on each fighter's face for a dramatic effect."
138;aof2;aof2;"龍虎の拳2 (c) 1994 SNK Corp.
;(Ryuuko no Ken 2)
12 selectable characters are available in this martial arts fighting game
column2: each showing progressive damage on their bodies during the fight."

column1: 139;aof3;aof3;"Art of Fighting 龍虎の拳 外伝 (c) 1996 SNK Corp.
;(Art of Fighting - Ryuuko no Ken Gaiden)

10 selectable characters battle each other in various locations in Mexico. Extremely beautiful and fluid animation courtesy of motion capture technology brings a whole new style of game-play to this popular fighting game."
140;apb;apb;"APB - All Points Bulletin (c) 1987 Atari Games Corporation.

;Players take on the role of policeman 'Officer Bob' as he takes to his patrol car and drives the streets in pursuit of lawbreakers. The object of the game is to meet (or preferably exceed) the daily quota of 'busts'
column2: as he tries to catch a variety of law-breakers.

column1: Along the way
column2: players must refuel their patrol car (by driving through filling stations) as well as meeting targets within a set time limit. Any accidental collisions or running over of pedestrians will result in the player earning 'de-merits'
column3: while a 'perfect day' will earn bonuses
column4: with further bonuses awarded for each arrest made that exceeds the daily quota. Picking up donuts extends the time limit for a day."

column1: 149;aponow;aponow;"Apocaljpse Now (c) 1982.

;The player pilots a rescue helicopter and must try to rescue numerous airmen who have parachuted into the sea below. The rescue chopper is under constant attack from enemy helicopters, while sharks swim in the ocean below and will kill any floating airmen they come across. Later levels also have enemy subs and ships all intent on foiling the rescue mission. Players must be careful to avoid the falling wreckage of any enemy helicopters they have just destroyed, and also need to be wary of hitting any parachuting airmen with their 'copter blades, as this will kill the airmen instantly.

157;arabiamj;arabianmj;Arabian Magic (c) 1992 Taito Corp.
;Arabian Magic is a scrolling beat-em-up for one to four players
column2: set in the mythical world of The Arabian Nights. A long time ago
column3: an evil wizard has taken over the peaceful kingdom of Shahariyard and used sorcery to transform its king into a Monkey. The player must defeat each of the game's seven Guardians to reclaim the 'Jewel of Seven Colours' and release the king from the evil hex.

column1: Each player can select from four distinctive characters: Prince Lassid
column2: Princess Lisa
column3: Sinbad or Afshael. Each character carries a primary weapon - Prince Lassid and Sinbad carry swords
column4: Princess Lisa a magical veil and Afshael a mace. In addition to the weapons
column5: players can also summon a magical attack in the form of a huge genie. The genie will only appear for a few seconds but during that time
column6: players have control over the genie and can steer him towards enemies.

column1: Arabian Magic has seven different stages with one of the powerful guardians awaiting the player at the end of each level. Each guardian
column2: once defeated
column3: will drop a jewel which forms a part of the Jewel of Seven Colours. Guardians
column4: once defeated
column5: will join the player and become a Genie. Each level is littered with vases and wooden chests which
column6: when broken
column7: reveal treasure items and power-ups.

column1: The game ends when the player has recovered the Jewel of Seven Colours
column2: saved the King (making him human in the process) and restored peace to Shahariyard."

column1: 159;arabian;arabian;"Arabian (c) 1983 Sun Electronics.
;You'll have 1001 hours of fun with the ARABIAN upright game! You are the adventurous Arabian prince
column2: and your goal is to rescue the princess from her palace. Use the joystick control and the KICK button to move through perilous passages. Sail the seas
column3: crawl in caves
column4: and fly magic carpets - you'll be challenged by 4 increasingly hard waves of play! Score points on the way for picking up the letters in A-R-A-B-I-A-N
column5: and get a bonus if you pick them up in order!

column1: Arabian is a 'video book' with a happy ending! The attract mode introduces the story
column2: and animated storybook 'pages' let you experience the Arabian Prince's adventures. Use the 8-position joystick to jump
column3: super-jump
column4: walk
column5: crawl
column6: or climb in all directions. Tap either KICK button (are you right- or left-handed?) to kick your enemies out of the way.

column1: The player controls a young Arabian Prince who must rescue his Princess from the castle tower where she is being held prisoner. Evil Genies in brass jugs
column2: swooping Rocs
column3: and purple ghostly creatures called Oscars will try to stop him along the way. The Prince scores points for kicking Oscars or Rocs
column4: picking up lettered jugs
column5: or spelling A-R-A-B-I-A-N. The Prince loses a life when he's hit by a smokeball
column6: falls off a ledge
column7: flying carpet or vine
column8: or gets caught (touched) by a Genie
column9: Oscar
column10: or Roc.

column1: The Prince must successfully complete 4 levels to rescue the Princess (4 levels or 'pages' equals 1 section). Each level is introduced with the turning of a page
column2: which shows a distant view of the upcoming playfield. Each playfield has 7 lettered jugs that must be picked up before the player can advance to the next level
column3: but he must avoid or KICK evil Genies
column4: Oscars
column5: and Rocs that will try to stop him.

column1: Page 1. Page l turns
column2: revealing a ship. The Prince must work his way to the crow's nest at the top of the mast before the vessel reaches the shore. As he climbs up the rigging
column3: Rocs and Oscars dive at him in an attempt to knock him down. The Prince must KICK them out of the way to survive. While contending with these rascals
column4: he must also try to collect all the jugs with letters on them. Beware! The jugs hold devilish Genies which can appear at any time and throw smokeballs at the Prince. Once a Genie has materialized
column5: the Prince's kicking power cannot be used against him and he is unable to collect the jug so he should avoid the Genie. However
column6: the Prince may collect the jug while the Genie is in smoke. When the Arabian has collected all the jugs and reaches the top of the ship
column7: Page 2 introduces the second level of the story.

column1: Page 2. Now the Arabian has arrived on shore. To reach the Princess he must complete a cave maze under the cliff. Low-hanging rocks and climbing vines force him to crawl and climb. The Prince must still dodge Rocs
column2: Oscars
column3: and the Genie's smokeballs. And he must still collect the brass jugs. When he reaches the top of the cave
column4: he must try to collect the letter N jug.

column1: Page 3. Now the Arabian Prince must scale the walls of the castle. As flying carpets whiz by
column2: the Arabian must jump from one to the next
column3: taking care he isn't knocked off his present perch by another carpet flying too closely He can duck to avoid them
column4: but his timing has to be precise or he will take a tumble down to the ground. He must still dodge Rocs
column5: Oscars
column6: and the Genie's smokeballs. The player must beware - sometimes a pair will merge into one super Roc bird or super Oscar!

column1: Page 4. The Prince has at last entered the castle. The Princess beckons him from high in the tower. To reach her
column2: he must ride atop some flying carpets and pull himself up ropes - all the while collecting the brass jugs and kicking meddlesome Rocs and Oscars. When he reaches his loving and grateful Princess
column3: the 2 fly happily into the sunset on a magic carpet.

column1: Once the player has taken the Arabian through a section (all 4 levels)
column2: the next section begins. But the action gets faster
column3: the Genies are angrier and fling more smokeballs
column4: and there are more intelligent and challenging Rocs and Oscars. Even the brass jugs are rearranged so that it becomes more difficult for the player to spell A-R-A-B-I-A-N in order."

165;archriv2;archrivla;Arch Rivals (c) 1989 Bally Midway Mfg. Co.
;Arch Rivals is a hilarious basketball game featuring customizing team names and colors. A full game consists of four quarters
column2: with four minutes each. Each team has two players
column3: and the objective of the game is to outscore the opponent until the final buzzer sounds.

column1: If the game results in a tie after four quarters
column2: a sudden death overtime period is added
column3: in which case the next basket to go in will win the game for the team who scored it. The overtime period is one minute long. A player can call for his teammate to pass him the ball or to shoot it.

column1: There are eight characters that the player can play as
column2: each with a unique characteristic. They are :

column1: * Blade : A crowd pleaser.
* Hammer : Rebound king.
* Lewis : Top shooter.
* Mohawk : Tough & mean.
* Moose : A real champ.
* Reggie : All-American.
* Tyrone : Defensive giant.
* Vinnie : A great player."

170;argus;argus;Argus (c) 1986 Jaleco.
;While it borrows heavily from the game which established the vertically scrolling shooter
column2: ""Xevious""
column3: Argus adds its own unique twists. The player's ship is always presented in the center of the screen
column4: and as the player moves left and right
column5: the ground actually scrolls in the opposite direction. The player can continue scrolling all the way in one direction and end up back where he or she started.

column1: Other new concepts include walls of mazes that float in the air which may be optionally traveled through. Certain ground targets provide power-ups or special weapons
column2: but they must be bombed 3 times in order to earn them. A boss sequence occurs at the end of each stage. The boss has one infrequently exposed weak spot that only takes one bomb to destroy
column3: but the boss will leave after an allotted time if the player does not succeed. There is a landing sequence after the boss fight that must be successfully maneuvered for bonus points. And finally
column4: the ship receives a new weapons at each stage (5 distinct combinations which cycle).

column1: The arcade game features 16 levels
column2: the last four of which repeat indefinitely."

column1: 171;arkangc;arkangc;"Arkanoid (c) 1986 Game Corporation.

;Game Corporation's Bootleg version of Taito's original.
172;arkanoid;arkanoid;Arkanoid (c) 1986 Taito Corp.
;After a sudden alien assault
column2: the Arkanoid spaceship has been destroyed and the only survivor
column3: the small 'Vaus' space vessel
column4: has been mysteriously trapped in another dimension by an unknown enemy. The player is charged with helping the 'Vaus' overcome the security systems
column5: as well as the many enemies that guard them
column6: before finally finding and destroying 'DOH'
column7: the alien responsible for the attack.

column1: Arkanoid is an update of the early ball and paddle video games - and specifically of Atari's 1978 classic
column2: ""Super Breakout"" - in which the player takes control of a paddle at the bottom of the screen and must use it to deflect a ball into rows of bricks at the top of the screen
column3: thus destroying them and
column4: eventually
column5: clearing the screen to progress to the next level.

column1: As well as impressive and colourful graphics
column2: Arkanoid introduced a number of new elements to the classic bat 'n' ball gameplay. Certain bricks
column3: when destroyed
column4: would release a power-up - in the form of a falling capsule. the player had to catch the capsule to retrieve the power-up. Among the many enhancements the power-ups provided were an increased 'bat' size
column5: multiple balls
column6: 'sticky' ball (which would stick to the bat and could be released when the player chose) and even a laser
column7: which allowed the player to shoot the bricks."

180;arknid2j;arknoid2j;Arkanoid - Revenge of DOH (c) 1987 Taito Corp.

;The mysterious enemy known as 'DOH' has returned to seek vengeance on the 'Vaus' space vessel. The player must once again take control of the Vaus and overcome many challenges in order to destroy DOH once and for all.
An update of the popular 1986 original
column2: Revenge of DOH sees the player battle through 34 rounds
column3: taken from a grand total of 64. Revenge of DOH differs from its predecessor with the introduction of ""Warp Gates"". Upon completion of a round or when the Break ('B') pill is caught
column4: two gates appear at the bottom left and bottom right of the play area respectively
column5: the Vaus is then taken through one of the gates - the choice will affect which version of the next round is provided.

column1: The game also features two new features for bricks. Notched silver bricks
column2: like normal silver bricks
column3: take several hits to destroy. However
column4: after a short period of time after destruction
column5: they regenerate at full strength. Fortunately
column6: clearing a level does not require that any notched bricks to be destroyed. Also
column7: some bricks move from side to side as long as their left and/or right sides are not obstructed by other bricks.

column1: The game features a mini-boss in the form of a giant brain
column2: which will help you practice for DOH. You must aim for the brain's mouth to defeat it."

column1: 181;arknid2u;arknoid2u;"Arkanoid - Revenge of DOH (c) 1987 Taito America Corp.
;North American version. For more information about the game itself

column1: - TRIVIA -
Licensed to Romstar for US distribution
column2: Arkanoid - Revenge of DOH was released in June 1987.

column1: This US version is different :
* Round 1 (the first 'Iomanoid') features a completely different layout of blocks not included in the World or Japanese versions that features an entire line of notched bricks
column2: with all colored bricks above it moving from side to side.

column1: * If you use the continue feature after Game Over
column2: your score is not reset to zero
column3: and you don't have to start the current level over on a continue.

column1: * The boss battles ('Vetranoid') are played in the attract mode.
* The layouts of Rounds 3-L and 20-R have both switched places with that of Round 17 (the first 'Vetranoid' - the mini-boss)
column2: making it possible to battle the mini-boss twice or not at all. Round 17-L is the same as non-US Round 3-L and is identified ingame as 'Xeufnoid' while Round 17-R is the same as non-US Round 20-R and is identified as 'Gakanoid'.

column1: 197;armwrest;armwrest;"Arm Wrestling (c) 1985 Nintendo.
;In Arm Wrestling
column2: the player takes on a number of different
column3: distinctly cartoon-like opponents in a series of arm wrestling matches. The game's graphical styling is very similar to Nintendo's classic ""Punch-Out!!"" series. Gameplay requires that the player initially pushes the joystick to the left
column4: but whenever the computer opponent starts to act
column5: the player must push the joystick to the right to counter-attack
column6: and press the button to increase power. If the counterattack is unsuccessful
column7: moving the joystick back and forth several times will prevent the player from being pinned. The player's opponent must be pinned before the counter reaches one minute
column8: or the match will be lost."

201;aso;aso;ASO - Armored Scrum Object (c) 1985 SNK.

;ASO is a one-player scrolling shooter game, similar to Xevious in its segregation of air-to-air and air-to-ground weapons. Missiles are used to destroy ground enemies, while laser-like weapons are used for aerial opponents. Throughout each of the levels, the player must fight off waves of enemies that threaten several space stations and a boss must be defeated at the end of each. Like most early games in this genre, when the player dies, all weapons are lost and the player is moved to a point slightly before the point of death. The player's craft can also be upgraded to have more powerful weapons by picking up various power-ups throughout the level.
202;assault;assault;Assault (c) 1988 Namco
column2: Limited.

column1: ;Your mission is to reclaim your homeland by destroying the enemy forces that have taken over. You have an Assault tank
column2: the supreme mobile weapon. Your tank has artillery guns and grenades
column3: can perform Rapid Rolls to dodge enemy shots
column4: and uses Power Wheelies to launch grenades.

column1: Your controls are two 4-position joysticks with triggers. These controls make Assault like no other tank game. You have a quick
column2: highly responsive vehicle with fast movement in all directions. To avoid enemy shots
column3: Rapid Roll your tank left or right by moving both joysticks to the same side. To launch grenades
column4: put the tank in the Power Wheelie position by moving both joysticks to the outside
column5: then pressing either trigger. Your grenades are triple the fire power of your tank's standard shots.

column1: Your tank is always in the center of the screen no matter what direction you are going. With Assault's 360-degree scrolling playfield
column2: the world rotates around you as you move. An arrow always points you towards the exit to the next level.

column1: The lift zone gives you an advantage over the invaders and a spectacular view of the playfield. Each lift zone is a five-sided platform on the playfield that flashes red when you can use it. When you drive onto the lift zone
column2: your tank jets straight up to get a bird's eye view of the surrounding terrain and enemy lines. From this overhead position
column3: you can reconnoiter enemy forces and bomb enemy outposts.

column1: Fight your way through 11 different levels to seek out and destroy the invader’s headquarters. To succeed
column2: you must :

column1: * Dodge enemy gunfire with the Rapid Roll maneuver.
* Assault enemy lines with long-range powerful grenades launched from Power Wheelies.
* Destroy all enemy tanks you encounter to prevent rear attacks.
* Bomb enemy outposts and reconnoiter enemy emplacements using the lift zones.
* Protect yourself against enemy artillery using buildings and trees.
* Blow up the large cannons on each level while you avoid enemy attacks.
* Follow the arrow to find the exit to the next level. Before you can exit
column2: you must destroy the large cannons defending the enemy strongholds."

column1: ;Asteroids Deluxe is a 1 or 2-player game with an X-Y or vector-generator monitor. The game depicts a third-person view of a player's spaceship battling to destroy asteroids
column2: flying saucers and enemy ships or 'death stars' (shaped like clusters of triangles). When hit
column3: the asteroids and death stars will break into progressively smaller pieces.

column1: Players can put up an octagon-shaped 'shield' to temporarily protect their spaceship. However
column2: this shield wears out with use.

column1: Large asteroids appear and drift in from the outer edges of the display. By pressing the ROTATE LEFT and ROTATE RIGHT pushbuttons on the control panel
column2: the player may aim a spaceship toward any of the asteroids. The player uses the FIRE pushbutton to shoot at the asteroids and other objects.

column1: When shot
column2: each large asteroid divides into two medium-sized asteroids
column3: and the game adds 20 points to the player's score. Medium-sized asteroids
column4: when shot
column5: divide into two small-sized asteroids
column6: and the game awards 50 points to the player. When shot the smallest asteroid disappears and the game adds 100 points to the player's score.

column1: In addition to asteroids
column2: the players can score points for shooting the various enemy ships. When hit
column3: the large ships ('death stars' shaped like hexagons) score 50 points and break into three diamond shapes. The medium-sized enemy or diamond
column4: when hit
column5: grants the player 100 points and breaks into two small triangular pieces. These small pieces disappear when the player hits them
column6: and the score increases by 200 points.

column1: At any time during game play
column2: a flying saucer may appear from either side of the display. The game awards players 200 points for shooting a large saucer and 1
column3: 000 points for a small saucer (the latter is a smaller target for players
column4: though not any faster moving than the large one. It also shoots more accurately).

column1: The player's objective in the game is to shoot and destroy as many asteroids
column2: saucers
column3: and enemy ships as possible before all his or her spaceships are destroyed. A ship is destroyed if an asteroid
column4: saucer or enemy ship smashes into it
column5: or if a flying saucer shoots it. To prevent losing a ship
column6: the player may press the THRUST pushbutton to move out of the path of an oncoming object.

column1: As an emergency maneuver
column2: a player can press the Shields button. An octagon will then appear around the player's ship as protection from all enemies. For challenge the shield power lasts only about 10 seconds
column3: but the power is renewed with each ship. The amount of shielding power available is shown by the brightness of the octagon (dim means almost exhausted power).

column1: - CAST OF CHARACTERS -
Spaceship - This is you
column2: the player. You can rotate 360 degrees
column3: fire bullets
column4: thrust forward in any direction
column5: and use the shields if you feel you are in danger.

column1: Large Asteroid - These are the large rocks that fill the screen at the beginning of each stage. Hitting one with a bullet will break it apart in to two Medium Asteroids.
Medium Asteroid - Slightly smaller than Large Asteroids
column2: but faster moving
column3: shooting one of these will result in two Small Asteroids.

column1: Small Asteroid - These are the smallest and fastest rocks on the screen. If a bullet hits one of these
column2: it will vaporize.

column1: Hexagon - This addition to Asteroids appears when the stage is nearly free of rocks. It floats in one direction until it is shot.
Diamond - When the Hexagon is shot it breaks up in to three separate diamonds. These begin to track and slowly follow you.
Triangle - When a Diamond is shot it breaks up in to two separate triangles. These will move very quickly and zero in on you if you don't destroy them fast enough.
Large Saucer - Large flying saucers appear on the screen from time to time
column2: randomly firing shots around the screen. Approximately one out of every four shots will be aimed directly at your ship. They will also target Hexagons if any are on the screen at the same time.

column1: Small Saucer - The small saucers are deadlier than the large variety. They are much more precise with their shots
column2: and are more likely to kill you. Eliminate them quickly or get out of their range."

column1: 207;asterix;asterix;"Asterix (c) 1992 Konami Company
column2: Limited.

column1:
;Asterix is a 1- or 2-player horizontal-scrolling beat'em up based on the French comic series, 'Asterix & Obelix'. The player fights as either Asterix the Gaul or his best friend, Obelix, as they take on the 'might' of the oppressive Roman Empire. Asterix includes a variety of humorous fighting moves, which are demonstrated in the game's attract mode. The artwork and feel of Asterix remains true to its French source material, and the game's many humorous touches (such as the way defeated Legionnaires crawl away) will be instantly familiar to fans of the comic-book and cartoon series. Bonus levels - such as the chariot race that awaits at the end of the first level - introduce different game-play elements to provide a break from the fighting.
208;asterock;asterock;Asterock (c) 1979 Sidam.
;An Italian bootleg of Atari's Asteroids.
- TRIVIA -
The official Italian distributor of Atari Arcades
column2: f.lli Bertolino s.r.l.
column3: moved a legal attack against Sidam
column4: and won. Many code fragments stored in ROM of Asterock
column5: Missile Storm and other Sidam clones was identical to those contained in Atari originals' memory. Sidam changed the coin accept and sound routines
column6: to get rid of copyrighted Atari POKEY chip. Sidam called this a 'coincidence'; moreover
column7: the Italian legislation did not mention directly the computer programs as copyrighted materials like songs and books. However
column8: the court sentenced about the 'intellectual property' of programs - this was an important sentence in Italian legal history - and Sidam was convicted of copyright violation."

column1: 209;asteroi1;asteroid1;"Asteroids (c) 1981 Atari
column2: Incorporated.

column1: ;The object of the game is to destroy as many asteroid boulders as possible and keep your ship in space as long as possible. Use your Joystick Controller to maneuver your ship through space and press the red controller(fire) button to shoot photon torpedoes at the asteroid boulders. When an asteroid is hit
column2: it may just break up into smaller boulders
column3: or it may be completely pulverized. In some game variations you'll face additional space hazards such as satellites and UFOs (Unidentified Flying Objects); both of which may be firing torpedoes at you.

column1: Asteroids includes 66 game variations for 1 or 2 players."
210;asteroib;asteroidb;"Asteroids (c) 1979 Atari
column2: Incorporated.

column1: ;Asteroids is a legendary
column2: genre defining game - in an era replete with genre-defining classics - in which a single player takes control of a spaceship trapped in the middle of an asteroid belt. A number of large
column3: slow-moving asteroids drift randomly around the play area and must be shot by the player. When shot
column4: the asteroids will break into a number of smaller pieces which must also be shot until eventually
column5: all of the asteroids and fragments will be destroyed and the next wave begins.

column1: Asteroids introduced real-world physics to video games for the first time
column2: with speed and inertia all adding to the player's problems. As well as the inertia of the player's ship - forcing the player to allow for the ship slowing down and speeding up whenever the Thrust button was utilized - shot asteroids would often send fragments flying in seemingly random directions
column3: and at varying and unpredictable speeds.

column1: As well as the ever-present asteroids
column2: flying saucers also make a regular appearance. These move horizontally and diagonally around the screen
column3: firing at the player's ship
column4: and must be quickly destroyed. They are destroyed when hit by the player's shot
column5: when hit by a saucer's shot or when they collide with an asteroid.

column1: - CAST OF CHARACTERS -
Spaceship - This is you
column2: the player. You can rotate 360 degrees
column3: fire bullets
column4: thrust forward in any direction
column5: and hyperspace to safety if you feel you are in danger.

column1: Large Asteroid - These are the large rocks that fill the screen at the beginning of each stage. Hitting one with a bullet will break it apart into two Medium Asteroids.
Medium Asteroid - Slightly smaller than Large Asteroids
column2: but faster moving. Shooting one of these will result in two Small Asteroids.

column1: Small Asteroid - These are the smallest and fastest rocks on the screen. If a bullet hits one of these
column2: it will vaporize.

column1: Large Saucer - Large flying saucers appear on the screen from time to time
column2: randomly firing shots around the screen. They pose a minor threat.

column1: Small Saucer - The smaller flying saucers are deadlier than the large variety. They are much more precise with their shots
column2: and are more likely to kill you. Eliminate them quickly or get out of their range."

213;astorm;astormj;"Alien Storm (c) 1990 Sega.

;Alien Storm is a side-scrolling beat-em-up in which up to 3 players take on the role of one of 3 futuristic warriors. The game heroes are charged with destroying the hoards of repulsive aliens who are invading the Earth. Many of the aliens are disguised as a variety of everyday street objects; such as telephone booths
column2: oil cans
column3: trash cans and mailboxes. The aliens reveal their true forms as the warriors approach.

column1: Each of the 3 heroes carries their own individual weapon; Gordon has his plasma gun
column2: Karla has a flamethrower and Scooter has an electric whip. At the end of each level
column3: the warriors will enter a building and the shoot-em-up action will switch to a first-person perspective."

column1: 216;astrass;astrass;;
217;astrob;astrob;"Astro Blaster (c) 1981 Sega.

;Astro Blaster is a 1- or 2-player game in which players must advance through squadrons of alien ships in an attempt to dock with the mother ship. Players move their ship left or right and shoot at attacking squadrons. A special time warp allows the player to slow down the alien space ships and their laser fire
column2: while maintaining his own ship and laser fire at normal speed.

column1: As players go through the game play
column2: each step is directed by the voice of mission control. Mission control keeps players informed of fuel status
column3: provides a countdown on warp
column4: keeps track of the number of ships remaining
column5: and monitors the player's laser temperature.

column1: As players enter each new sector they encounter a different number of alien squadrons. Players must destroy all ships in each squadron to pass through the sector. One squadron of rockets is extremely difficult to destroy
column2: but players can pass through this squadron by hitting a few enemy ships. Once a player has destroyed all the squadrons in that sector
column3: he enters an asteroid belt. He must maneuver and shoot his way through the asteroids to reach the mother ship. If fuel is critically low when the player enters the asteroid belt
column4: he can receive extra fuel by shooting the red fireballs interspersed among the asteroids. After passing through the asteroid belt
column5: the player's ship docks with the mother ship and refuels.

column1: There are 29 different alien squadrons players encounter as they move through the different sectors. Every new sector increases in difficulty with different numbers of squadrons in each sector. Each alien ship has its own individualized sounds
column2: movements and firing capability.

column1: During their game
column2: players must keep track of fuel consumption. As the player's ship moves through the sector
column3: it consumes fuel. The player must ensure he has enough fuel to advance through the sector and dock with the mother ship. Extra fuel can only be obtained by shooting red fireballs or docking with the mother ship. The screen also displays the laser temperature. As players fire
column4: the laser temperature rises. When they cease firing it cools down. If the laser overheats
column5: players lose their laser fire until it cools down.

column1: By depressing the warp button
column2: players slow down the enemy ships and their laser fire while maintaining his own at normal speed. Players receive one warp per ships and are awarded one warp upon docking
column3: if he has used his warp in the previous sector.

column1: Each alien ship destroyed carries a different point value. Players also receive double points for destroying an alien ship when their fuel is in the red. To add further excitement
column2: there are 25 tasks that a player performs during the course of the game and receives a secret bonus. Players do not know what these tasks are
column3: but a good player will keep track. The 25 tasks are consistent throughout the game. Players also receive a bonus for any fuel they have left when they dock with the mother ship.

column1: With a two-player game
column2: players alternate at the conclusion of each sector
column3: not after each ship.  Players receive 3 to 5 ships
column4: which is operator adjustable. The game is over when a player runs out of fuel
column5: loses all his ships
column6: or crashes while attempting to dock with the mother ship. The top three scores are displayed and the game ranks players from 1 to 99.

column1: PLAY INSTRUCTIONS :
1. Shoot enemy space ships for points.
2. Shoot fire balls for extra fuel.
3. Use warp to slow down enemy ships and bombs (only once per sector or ship).
4. Discover how to earn secret bonuses for extra points.
5. Dock with mother ship to refuel after each sector.
6. Game over when you run out of ships or fuel.
7. Laser will not fire while overheated."

column1: PLAY INSTRUCTIONS :
1. Shoot enemy space ships for points.
2. Shoot fire balls for extra fuel.
3. Use warp to slow down enemy ships and bombs (only once per sector or ship).
4. Discover how to earn secret bonuses for extra points.
5. Dock with mother ship to refuel after each sector.
6. Game over when you run out of ships or fuel.
7. Laser will not fire while overheated."
219;astrob2;astrob2;"Astro Blaster (c) 1981 Sega.

;Astro Blaster is a 1- or 2-player game in which players must advance through squadrons of alien ships in an attempt to dock with the mother ship. Players move their ship left or right and shoot at attacking squadrons. A special time warp allows the player to slow down the alien space ships and their laser fire
column2: while maintaining his own ship and laser fire at normal speed.

column1: As players go through the game play
column2: each step is directed by the voice of mission control. Mission control keeps players informed of fuel status
column3: provides a countdown on warp
column4: keeps track of the number of ships remaining
column5: and monitors the player's laser temperature.

column1: As players enter each new sector they encounter a different number of alien squadrons. Players must destroy all ships in each squadron to pass through the sector. One squadron of rockets is extremely difficult to destroy
column2: but players can pass through this squadron by hitting a few enemy ships. Once a player has destroyed all the squadrons in that sector
column3: he enters an asteroid belt. He must maneuver and shoot his way through the asteroids to reach the mother ship. If fuel is critically low when the player enters the asteroid belt
column4: he can receive extra fuel by shooting the red fireballs interspersed among the asteroids. After passing through the asteroid belt
column5: the player's ship docks with the mother ship and refuels.

column1: There are 29 different alien squadrons players encounter as they move through the different sectors. Every new sector increases in difficulty with different numbers of squadrons in each sector. Each alien ship has its own individualized sounds
column2: movements and firing capability.

column1: During their game
column2: players must keep track of fuel consumption. As the player's ship moves through the sector
column3: it consumes fuel. The player must ensure he has enough fuel to advance through the sector and dock with the mother ship. Extra fuel can only be obtained by shooting red fireballs or docking with the mother ship. The screen also displays the laser temperature. As players fire
column4: the laser temperature rises. When they cease firing it cools down. If the laser overheats
column5: players lose their laser fire until it cools down.

column1: By depressing the warp button
column2: players slow down the enemy ships and their laser fire while maintaining his own at normal speed. Players receive one warp per ships and are awarded one warp upon docking
column3: if he has used his warp in the previous sector.

column1: Each alien ship destroyed carries a different point value. Players also receive double points for destroying an alien ship when their fuel is in the red. To add further excitement
column2: there are 25 tasks that a player performs during the course of the game and receives a secret bonus. Players do not know what these tasks are
column3: but a good player will keep track. The 25 tasks are consistent throughout the game. Players also receive a bonus for any fuel they have left when they dock with the mother ship.

column1: With a two-player game
column2: players alternate at the conclusion of each sector
column3: not after each ship.  Players receive 3 to 5 ships
column4: which is operator adjustable. The game is over when a player runs out of fuel
column5: loses all his ships
column6: or crashes while attempting to dock with the mother ship. The top three scores are displayed and the game ranks players from 1 to 99.

220;astrof;astrof;"Astro Fighter (c) 1979 Data East Corporation.

;Astro Fighter is a 2-D, space shooter style game. Your job is to protect the various sectors from the hoards of invading aliens. You will have to defeat four waves of alien spaceships in order to dock with the 'GS' ship and refuel. In addition to battling the alien spaceships, you will also have to dodge bombs that seem to come out of nowhere. Armed only with your fighter and a lot of spirit, you must ensure that you clear the screen of invaders before they pass you by. All in all, another walk in the park.

224;astrxeaa;asterixeaa;Asterix (c) 1992 Konami Company
column2: Limited.

column1:
;Asterix is a 1- or 2-player horizontal-scrolling beat'em up based on the French comic series, 'Asterix & Obelix'. The player fights as either Asterix the Gaul or his best friend, Obelix, as they take on the 'might' of the oppressive Roman Empire. Asterix includes a variety of humorous fighting moves, which are demonstrated in the game's attract mode. The artwork and feel of Asterix remains true to its French source material, and the game's many humorous touches (such as the way defeated Legionnaires crawl away) will be instantly familiar to fans of the comic-book and cartoon series. Bonus levels - such as the chariot race that awaits at the end of the first level - introduce different game-play elements to provide a break from the fighting.

233;ataxx;ataxx;Ataxx (c) 1991 Leland.

;The object of the game is to fill the 7x7 tiled board with your colored globs. This is done by moving your glob adjacent to your opponent's glob and turning it to your color. 2 types of moves can be made during the game : first
column2: placing a glob adjacent to one of your own duplicates it; or second
column3: a glob may jump two spaces
column4: but it will not be duplicated. The number and arrangement of obstacles in the playfield changes between each round
column5: so strategies must be changed in order to accommodate these barriers.

column1: Eventually
column2: all the empty spaces on the board are filled
column3: and the player with the most colored globs wins. In single-player mode if the human player wins
column4: they must face a more difficult computer opponent in the next round. The game is over when time runs out
column5: regardless if you're winning or not. You can 'buy-in' at any time."

;This is a pretty hard platform game where you take the role of Athena fighting your way through different worlds inhabited by all kinds of different enemies
column2: ranging from moving pears to huge golems and flying devils.

column1: You start out with nothing more than your feet to fight with and no more protection than Athena's underwear (she actually loses her dress in the intro to the first world) but can collect a huge number of different weapons and armour
column2: as well as a great number of power-ups ranging from the usual more-power-for weapon or armour
column3: through boots that allow her to jump higher and wings for flying
column4: to one where Athena becomes a semi-god and actually growths to twice her usual size and gets a huge burning sword and full armour.

column1: The worlds are filled with stone blocks that can be smashed when searching for secrets and items
column2: as well as several levels connected by ladders or other means of transportation.

column1: Athena is a great game
column2: and will give even the most hardened platform-player a real challenge
column3: for it is NOT an easy game
column4: even with the dip switches in 'Easy' mode."

;Your mission : Finish the six tables at all costs by eliminating a maximum of opponents. To Do this you possess a multi-directional laser (ultra-rapid firing) and terrifying torpedo-bombs. Through all 6 tables
column2: build up your bonus by blowing-up the fuel tanks.

column1: Table 1: Avoid and destroy the floating mines.
Table 2: The deadly exploding sharks appear as well as the destroyers (avoid their bombs!). Obliterate them with your laser.
Table 3: You penetrate into an abyssal cavern where redoubtable octopuses lie in wait. The destroyers can only drop their bombs through the thin sides of the cavern.
Table 4: A complex of towers replaces the lower part of the cavern. As well as the destroyers and octopus
column2: the mines reappear in large numbers.

column1: Table 5: Accelerated version of Table 4.
Table 6: You return to Table 1 in an accelerated version but you must face up to all your opponents."

;Avalanche is a 2-D game of skill. You control a multi-storied platform with a spinner-knob. Your goal is to prevent the falling rocks from ever reaching the ground. There are six rows of rocks to deal with. You start with a 6-storied platform and you lose one platform per row of rocks cleared. You score points for those rocks you prevent from reaching the ground. Of course, the farther the row of rocks, the smaller and faster they become. Your ultimate goal is to get enough points so that you can continue your game should you lose your first one. Get your hard hat out and prepare to catch some rogue rocks.

column1: 261;aztarac;aztarac;"Aztarac (c) 1983 Centuri.

;The actual game has you piloting a little space tank. The tank and its turret are controlled independently, which allows you to move in one direction while shooting in another. Your mission is to guard various space outposts from hordes of incoming enemy ships. Each level will have several outposts all clustered together in the center. If an enemy ship touches an outpost, then the outpost is destroyed. You can activate a long range scanner by using your second button. This allows you to locate enemies before they get close, that way you can fly off and get them before they even have a shot at the outposts.
