605;cchasm;cchasm;Cosmic Chasm (c) 1983 Cinematronics.
;Strap on your vector spacesuit
column2: and hop into your vector spaceship. It is a good old ship
column3: and it has seen a lot of action. From navigating the asteroid belt and blasting aliens around the sun
column4: to attacking evil space cannons
column5: your little vector ship has done it all
column6: and this time it has been upgraded with twin blasters. You see the ship in Cosmic Chasm seems to be the same spaceship that is in every vector game. You control it using rotation buttons and a thruster button
column7: with a laser and a shield button thrown in for good measure
column8: just like almost every other vector game around.

column1: Now here is what you have to do. You guide your ship through a space fortress room by room. Each room contains a center section that slowly grows and will eventually trap you if you are not fast enough. You can shoot the center section to slow its growth. Each room also contains several exits. One of the exits will always spew forth a bunch of bad guys
column2: shoot them
column3: then exit to go to a different room. Between rooms you get to see an excellent tunnel animation. The idea is to make your way to the center of the fortress
column4: blast the power core
column5: and then leave. There is a map at the top of the screen to keep you from getting lost. This is a pretty decent game. It has a lot more to offer than the one screen of bad guys that most vector games have."

column1: 607;cclimber;cclimber;"Crazy Climber (c) 1980 Nichibutsu [Nihon Bussan Company
column2: Limited.].

column1:
;Crazy Climber is a 2-D, strategy style game. The game is strategic in the fact that you must plan your moves as you climb up the building and anticipate the hazards that await you. You start out the game at the bottom of a building to be scaled. As you climb up the building, you will be assailed by bald people throwing flowerpots, signs with loose electrical wires, very large apes, falling signs, trash and barbells, and a bird that likes to drop bad things on your character. Your goal is to make it to the top of the building and catch the helicopter, which will transport you to the next building to be scaled. Of course, you will be rewarded for quickly making it up the building by getting a bonus (that is as long as you can catch the helicopter). The things one does for publicity.
608;cclimbr2;cclimbr2;Crazy Climber 2 (c) 1988 Nichibutsu.

;Using 2 joysticks, the player climbs up the face of high-rise buildings, avoiding closing windows, falling objects, cranes, birds, laundry, gorillas, etc. Reach the top of the building and catch a ride on a helicopter over to next building.
609;cclimbrj;cclimberj;Crazy Climber (c) 1980 Nichibutsu [Nihon Bussan Company
column2: Limited.].

610;cdiscon1;cdiscon1;Disco No 1 (c) 1982 Data East.

;You play a 90 pound weakling kid in a roller rink who has to skate around the bad guys in order to win the love admiration of cute chicks. Earn points by completely encircling one or more tough guys and picking up various bonus items that float across the rink. Interesting gameplay mechanics, nice music and decent graphics for 1982.
611;centipb2;centipdb;Centipede (c) 1980 Atari.

;Centipede is a 1- or 2-player game with a color raster-scan monitor. The fast-moving game action takes place on a magical mushroom patch and includes a variety of insects that drop down from the top of the screen or enter from the sides of the screen
column2: most of them to attack the Bug Blaster
column3: controlled by the player. The Bug Blaster is represented on the screen by a somewhat humanoid head. The object of the game is to shoot at and destroy as many of these insects and mushrooms as possible for a high point score
column4: before the player's lives are all used up.

column1: Player control consists of a Mini-Trak Ball control and a FIRE button. The Bug Blaster is moved by rotating the Midi-Trak Ball control. The Bug Blaster can be moved in all directions
column2: but only within the bottom 5th of the screen. However
column3: the Bug Blaster must move around mushrooms
column4: since these are fixed
column5: not 'transparent'
column6: objects. Pressing the button causes the Bug Blaster to fire individual shots upward
column7: either singly or in rapid-fire mode
column8: if held down constantly. (Only one shot appears on the screen at a time.)

column1: Game play begins with a playfield of randomly-placed mushrooms in a mushroom patch. A Centipede starts snaking its way across from the center top of the screen. The Centipede changes direction when it runs into a mushroom or either the left or right boundaries of the playfield.
When a segment of the Centipede is shot
column2: it is destroyed and a mushroom appears where that segment was shot. When a body segment is shot
column3: the Centipede breaks into two smaller Centipedes
column4: each with its own head. When a Centipede reaches the bottom of the screen
column5: it starts back up
column6: but remains within the area of the Bug Blaster (the bottom fifth of the screen).

column1: If a Centipede reaches the bottom of the screen without being shot
column2: it releases its tail. This tail changes into a new head. Also to provide the player a challenge
column3: if a Centipede is still alive when it reaches the bottom
column4: new heads will enter the screen almost at the bottom of the sides. More of these heads will appear as time progresses.

column1: A round of play ends when all Centipede segments are destroyed.

The randomly moving Spiders also appear in the first wave. The Spiders can destroy any mushrooms they move over. This eliminates many mushroom targets for a player. Depending on a special option switch setting
column2: the Spider moves slowly until the player reaches a specific score
column3: and then it speeds up. If the Bug Blaster and a Spider collide
column4: both are destroyed.

column1: Whan a Centipede with fewer than eleven body segments appears
column2: a bombardment of Fleas starts. As a Flea descends
column3: it leaves a trail of new mushrooms behind it. Fleas appear when a certain number of mushrooms remains at the bottom of the screen. This number increases as the game progresses
column4: meaning Fleas appear more often later on in the game. The Bug Blaster must hit a Flea twice to destroy it; the first shot just speeds it up.

column1: When a Centipede with fewer than ten body segments appears
column2: a Scorpion enters from either side
column3: moving at a relatively slow speed. As the player earns more points
column4: the Scorpion's speed increases.

column1: As the Scorpion travels across the screen
column2: it 'poisons' the mushrooms that it moves over and changes their colors. These mushrooms cause any Centipedes that would collide with them to head straight towards the bottom of the screen
column3: rather than continue snaking around. The Bug Blaster can stop a poisoned Centipede by shooting its head.

column1: In addition
column2: these poisoned mushrooms as well as any partially shot mushrooms add 5 points to the player's score as the mushroom patch resets after a player loses a life.

column1: If the players are very skilled and earn at least 60
column2: 000 points
column3: two things happen to increase player challenge : the Fleas descend at a faster speed and the Spiders restrict their movement to a smaller area at the bottom of the screen.

column1: An important new feature of this game is the operator option for easy/hard game difficulty. At Easy
column2: the Spider moves slowly up to a 5
column3: 000-point score
column4: and then bounces at a higher speed. It also changes direction less often throughout the game than at the hard setting. At Hard
column5: the Spider moves slowly only for the first 1
column6: 000 points
column7: and then speeds up. It also changes direction more often throughout the game. In either setting
column8: the Spider always moves at a 45-degree angle or straight up and down."

620;cgangpzj;cgangpzlj;Cosmo Gang - The Puzzle (c) 1992 Namco.

;In this puzzle game, different combinations of blocks mixed with Cosmo Gang members fall from the top to the bottom of the screen. The object is to stack up the blocks to form a complete row causing that row to disappear. To accomplish this a ball must be used to eliminate the Cosmo Gang that stacked up to block your progress.
621;cgangpzl;cgangpzl;Cosmo Gang - The Puzzle (c) 1992 Namco.

column1: 624;chaknpop;chaknpop;"Chack'n Pop (c) 1983 Taito.

;Chack'n Pop is considered by many to be the precursor to the venerable game Bubble Bobble. The cast consists of two enemies that would later be seen in Bubble Bobble. Many fans of the Bubble Bobble series may find Chack'n Pop less fun to play due to its high degree of difficulty.
The game puts the player in the role of Mr. Chack'n
column2: who must rescue all of the hearts that were stolen during a romantic interlude between him and Miss Chack'n. Chack is an interesting character with interesting abilities. He can toss two bombs
column3: only one in each direction at a time. He can also effortlessly go from walking on the floor to walking on the ceiling. If the ceiling is low enough
column4: Chack can extend his legs until his head touches the ceiling to immediately begin walking on it.

column1: Chack must use his bombs to release the captured hearts from their cages. Once all of the hearts are freed
column2: he can escape through the top right corner of the maze. Along the way
column3: purple Monstas will be trying to stop Chack simply by colliding with him. Chack can use his bombs to defeat the Monstas
column4: but the limited use he has over them makes the bombs an unreliable attack method. Once Chack spends enough time in a maze
column5: it is not uncommon for Chack to become completely overwhelmed by the presence of the Monstas."

column1: 625;challeng;challeng;"Challenger (c) 1981 Centuri.
;CHALLENGER is the newest video game to be introduced by Centuri. With its vivid colors and lively setting
column2: it is sure to lure the most ardent player into game action.

column1: The game consists of 16 sectors (rounds) of play. Sector 1 begins with Large Energy Rings floating randomly across the screen. The Spaceship must avoid colliding with the Rings
column2: or it will explode into a starburst of brilliant colors. The Spaceship dodges the Energy Rings by moving right or left across the playfield
column3: while bursting them with the Spaceship's 3-directional guns. Bursting the Large Rings (100 points) breaks them into Medium Rings. Bursting the Medium Rings (200 points) breaks them into Small Rings. Bursting the Small Rings (400 points) causes them to disintegrate.

column1: The Spaceship is further protected by a feature called a 'Warp' button. By depressing this button
column2: the Spaceship will relocate from the top or bottom of the screen to the opposite side.

column1: If the Spaceship is in ultimate danger of being destroyed
column2: releasing its Super Bomb will wipe out all the objects on the playfield
column3: and add the point value of the objects to your score. Use of the Super Bomb is lost
column4: if the ship is destroyed first. Only one Super Bomb is awarded per Spaceship.

column1: At any time
column2: a colorful Space Bogey resembling a Worm may appear on screen and proceed to chase the Spaceship. If the Worm is destroyed by Spaceship fire
column3: or dodged successfully for several seconds
column4: a 'clang' is heard and the Worm (500 points) wriggles off the screen in a bright red hue of embarrassment. If the Spaceship is caught by the Worm
column5: a bell is sounded
column6: and the astronaut is chased out of his ship in pursuit of safety.

column1: At random time intervals a Bonus Bug will walk across the playfield
column2: stop
column3: and count down a Bonus Number. This number is equal to 100 times its value. To receive this Bonus
column4: the Spaceship must link with the nose of the Bonus Bug.

column1: When the Spaceship has survived 50 Seconds of playing time
column2: it now enters the challenges of the next sector.

column1: The remaining 15 sectors are played in the same manner as Sector one. The differences include that each succeeding sector increases in difficulty. The Energy Rings increase in number and move faster across the screen making them harder to dodge. Also there are several Space Bogeys introduced in the first 8 sectors. They also increase in number with advancement through each sector. Some of the Space Bogeys resemble Comets whizzing through space. Others resemble Spaceships from other worlds. Each Space Bogey (500 points)
column2: is an assemblage of bright colors
column3: and when destroyed
column4: burst with a ""clang"" into a spray of bright light.

column1: Sectors 4
column4: and 16
column5: are alike as follows. A few seconds after the Energy Rings are broken into smaller pieces
column6: they are pulled into a Black Hole in the center of the screen. While swirling across the game area
column7: the condensed Rings expand and shatter into fragments which must be destroyed before they absorb the Spaceship.

column1: When Sector 16 has been accomplished
column2: it will return to Sector 9.

column1: When Bonus levels are achieved
column2: an additional Ship will be added to your game.

column1: CHALLENGER INSTRUCTIONS
1. Burst energy rings to score and increase bonus levels.
Large rings - 100 points
Medium rings - 200 points
Small rings - 400 points
2. After all the small rings are hit
column2: advance to the next sector.

column1: 3. In each sector
column2: space bogeys appear and score 500 points when hit.

column1: 4. When the bonus bug walks across the playfield and stops
column2: bonus points are counted down. To collect the bonus
column3: link the ship with nose of the bug.

column1: 5. Pressing the warp button immediately relocates the ship from the top or bottom of the playfield to the opposite side.
6. The Super Bomb button destroys all objects on the playfield screen and awards total point value to your score.
7. One Super Bomb is awarded per ship.  Use of it will be lost if the ship is destroyed first.
8. Game is over when all the ships have been destroyed."
626;chameleo;chameleo;"Chameleon (c) 1983 Jaleco.
;A colourful platform game in which the player controls a long-tongued chameleon that must make around a series of single-screen
column2: platform-strewn levels; stealing chicken eggs from their nests and being careful to avoid contact with angry chickens.

column1: As well as walking along the platforms and poles
column2: the chameleon can use its tongue to pull itself up to higher platforms; and to escape from any nearby chickens. Each level also has a number of bombs placed at various points; the chameleon can hit these with its tongue to send them crashing towards nearby chickens. The player must keep an eye out for projectiles thrown by the chickens
column3: such as flashing eggs.

column1: If the nesting eggs are left for too long
column2: they will hatch into a baby chick. The player can eat the chick for bonus points
column3: but if the chick is left alone for too long
column4: it will grow into an adult chicken and start attacking the player.

column1: A level is over once all of the eggs have been collected and all of the chickens killed."

634;changes;changes;Changes (c) 1982 Orca.

;This maze game is quite similar to ""Pac-Man"". The player controls a caterpillar that crawls along the branches of a maze-like tree eating nuts and strawberries while avoiding deadly bugs and a hungry bird. The caterpillar changes into a butterfly after everything has been eaten.

The caterpillar must eat all the strawberries and nuts on each level to become a butterfly. Eating a strawberry temporarily makes the caterpillar invincible allowing it to kill the deadly bugs and score 400 bonus points ber bug. If the caterpillar remains still for too long
column2: an invincible owl (replaced by an invincible bat in later levels) will appear. If your catepillar moves
column3: the owl or bat will disappear.  If your catepillar remains still
column4: the invincible owl or bat will chase the caterpillar
column5: albiet not very effrctively.

column1: When the caterpillar crosses over a pivot branch
column2: all the branches will rotate at once
column3: and any bugs that are on those branches will fall off and score 400
column5: 1600 and 3200 points
column6: depending on the amount of bugs killed. Keep an eye out for the flowers that will appear below the house - they will reward you between 400 and 3200 points
column7: depending on the level."

column1: 635;chasehq;chasehq;"Chase H.Q. (c) 1988 Taito Corp.

;"Chase H.Q."" is a checkpoint-based racing game in which the player takes on the role on an undercover cop called Tony Gibson in this 'Miami Vice' inspired game from Taito. Gibson drives a powerful unmarked police car (resembling a Porsche 911) along with his partner
column2: 'Raymond Broady' and must chase down and apprehend various criminals.

column1: The player has between fifty-five and seventy seconds (depending on the game's 'Dip' settings) to catch up with the fleeing criminal
column2: then the same time period again to repeatedly ram into the criminal's car until it is too damaged to drive. The criminal's car is constantly moving away
column3: so if the player repeatedly crashes or drives too slowly
column4: the criminal will escape and the game ends.

column1: As with Sega's seminal ""Out Run""
column2: ""Chase H.Q."" features forked junctions offering players a choice of routes. In this game
column3: however
column4: the route selected is only a temporary diversion and dictates how quickly the criminal is caught up with. The player's Porsche is equipped with a limited number of turbo boosts
column5: when used a turbo boost pushes the car to incredible speeds
column6: at the expense of control. The turbos must be used wisely if the player is to have a chance of capturing the criminal before the time limit expires.

column1: The game consists of five levels
column2: each with its own villain to capture.

column1: The game's villains and the cars they drive are:
1. Ralph
column2: the Idaho Slasher (White Lotus Esprit)

column1: 2. Carlos
column2: the New York armed robber (Yellow Lamborghini Countach)

column1: 3. Chicago pushers (Grey Porsche 959)
4. L.A kidnapper (Blue Ferrari 288 GTO)
5. Eastern Bloc Spy (Red Porsche 928)"

column1: ;- TRIVIA -
Commercial remakes on home computer : Danger UXB by Micropower on the BBC Micro/Acorn Electron.
Also released by Zilec-Zenitone outside Japan.
- SCORING -
Clearing a square by walking over it: 10 points.
Collecting flags: 500
column7: 000 points etc.

column1: Defusing a bomb with 50-60 seconds remaining: 3
column2: 000 points.

column1: Defusing a bomb with 40-49 seconds remaining: 2
column2: 500 points.

column1: Defusing a bomb with 30-39 seconds remaining: 2
column2: 000 points.

column1: Defusing a bomb with 20-29 seconds remaining: 1
column2: 500 points.

column1: Defusing a bomb with 10-19 seconds remaining: 1
column2: 000 points.

column1: Defusing a bomb with 1-9 seconds remaining: 500 points.
- TIPS AND TRICKS -
* Collect all of the flags on the early levels as there is no great threat from the boots.
* Scroll bombs to the opposite edge of the screen so you can easily collect them and move back to your starting side.
* At the start of each level you get a few seconds where the boots can not move. Make use of this time to get to the first bomb.
* If two bombs are ticking down
column2: get the closest one first unless the other is much closer to exploding.

column1: * Move the floor away from boots to trap them.
* If you trap a boot on a single square
column2: you can move the square away from underneath it
column3: trapping it on empty space.

column1: - STAFF -
Designed and programmed by: Peter Hughes
column2: Duncan Shortland
column3: Malcolm Mailer

644;chelnovj;chelnovj;"ATOMIC RUNNER CHELNOV 戦う人間発電所 (c) 1988 Data East Corporation.
;(Atomic Runner Chelnov - Tatakau Ningen Hatsudensho)
A horizontally scrolling platform shoot-em-up in which the player controls Chelnov
column2: a former coal miner caught up in a Chernobyl-like nuclear accident. Now possessing superior physical strength and agility
column3: Chelnov is determined to escape the Eastern Bloc country he called home
column4: and run and jump across the world to finish in the US.

column1: What distinguishes this game from others of its genre is its use of forced scrolling. The screen moves continuously from left to right and players must negotiate the game's many obstacles and enemies without the benefit of dictating their speed of progress. Enemies attack from left
column2: right
column3: above and below and Chelnov can switch the direction he's facing to attack enemies that are behind him. Some enemies carry different types of weapons and power-ups and when they are shot the power-ups drop to the ground and can be picked up."

;A first-person shoot'em up game

column1: 1) SALOON SCENE - Protect yourself from outlaws
column2: armed with guns and knives
column3: flying chairs and bottles
column4: rolling barrels and raging bulls. Buster this is no time for a drink!

column2: ghouls
column3: killer cats
column4: demons and armed outlaws.

column1: 3) GHOST TOWN - Defend buster against skeletons
column2: undertaker throwing pitch forks
column3: the headless horseman
column4: ghosts
column5: skeletal bird
column6: etc...

column1: 4) CANYON SCENE - Poor buster is trapped by cannon fire
column2: bombs
column3: flying arrow and hatchets
column4: can you possibly saves him and defeat the outlaws?

column1: 5) STAGECOACH SCENE - Ride through the desert looking out for outlaws
column2: flaming arrows
column3: egg dropping bird vultures
column4: wild indians
column5: etc...

column1: 6) FOREST SCENE - Poor buster is really in a fix. Torrential waterfalls
column2: wild animals
column3: tumbling boulders. Is the gold really worth it ?

column1: 7) MINESHAFT - Hunt down outlaws while looking out for runaway ore cars
column2: fluttering vampire bats
column3: falling rocks
column4: hungry rats
column5: don't let the lanterns dim busters chances for survival.

column1: 8) BONUS ROUND : you've protected buster through a grueling sequence of danger filled episodes
column2: before you dare go on to even more perilous encounters (with even greater bounties) practice shooting is a must. Good luck to you buster!"

648;chiller;chiller;Chiller (c) 1986 Exidy.
;This is a gun game
column2: and there are four different screens (plus two different bonus screens). The object is simply to shoot everything in sight (and to try and locate any hidden targets on the screen). The game is based on time
column3: and the timer moves faster when you are shooting poorly.

column1: * The first screen is a torture chamber. There are four (still living) human targets on this screen. From left to right they are; a man chained to the wall
column2: a person in a guillotine (shoot the top of the guillotine to decapitate them)
column3: a woman strapped in a strange machine
column4: and a man in a head vise (shoot the vise to crush his head). The rest of the room is strewn with blood and loose body parts. You don't simply shoot each target once
column5: instead you shoot each part of the target
column6: which reduces that part to a mess of blood and bones. This is thankfully the most disturbing level in the game.

column1: * The second room is another torture chamber with a river of blood flowing through the middle. This one has five human targets; a man strapped to a board
column2: a man chained to the floor
column3: two people on stretching racks (shoot the wheels to pull them apart)
column4: and a woman hung from rope over the river (shoot a pulley to slowly lower her into the river to be eaten by crocodiles). Body parts will flow down the river randomly
column5: and a man will pop out of a door from time to time to toss a blade into one of the helpless victims.

column1: * The third level is a haunted house hallway. There is only one human victim on this level. It is a woman who runs from one doorway to another
column2: shoot out the trapdoor to cause her to fall inside (and then shoot the beast that was chasing her). Your other targets are mostly assorted ghosts
column3: and a few random body parts that will fall from the ceiling.

column1: * The final level is a graveyard. Your only human victim on this level is a woman who is half buried in the ground
column2: shooting her torso multiple times strips off her clothing until she is topless
column3: and the last shot kills her. You other targets are bats
column4: hands that pop up from the ground
column5: and a man who pulls a cart full of body parts (you can't kill him
column6: shooting him just makes him run away
column7: only to return later).

column1: The game repeats the levels over and over again until you manage to find every secret target on each screen (it gives you hints between the levels). Finding all the targets on a single screen earns you a bonus game (a slot machine)
column2: while finding all the hidden targets in the game gives you the second bonus game (a shooting gallery)
column3: and a free game."

column1: 649;chimerab;chimerab;"Chimera Beast (c) 1993 Jaleco.
;A horizontally scrolling shoot'em up where 1 or 2 players control creatures known as 'eaters' which are capable of eating other creatures and taking their DNA
column2: thus acquiring their abilities or characteristics.

column1: Chimera Beast takes place on a planet which is described as distant and Earth-like. The planet is overrun by animals known as eaters
column2: capable of eating other creatures and acquiring their abilities or characteristics. The player controls one of these eaters and progresses through the game by means of evolution
column3: consuming microscopic organisms in the first stage
column4: fish in the second
column5: and so on. When the player's creature gets big enough to take on humanity
column6: the goal of the game is revealed. The planet's humans have developed space travel
column7: which the player must thwart
column8: so as not to give the eaters a means of escaping the planet. There are two possible endings: one in which the player is able to stop the eaters from escaping the planet
column9: and one in which the eaters do escape and
column10: we are told
column11: will eventually make their way to Earth.

column1: The chief innovation of Chimera Beast is its power-up system. Instead of collecting gun upgrades as in most games of this genre
column2: the player's eater enhances itself by eating other creatures and assuming their abilities and defenses. Instead of simply having various types of projectile weaponry
column3: the game attempts to make these new abilities as varied as possible. Consuming a crustacean might give the player's eater a hard protective shell
column4: for example
column5: while an insectoid creature might offer a poisonous tail instead. The game even includes the ability to use cancer as a weapon.

column1: Another difference from typical shooter mechanics is that the player's eater does not die after being hit. It has a life bar
column2: which can be charged by consuming enemies. It is even possible to eat enough charge the life bar past its starting position
column3: creating a larger eater which is not only more powerful but can take more damage as well."

;The object of Clay Pigeon was to shoot as many clay targets as you can
column2: using an arcade light gun that was shaped like a shotgun. At the start of the game you are given the choice of selecting either Trap Shooting or Skeet Shooting. Trap shooting is where the clay target is thrown directly away from the shooter
column3: while in skeet shooting the target is launched across the shooter's field of vision. The graphics are done in Exidy's realistic style
column4: each round is played against a decent looking outdoor background
column5: and an extremely repetitive announcer yells 'pull' to warn you of each and every target being launched. After several rounds of targets
column6: you finally get to go after some real live animals! The real live animals are of course
column7: ducks! The ducks are small and fly onto the screen in small groups of up to around a half dozen or so
column8: and unlike the earlier title ""Vs. Duck Hunt""
column9: you cannot miss any of these. Missing any ducks in this round ends the game instantly
column10: and will more than likely have you fumbling for another quarter in an attempt to do it right this time."

692;cloak;cloak;Cloak & Dagger (c) 1983 Atari.
;Agent X
column2: complete with trenchcoat
column3: Bogie hat
column4: and briefcase
column5: hurries through a series of adventures and misadventures to retrieve stolen plans and destroy dastardly Dr. Boom's subterranean bomb factory. Our masked hero descends to the depths of Dr. Boom's laboratory in a special elevator. On each floor he encounters a series of conveyor belts that are moving explosives. A giant bomb ticks down the game seconds while devices of Dr. Boom's plotting
column6: such as bomb converters
column7: forklifts deflecting shots back at Agent X
column8: robot guards
column9: acid pits
column10: and crawling eyes shooting death rays
column11: challenge the player(s).

column1: CLOAK & DAGGER is a 1- or 2-player game with a color raster video display. You control Agent X as he descends underground floor by floor in an elevator to Dr. Boom's lab
column2: located on the 33rd floor. Your main goal is to retrieve Top Secret plans that are surrounded by an electrical arc. To stop the electrical current
column3: Agent X must shoot all the fiery nodes as he fights off robot guards.

column1: As Agent X leaves the elevator on each floor
column2: he must make his way carefully and quickly across the screen to another exit. Each floor displays a configuration of conveyor belts moving green unarmed and red armed explosives.  Agent X can pick up the green explosives. The red explosives will explode on contact. Some floors have marauding robot guards
column3: death-ray shooting crawling eyes
column4: and acid pits.

column1: Once Agent X has the top secret plans in hand
column2: he must make his way back to the surface. If he exits on a floor that was bombed on the way down
column3: he will find a massive crater protected by node monsters and the previously mentioned attackers. If he exits on a floor that was not bombed
column4: a superguard will join the other attackers to challenge Agent X. On the final level
column5: rumors are that he will meet the notorious Dr. Boom himself.

column1: At the center of the display
column2: a double-coiled fuse to a giant bomb is ticking down the game seconds for each level. Agent X can light the fuse in a rush for bonus points
column3: but must be able to escape that level before the bomb explodes. If the fuse has shortened on its own to one coil
column4: it lights automatically and prompts Agent X to make a mad dash to the waiting elevator. The doors close just as a burst of light from the explosion is seen. The game's perspective now changes to a full view inside the elevator. Messages flash across the elevator to give helpful hints on the next level.

column1: Dr. Boom has placed explosive mines on every 4th floor. On each of the preceding 3 floors Agent X can pick up a secret map box that will show him part of the safe path across the minefield on the next 4th floor.
Agent X's first goal is to travel successfully from one elevator to the other; his second goal is to pick up a secret box to get a map of the minefield on levels 4
column8: and 32; the third goal is to light the bomb fuse and escape before the explosion.

column1: As game play progresses
column2: Agent X may find an extra-life box and a mystery box that give bonus points
column3: double speed
column4: half speed
column5: and occasionally
column6: an extra life. Extra bonus points are earned for picking up green unarmed explosives or for skipping floors.

column1: If Agent X succeeds in capturing the top secret plans
column2: he must fight his way back up to the top level. The appearance of box compressors
column3: crawling eyes
column4: and other enemies are more random on the way up than on the way down. If Agent X makes it back to the surface
column5: a free game will be awarded (depending on the settings of the option switches).

column1: The game ends when you use up your last life or successfully make it to the surface."

714;cobracom;cobracom;Cobra-Command (c) 1988 Data East.
;The player must defend Colony 7 from alien attack by either using the main weapons that fire shots
column2: a Mega-Blaster which knocks out targets near the detonation zone
column3: or with the Eradicator that acts as a smartbomb which clears the entire screen. There is an ion shield which provides temporary safety for the colony below
column4: but can be blasted away by alien fire.

column1: Colony 7 is in many ways a combination of two of the most popular shoot 'em up games of the time
column2: containing elements of both Tehkan's Pleiads and Atari's Missile Command. The main innovation of Colony 7 was the extended weaponry arsenal. This gave the player the choice to change between several different weapons
column3: with the the Eradicator needing to be purchased separately as ""extended weaponry""."

column3: or with the Eradicator that acts as a smartbomb which clears the entire screen. There is an ion shield which provides temporary safety for the colony below

column1: Colony 7 is in many ways a combination of two of the most popular shoot 'em up games of the time
column2: containing elements of both Tehkan's Pleiads and Atari's Missile Command. The main innovation of Colony 7 was the extended weaponry arsenal. This gave the player the choice to change between several different weapons

column1: 718;columns;columns;"Columns (c) 1990 Sega Enterprises
column2: Limited.

column1: ;Sega's answer to the legendary ""Tetris""
column2: the rules of Columns are simple : a column of 3 square pieces - stacked one on top of the other - drops from the top of the screen into the play area. As with Tetris
column3: the column puzzle pieces can be moved left and right as they fall
column4: but unlike Tetris
column5: they cannot be rotated. Instead
column6: pressing a button will cause the order of the colored blocks in a column to shift by one position.

column1: The object of the game is to place columns at the bottom of the pit in such a way that lines of 3 or more like-colored blocks are created (either horizontally
column2: vertically or diagonally). When this happens
column3: these blocks disappear
column4: and any blocks resting upon them immediately fall onto the recently vacated space. This will often cause additional lines to be arranged
column5: producing a 'cascade' effect. The key to a long game (and
column6: ultimately
column7: a high score) is to set up these cascades wherever possible.

column1: While not achieving the same legendary status as the mighty ""Tetris"" (something that no puzzle game can realistically hope to achieve)
column2: the 'Columns' series has managed to garner a dedicated following of its own and is a respected example of the genre."

column1: 719;columns2;columns2;"Columns II - The Voyage Through Time (c) 1990 Sega Enterprises
column2: Limited.

column1: ;Align 3 or more items of the same color vertically
column2: horizontally or diagonally.

column1: Columns II: The Voyage Through Time was the sequel to Columns. It featured the normal puzzle game play
column2: but was only released in Japan in the arcades. It is not clear as to why it was subtitled ""The Voyage Through Time""
column3: other than the minor tile differences which seem to  attempt to indicate future and past ages: they are labeled as Machine Theme
column4: Pale Green Theme
column5: and Classic Theme."

column1: 721;combasc;combatsc;"Combat School (c) 1987 Konami.
;Combat School is a one or two player multi-event combat game
column2: similar in gameplay style to Konami's ""Track and Field"" series.

column1: * In the obstacle course
column2: you must repeatedly press the fire button to run as fast as possible. Press the jump button in order to clear or mount hurdles of various heights. Complete the course within a specific amount of time to continue the game.

column1: * In the Iron Man race
column2: the controls are the same but you will jump puddles and boulders and swim across a stream.

column1: * In the firing ranges
column2: aim with the joystick or trackball and shoot using the fire button. There will be various firing range sessions beginning with stationary targets
column3: proceeding to moving targets
column4: and finishing with having to avoid hitting the targets that represent comrades. The comrade targets resemble your drill instructor but you must still avoid hitting them (the wrong targets and the drill instructors) as it will cost you the game. The activities get progressively more difficult as you proceed."

column1: 725;combat;combat;"Combat (c) 1985 Exidy.

726;commandj;commandoj;戦場の狼 (c) 1985 Capcom.
;(Senjou no Ookami)

Senjou no Ookami is a vertically-scrolling shoot'em up in which the player takes on the role of a highly trained commando soldier. The mission is to rescue captives and destroy enemy bases and strongholds
column2: killing as many enemy soldiers as possible in the process. The commando carries only 2 weapons : a limited-range machine gun with unlimited shots
column3: and a limited supply of hand grenades. Extra grenades can be picked up as the player progresses through the levels."

column1: 727;commando;commando;"Commando (c) 1985 Capcom.
;Commando is a vertically scrolling shoot'em up in which the player takes on the role of a highly trained commando soldier called ""Super Joe""
column2: who starts the game by being dropped off in a jungle by a helicopter.

column1: Joe's mission is to rescue captives and destroy the enemy bases and strongholds that appear at the end of each level

column1: 729;commsega;commsega;"Commando (c) 1983 Sega.

;An early shoot'em up.
730;comotion;comotion;CoMotion (c) 1976 Gremlin.

;This game was for two or four players only, you must have a live human opponent to play against, or else the other players character will go straight into a wall, making for a very quick and boring game. Each player moves their character around leaving a solid line behind them. All moves are made on an invisible grid, so you can only turn at 90 degree angles. To win you must last longer than your opponents before hitting something. Each player is eliminated when they crash, taking their lines with them. One good strategy is to turn around and head for the outer area of the screen (in four player mode), because everyone starts out headed for the center. Skirt around the edges until you only have one opponent left, then box them in. Pushing backwards on the stick will cause you to crash into your own line, so avoid that at all cost.

735;contcirc;contcirc;"Continental Circus (c) 1987 Taito.
;Continental Circus is a Formula One racing game in which the player races over a number of International Grand Prix circuits
column2: trying to complete each lap before the time limit expires. The game features Pit-stops and dynamic weather; the latter in the form of rain.

column1: If the player's car is hit by either a rival car or strikes a trackside barrier
column2: the car will be damaged and begin to smoke. The player must 'pit' at the earliest opportunity to get the car repaired
column3: otherwise the fire will spread and the car will eventually explode. Should the player's car have a second collision before the Pit-stop is reached
column4: the car to explode
column5: wasting precious time before a replacement car appears.

column1: Continental Circus' Grand Prix tracks are as follows :
BRAZIL / Brazil GP - Qualified Rank 80

MONACO / Monaco GP - Qualified Rank 40
GERMANY / Germany GP - Qualified Rank 30
SPAIN / Spain GP - Qualified Rank 20
MEXICO / Mexico GP - Qualified Rank 10
JAPAN / Japan GP - Qualified Rank 3"

737;contra;contra1;"魂斗羅 (c) 1987 Konami.
;(Contra)

column2: a meteorite strikes the Galuga archipelago near New Zealand
column3: carrying with it a dormant alien being. Two years later
column4: a terrorist organization calling themselves Red Falcon takes over the island as part of their plot to invade the Earth. Bill Rizer and Lance Bean
column5: of the Contra unit
column6: are sent to the Oceania island to stop the evil threat.

column1: 'Contra' is a hectic one or two player platform shoot-em-up featuring 10 stages. In addition to the standard side-view levels
column2: there are also ""3D maze"" stages in which the player must proceed through a series of corridors inside an enemy base
column3: destroying various sensors
column4: in order to reach the core of the base.

column1: Each player's character is equipped with a semi-automatic machine gun with an unlimited amount of ammunition and can jump
column2: move and fire in all eight cardinal directions. Players can also move and jump simultaneously while firing. Co-ordination of the character's movement is essential as a single hit from any enemy
column3: bullet
column4: or other hazard will instantly kill the player's character and also eliminate the current weapon from the player's inventory.

column1: As players fight their way through the enemy-packed levels
column2: additional weapons can be collected. If the player loses a life
column3: they will also lose any weapon power-up they were carrying. Available weapons are:

column1: Machine Gun: Auto-fire.
Spread gun [S]: Allows the player to fire 5 shots in an arc.
Laser: Will shoot a long laser that can take out many enemies in a row.
Fire Ball [F]: A gun which fires small fireballs in a corkscrew pattern.
Rapid Bullets [R]: Increases the firing rate of the player's currently equipped weapon. Works with the Machine Gun and Fire Ball.
Barrier [B]: Will make the player invincible for a few seconds.
The game consists of ten stages:
Stage 01: Jungle (horizontal scroll)
Stage 02: Inside Base 1 (3D maze)
Stage 03: Core of Base 1 (3D fixed)
Stage 04: Waterfall (vertical scroll)
Stage 05: Inside Base 2 (3D maze)
Stage 06: Core of Base 2 (3D fixed)
Stage 07: Snow Field (horizontal scroll)
Stage 08: Energy Zone (horizontal scroll)
Stage 09: Hangar (horizontal scroll)
Stage 10: Alien Lair (horizontal scroll)"

;A one or two player sideways scrolling platform shoot-em-up in which two cops
column2: by the name of Tony Gibson and Raymond Brody
column3: fight gangs of criminals over six platform-strewn stages. Each stage centres around a specific criminal activity
column4: such as bank robbery or smuggling. The ultimate goal in Crime City is to find the King-pin 'boss' characters that await the players at the end of each level
column5: and arrest them.

column1: The game's heroes start each level armed with a pistol
column2: and extra weapons become available as players progress through a level. Both the pistol and additional weapons have only a limited amount of ammunition
column3: and if players runs out of ammo
column4: they will only be able to punch or ""somersault attack"" into attacking enemies. Each stage features numerous background items that can be used to attack enemies
column5: such as wooden barrels
column6: boxes and hanging lights. When shot
column7: some criminals drop packets of illegal drugs
column8: which can be picked up for bonus points.

column1: Crime City's gameplay takes its inspiration from both Namco's ""Rolling Thunder"" and Sega's ""Shinobi""."

784;crimfght;crimfghtu;"Crime Fighters (c) 1989 Konami.
;Export release. 4-Player Conversion Kit. Game developed in Japan. For more information about the game itself
column2: please see the original Japanese release entry; ""Crime Fighters [Model GX821]"".

column1: - TRIVIA -
In this version:
* Reverse kick removed. This is now a 2-button game (punch & kick) instead of 3 in the original version.

* Character's energy is represented by a numerical hit point value which is always on countdown to zero. Additional hit points may be added by inserting more coins into each player's corresponding coin slot.
* Characters can use a reversal kick which is automatically activated if an opponent is behind you as you press the kick button. This kick knocks down enemies (except bosses) with a single hit!
* The gun has limited ammo
column2: however it is possible to pick it up again if an enemy knocks it off your hand. Also each gunshot is as strong as 3 punches or kicks and knocks down most enemies in one shot.

column1: * You can play the extra stage (enemy boss revenge) more than once.
* Original Timer and Credit Counter removed.
- STAFF -
Cabinet Graphic Design: Don Marshall"

786;crimfgtj;crimfghtj;"Crime Fighters (c) 1989 Konami.

;Plenty of young & beautiful women are missing and the city's local kingpin is the main suspect. As a group of street vigilantes you must venture into the most dangerous zones of your city and destroy all street punks & criminals that are dumb enough to get in your way in order to rescue the girls! Features colorful graphics, a catchy soundtrack, some cool moves (such as striking downed enemies) and a good challenge. Like the idea of fighting to rescue a beautiful damsel in distress? Why not a huge bunch of 'em so its worth your time!
787;crkdown;crkdownu;Crack Down (c) 1989 Sega.
;A futuristic city has been over-taken by a powerful
column2: bio-mechanical army; created by an evil scientist in a bid to take over the world. 2 elite agents must plant a series of time bombs to destroy their base and crush the rebellion.

column1: The 1- or 2-player shoot-em-up action is displayed via an innovative split screen that allows 2 players to work either individually or as a team. A timer countdown timers adds to the tension. Time bombs must be set by running over areas marked with an 'X'; while machine guns and cannons can be reloaded by finding the ammo caches that appear on each level. If ammo runs out
column2: players must result to punching and kicking to defeat opponents."

795;crush;crush;Crush Roller (c) 1981 Kural Electric
column2: Limited.

column1: ;Crush Roller is a maze game in which the player controls a paintbrush and must paint the entire layout in order to advance to the next stage. Two fish — one yellow
column2: the other light blue — emerge from separate aquariums to pursue the paintbrush around the board
column3: and if either of the fish succeeds in making contact with the paintbrush
column4: the player loses a life.

column1: The player may use two ""rollers"" to attack the fish. The rollers are located on two overpasses
column2: one vertical in its orientation
column3: the other horizontal. To use a roller
column4: the player positions the paintbrush on the forward end of the roller
column5: waits for either or both of the fish to approach
column6: then pushes the paintbrush along the roller
column7: attacking the fish. The fish is removed from the maze for a few seconds
column8: then returns to one of the aquariums and resumes its pursuit of the paintbrush. Killing fish in this manner scores bonus points.

column1: A third character
column2: appearing to be an animal or human figure depending on the level
column3: may enter the maze and leave tracks that must be painted over in order for the board to be completed. The player can limit the damage by running over the figure
column4: which not only stops further tracks from being left but also awards the player a score
column5: which progressively increases as more boards are cleared."

column1: 798;crusnu21;crusnusa21;"Cruis'n USA (c) 1994 Midway.
;Designed by the legendary Eugene Jarvis (creator of
column2: among other things
column3: ""Robotron"" and ""Defender"")
column4: Cruis'n USA is a point-to-point racing game featuring fourteen separate courses set in a number of different US locations.

column1: Each race takes place against nine other rival cars. In addition to the player's opponents
column2: the roads are packed with civilian traffic that must be avoided. Any collision with either other vehicles or with trackside objects will result in lost time as the player races against both the clock and the nine rival racers. On many tracks
column3: collisions can be avoided by driving off-road
column4: although this has as inverse effect on both handling and speed.

column1: The in-game physics are skewed entirely toward arcade-style handling. The aforementioned collisions have vehicles bouncing and spinning as though made of rubber
column2: before righting themselves back on the track."

column1: 801;crusnw13;crusnwld13;"Cruis'n World (c) 1996 Midway Mfg. Co.
;Cruis'n World is a direct sequel to ""Cruis'n USA""
column2: and is again a point-to-point racing game
column3: with each race having the player racing against nine rival drivers.

column1: Unlike its USA-set prequel
column2: Cruis'n World's races take place in a variety of global locations
column3: such as the Egypt
column4: London and France. Players can race in any one of twelve countries ranked by difficulty
column5: or drive the entire world through fourteen tracks.

column1: While the core gameplay remains the same
column2: new time-saving stunt moves have been introduced in the form of wheelies and jumps
column3: and many tracks now feature short-cuts."

column1: ;Capcom Sports Club is a multi-event sports game for one or two players who can choose to play any one of three different sports games: Tennis (Smash Stars)
column2: Football (Kick Stars) and Basketball (Dunk Stars).

column1: The game's look and feel is typical of Capcom's output of the time and is skewed heavily towards fast
column2: cartoon-like arcade action.

column1: Of the three games on offer
column2: ""Smash Stars"" Tennis is by far the most accomplished and would easily stand up as an arcade machine in its own right."

;An addictive puzzle game in which the object is to guide eggs through a maze of egg-runs and guide them safely to the basket at the bottom of the screen.
This is achieved by switching red and blue pipes to face the left or right-hand side at exactly the right moment. Players must manipulate different pipes on BOTH halves of the screen at the same time
column2: making for demanding and rewarding gameplay."

;Championship Sprint is an updated version of the old Atari Sprint series
column2: with the added ability for players to upgrade their vehicles as the game progresses. Upgrades are won by collecting the bonus wrenches that appear once during each race
column3: and once players have collected four wrenches
column4: they will be presented with an upgrade screen; allowing them to choose better traction
column5: top speed
column6: acceleration
column7: or a faster helicopter.

column1: Collisions with barriers should
column2: of course
column3: be avoided
column4: as they invariably cost the player valuable time. Also; a direct
column5: head-on collision can cause the players' vehicles to explode - particularly if the player is moving at speed when this happens. In the event of a car exploding
column6: a helicopter will automatically airlift a replacement vehicle to the track; this replacement will retain any previous upgrades made by the player. Waiting for the replacement car takes precious time and allows rival drivers to gain a distinct advantage. Car replacement time can be shortened upgrading the helicopter.

column1: The tracks themselves are all variations on the basic 'oval'
column2: with gates
column3: jumps
column4: ramps and crossroads ensuring a demanding
column5: yet incredibly playable game."

859;cyberlip;cyberlip;"Cyber-Lip (c) 1990 SNK [Shin Nihon Kikaku].
;Cyber-Lip is a platform shoot-em-up for one or two players that borrows heavily from Konami's ""Contra"" series. Players must battle through sideways-scrolling levels
column2: to defeat armies of cyborgs and androids and restore order and peace to the world.

column1: Cyber-Lip has two shooting modes
column2: one for standard weapon use and one for rocket launchers and grenade throwing. Players can switch between the two modes at any time
column3: but only carry a limited amount of grenades or rockets. Weapon power-ups and additional grenades and rockets can be picked up throughout the levels.

column1: At the end of certain levels
column2: the game's heroes will enter an elevator and players can then choose whether to go 'up' or 'down'
column3: depending on which route through the game they wish to take. Each level has a large end-of-level boss that must be defeated."

864;cybsled;cybsled;"Cyber Sled (c) 1993 Namco.

;Piloting a colorful tank that slides over the surface like a 'Sled' in an arena of the future, the pilots fight for prestige and glory. Ending the game (either by winning or being eliminated) gives the player a rank and a letter grade to show how good you really are.
865;cyclshtg;cyclshtg;Cycle Shooting (c) 1986 Taito.
866;cyvern;cyvernj;Cyvern - The Dragon Weapons (c) 1998 Kaneko Company

column1:
;Take control of 3 artificially enhanced elemental dragons and battle against tons of enemy airships and hulking bosses in this excellent overhead shooter. Features awesome graphics & sound effects as well as responsive controls and a high level of challenge.
867;czeroize;czeroize;Zeroize (c) 1983 Data East.
868;dadandrn;dadandrn;Kyuukyoku Sentai Dadandarn (c) 1993 Konami.

;A trio of supervillains unleashes an army of gross mutants on earth on order to start an alien invasion. Our only hope is the trio of superheroes known as the 'Ultimate Task Force'. Squash the evil mutants and put an end to the alien menace. Features excellent graphics & sound as well as plenty of moves to find!
869;daimakai;daimakai;大魔界村 (c) 1988 Capcom.
;(Daimakaimura)

Three years have passed since the events of ""Makaimura"" and Arthur the knight once again finds himself battling against the hideous creatures of Demon World. The demons have now seized the kingdom and Arthur returns home to witness the castle's lone survivor
column2: his beloved Gunievere
column3: murdered by the king of the demons
column4: Lucifer. Arthur once again embarks on a one-man quest to destroy the demonic invaders and save Gunievere's mortal soul.

column1: Game-play is of a very similar vein to that of ""Makaimura"" - the classic run
column2: jump and shoot action remains intact. Daimakaimura is
column3: however
column4: even more difficult than its already demanding predecessor. Arthur now has access to several new power-ups to aid him on his daunting quest
column5: such as 'Golden Armour' which gives Arthur greater protection from the demons. Additionally
column6: unlike ""Makaimura""
column7: Arthur can now fire his weapons upwards instead of just left or right and
column8: while jumping
column9: can fire beneath him as well.

column1: The graphics in Daimakaimura are predictably far superior to those of its 1985 prequel
column2: with highly imaginative level design and superbly-drawn
column3: smoothly animated enemies all adding to the game's superb Gothic feel."

column1: 870;daioh;daioh;"Daioh (c) 1993 Sammy.

;An excellent vertically scrolling space shoot'em up. Excellent graphics, multi-layer scrolling, big sprites (especially bosses), and an extreme difficulty that continued to increase from easy to insane the farther along you went without getting killed.

column1: 879;danchih;danchih;;
880;dangar;dangara;"Dangar - UFO Robo (c) 1986 Nichibutsu.

;You fly a spaceship in a vertically scrolling game while fighting off enemy ships and collecting ship parts that combine to form an enormous, fist-launching robot. If the player can keep the robot in one piece (a difficult task considering the number of enemies the game throws at you), they'll eventually be able to arm it with a gun and even transform it into one of several devastatingly powerful smaller ships.
883;dangerz;dangerz;Danger Zone (c) 1986 Cinematronics.

;A war combat game that is set in a desert. Helicopters, fighters and bombers enter the area swooping down over the mountains. Watch your radar screen and protect your base.
884;dangseed;dangseed;Dangerous Seed (c) 1989 Namco.
;The player assumes control of three separate ships. Each ship has a different firing pattern. When the three ships are combined together
column2: they form the Moon Diver. Their mission is to quell an alien invasion which is spanning all of the Milky Way and destroy the alien headquarters: the Danger-Seed.

column1: The player starts the game with three separate fighters and has to make it through four tubes using the fighters separately. If one gets destroyed
column2: then the next
column3: more powerful ship makes an attempt to get through. If the player makes it to the fifth stage
column4: the three ships combine into a singular composite ship called the ""Moon Diver""
column5: which has a massive amount of firepower."

column1: 885;dankuga;dankuga;"Dan-Ku-Ga (c) 1994 Taito Corporation.

;A one on one fighting game.
886;daraku;daraku;The Fallen Angels (c) 1998 Psikyo.

;A very solid 2-D fighting game with beautiful pre-rendered backgrounds. 8 selectable fighters and 2 end bosses.
887;darius;darius;Darius (c) 1986 Taito Corp.
;A horizontally scrolling shoot-em-up that was unique at the time for featuring a game screen that was three times wider than the conventional size
column2: with the arcade cabinet utilizing three CRT screens to accommodate it.

column1: In the game
column2: the player flies an ornate fighter craft called a Silver Hawk. The craft is equipped with two attack weapons : Missile (forward-firing standard gun) and Bomb (drops from the bottom of the ship). The Silver Hawk is also equipped with the 'Arm' (armor); a green energy shield that can absorb enemy attacks without harm to the ship.

column1: During the course of the levels the player must navigate the terrain and battle a variety of fighter craft
column2: ground vehicles
column3: turrets
column4: and other obstacles. At the end of every level
column5: players are greeted with the obligatory end-of-level boss. The bosses in Darius are often in the form of mechanical aquatic animals
column6: such as fish or squid. If the player defeats the boss
column7: the tunnel splits into two and the player must decide whether to take the upper or lower tunnel
column8: both of which lead to a different stage. This allows many different paths to be taken through the game.

column1: Power-ups can be obtained by shooting enemies of a certain color
column2: with the power-ups appearing in the form of colored bubbles. Each color corresponds to one of the ship's three weapons :

column1: * Red - Missile
* Green - Bomb
* Blue - Arm
If the player powers up a weapon more than seven times
column2: the weapon changes to a new
column3: more powerful version. This then becomes the player's default weapon
column4: and can be powered up further. There are also two other colors of power-up bubble
column5: white and orange; which can be obtained by shooting at certain sections of the terrain; unfortunately
column6: there are no visual clues as to where these may be on any given level. These hidden power-ups offer the following :

column1: * White - Gives a score bonus.
* Orange - Smart bomb that kills all on-screen enemies."
888;darius2;darius2;"Darius II (c) 1989 Taito.
;The direct sequel to the 1986 original
column2: Darius II retained the distinctive 3-screen format of the first game.

column1: The power-up system of Darius II was changed from that of its parent game
column2: with players having to destroy complete waves of a particular enemy to earn a power-up. 2 new power-ups were also added; the 1st was a new weapon power-up that gave the player green
column3: vertical lasers
column4: the 2nd power-up was a rainbow-colored item that powered up all of the players weapons.

column1: Another new feature of Darius II is the appearance of mini-bosses - large enemies that appear at the mid point of a level
column2: possessing similar strength and abilities to those of the game's normal bosses (such as extravagant weapons
column3: or the inability to be damaged without first exposing a vulnerable area). The mini-bosses in Darius II are in fact smaller versions of the bosses from Darius.

column1: The game is set in the inner regions of the Solar system
column2: and has the same branching level structure as Darius
column3: allowing players to select their own route through the game."

891;dariusg;dariusg;"Darius Gaiden - Silver Hawk (c) 1994 Taito Corporation.
;In the game
column2: the third in the sequel of Darius series; the player flies an ornate fighter craft called a Silver Hawk. The craft is equipped with two attack weapons: Missile (forward-firing standard gun) and Bomb (drops from the bottom of the ship). The Silver Hawk is also equipped with the 'Arm' (armor); a green energy shield that can absorb enemy attacks without harm to the ship. Some enemies leave panels behind that can be collected to power-up your shots
column3: missiles or shield.

column1: The graphics and sound are superior to those of the previous Darius games
column2: and the game employs a lot of impressive visual effects; for example
column3: the Silver Hawk warps into a stage dramatically in the fourth-tier stages
column4: and begins to burn on re-entry at the start of the sixth-tier stages.

column1: The bosses are huge and far more complex than those of the previous games
column2: each employing several attack patterns and explode with powerful warping and twisting effects upon their defeat."

897;darkadv;darkadv;"Dark Adventure (c) 1987 Konami.
;Pre-version of ""Majuu no Ohkoku [Model GX687]"" For more information about the game itself
column2: please see the original version entry.

column1: Dark Adventure has:
* Different intro sequences.
* More difficult: The energy live decrease faster and each scene has more than one exit (and more than one key).
* There are three player characters instead of two (Zorlock has been added).
* The rectangle that contains the options (weapons and speed) that you can activate doesn't exist.
* The scenes with the dragon don't exist.
* The weapons and the process to catch them are different."

column1:

column2: in this colourful

904;darktowr;darktowr;"Dark Tower (c) 1992 The Game Room.

;A simple yet playable platform game which is somewhat unique in that while the game itself is original (i.e. not a direct clone of another game) many of the game's component parts are NOT. See 'Trivia' for further details.
905;darkwar;darkwar;Dark Warrior (c) 1981 Century Electronics.

;An old shoot'em up that features voice simulation.
906;darwin;darwin;Darwin 4078 (c) 1986 Data East Corp.
;The game takes place within a gigantic spaceship which has virtually infinite capacity because of its ability to manipulate time and space. The player must deal with enigmatic creatures called EVOL
column2: which consist only of pure energy and need to keep themselves in capsules in order to maintain their existence in the world.

column1: All of the characters in the game are designed to resemble microscopic organisms
column2: both in their appearance and their quick
column3: tricky movements. The player's ship undergoes over 10 types of transformations throughout the game
column4: each with offensive and defensive maneuvers specific to their design. The sound effects used are minimal
column5: but different types of sounds are used according to the type of shots or their speed. A sound resembling a long scream results when the player's ship is hit and returns to its weakest evolutionary state.

column1: The player must progress through 16 different levels
column2: defeating the boss at the end of each level. The player controls their ship using an 8-way joystick and 2 buttons (one button targets enemies in the air
column3: and the other targets the enemies on the ground). The power of the player's ship increases as it evolves.

column1: There are two broad categories that define how enemies attack. The first type only shoots in the forward direction at a constant speed
column2: but the second type shoots bullets that travel at different speeds depending on its distance with the player's ship (the bullets travel quicker if the player is farther away
column3: and slower if the player is close by). This makes it so that staying away from enemies will not necessarily make it easier to avoid attacks. The game's difficulty also does not change over time
column4: and enemies do not become stronger as the player's ship evolves."

;A mad scientist is creating an army of powerful mutant soldiers in order to conquer the world. Only Dynamite Duke, a battle-hardened elite soldier with an incredibly devastating bionic arm stands a chance to stop the attack before its too late. Features nice graphics & an interesting blend of shooter & beat-em up gameplay elements!
912;dblplay;dblplay;Super Baseball Double Play Home Run Derby (c) 1987 Leland Corp.
913;dbreed;dbreedm72;Dragon Breed (c) 1989 Irem Corp.
;Dragon Breed is a superb and innovative side-scrolling shoot-em-up from the same gaming stable that gave the world ""R*Type""
column2: Irem. Dragon Breed differs from other shoot-em-ups through its interpretation of the 'ship' that appears in other games of the genre; in Dragon Breed
column3: the player controls a figure who rides a fully articulated and superbly rendered dragon. What makes this a particularly inspired move is that the Dragon's body - which is invulnerable to enemies and enemy fire - can be used as both a shield and a weapon; the player can move the dragon in such a way that its tail can be used to surround its rider and protect him from his enemies. Any contact the enemy has with the dragon will also deplete the enemy's power and eventually kill it. The dragon can also be 'powered-up' in a similar fashion to the space craft of other shoot-em-ups.

column1: At various point throughout a level
column2: small areas of land will appear at the bottom of the screen. These often contain power-ups and the player can fly the dragon down to the platform
column3: dismount
column4: and move around on foot."

column1: 926;ddrago3b;ddragon3b;"Double Dragon 3 - The Rosetta Stone (c) 1990 Technos Japan Corp.

;A mysterious fortune teller warns Billy & Jimmy Lee about the rise of a powerful enemy in Egypt. Since the Lee brothers are looking for a true challenge to put their martial arts skills to the ultimate test
column2: they agree to face this mysterious new enemy. They embark on a world quest - joining up with new allies in the process - and try to lay claim to the famous 'Rosetta Stone'.

column1: The 3rd and final arcade entry of the Double Dragon series (not counting the later Neo-Geo fighting game based on the movie) features a completely gameplay system and graphics from the first two installments. The game can played by up to 2 or 3 players
column2: depending on the cabinet and settings. The 3rd player takes control of a yellow-clad Lee brother named Sonny
column3: who is exclusive to this game. Techniques from the previous games such as the hair grab and the elbow punch are gone
column4: but new ones are added such as the belly-to-back throw and the back-to-back hurricane kick
column5: as well as the ability to dash by tapping the joystick left or right twice.

column1: The game features weapon shops that allows the player to purchase power-ups by inserting additional tokens. The power-ups differ between stages differ between stages and are available as followed.
* Extra Guys - Allows the player to control a new character who replaces the current fighter when he dies. There are three character types in addition to the Lee brothers.
- The Urquidez Brothers (Roney
column2: Sunny
column3: Jonny) -  Tall European grapplers. They have the most energy of the four character types.  Up to three fighters can be have in reserve.

column1: - The Chin Brothers (Seimei
column2: Taimei
column3: Sinmei) - Chubby Chinese men with powerful attacks.

column1: - The Oyama Brothers (Masao
column2: Kunio
column3: Akira) - Japanese karate masters dressed in gis specializing in speedy attacks.

column1: * Tricks - The hurricane kick and the one-armed stand head butt are added to the player's move set. If the player's current character dies
column2: then the new techniques will be inherited by the next character in reserve
column3: if there is one.

column1: * Weapons - A nunchaku or sword are given player. Only the Lees can have purchase and wield weapons.
* Energy - Restores the current character's life to 150%.
* Power-Up - Increases the character's agility.
There are 5 stages in the game :
Mission 1 - America - The enemies in this stage are typical thugs and bikers. The first area takes place in a downtown area of city. After defeating the first wave of enemies
column2: the player will enter a warehouse
column3: where they encounter bikers that will try to run over them with their bike. The boss in this is Jim
column4: a red-haired biker wearing a leather jacket.

column1: Mission 2 - China - The enemies are martial artists that specialize in flying kicks. The stage takes place in a single level set in a countryside near the Great Wall of China. The boss at the end of level is Li Cheng-Long
column2: a Shaolin Martial Arts expert who resembles Bruce Lee. When he's down in life
column3: he will wield out his club.

column1: Mission 3 - Japan - The enemies are samurai swordsmen. The first area takes place outside a castle
column2: with bamboo traps and enemies coming out of walls. The second area takes place inside a castle
column3: where the player will face a few more swordsmen before taking out on the boss
column4: Ranzou
column5: a ninja. He attacks with throwing stars and smoke bombs and splits into three forms when he's down on his life.

column1: Mission 4 - Italy - Consists of a single level set in the ruins of a coliseum. The enemies are roman archers. After defeating most of the archers
column2: the boss Giuliano
column3: a man decked in gladiator armor
column4: will attempt to run the player over with his horse. After defeating all the archers
column5: Giuliano will dismount at the end of the level and fight the player. He wields a long hand spear and can block attacks with his shield.

column1: Mission 5 - Egypt - The final stage is composed of seven levels
column2: which includes a desert field
column3: an underground forest
column4: a trap room with stone pillars and giant hands emerging from the floor
column5: a hall with a flying disc. Enemies include living tree men and rock creatures."

column1: 927;ddragon;ddragon;"Double Dragon (c) 1987 Technos Japan Corp.
;Double Dragon is a side-scrolling beat-em-up for one or two players
column2: featuring twin brothers and martial arts masters
column3: ""Billy & Jimmy Lee"". The brothers must defeat the savage street gang known as the 'Black Warriors' to rescue Billy's kidnapped girlfriend
column4: Marian. Standing between the brothers and Marian are four huge
column5: colorful and varied levels; each populated with a wide variety of thugs.

column1: Many of the game's enemies carry weapons (knives
column2: baseball bats etc.) and should Billy or Jimmy manage to knock the weapons from the enemies' hands
column3: the heroes can pick the weapons up and use them against the enemies.

column1: The Black Warriors is made up of six distinct enemy characters- plus Willy
column2: the game's final boss - with each differing in both physical appearance and fighting style. The members of the Black Warriors consist of the following fighters:

column1: * Williams - A street punk in a tank top. In addition to the standard punches and jump kicks
column2: his signature technique is a body blow to the stomach. He also wields weapons such as baseball bats
column3: knives and dynamite sticks.

column1: * Rowper - A punk who wears matching-colored pants and shirtless vest. He wields all the same weapons as Williams
column2: but can also lift and throw heavy objects such as oildrums
column3: boxes and stones.

column1: * Linda - Female punk who usually carries a whip. She's not very strong
column2: as she falls down to ground with a couple of punches or a single kick (because of this
column3: she is the only regular-sized enemy who cannot be placed on a headlock).

column1: * Abobo - A tall
column2: big-muscled bald guy. His attacks includes punches
column3: a standing kick and a body toss. He can also lift and throw heavy objects like Rowper. Due to his large size
column4: he cannot be put into a headlock.

column1: * Boss 1 - The first boss
column2: a head-swap of Abobo with a Mr. T-style mohawk and beard. Fights just like Abobo
column3: only with an added double-handed slap. Unlike Abobo
column4: he does not use weapons. A green version of him appears as the Mission 3 boss.

column1: * Boss 2 - The second boss. A head swap of the player who uses almost all the same techniques.
* Willy - The game's final boss
column2: armed
column3: somewhat unfairly
column4: with a machine-gun.

column1: Double Dragon was a huge success due to the many game-play innovations it brought to the genre (see TRIVIA for details)
column2: but it demonstrates its final moment of inspired genius at the very end of the game. Should both players still be alive after the final boss has been defeated
column3: they will then have to fight each OTHER. The winner of this fight will be the one who wins Marian's affections."

column1: 928;ddragon2;ddragon2;"Double Dragon II - The Revenge (c) 1988 Technos Japan Corp.
;Following his defeat at the end of the original Double Dragon
column2: Willy
column3: the leader of the Black Warriors
column4: retaliates against Billy and Jimmy Lee by murdering their friend
column5: Marian
column6: leaving the brothers with the task to avenge her death.

column1: The sequel to Double Dragon is essentially an upgraded version of the original game
column2: but with with a two-way attacking system similar to one previously used in Technos Japan's 1986 arcade game ""Renegade"". Many of the attacks and combos from the original ""Double Dragon"" are retained
column3: as well as new techniques including the invincible Cyclone Kick.

column1: The stages and weapons are redesigned versions of items previously featured in the original game. There are a few new traps such as a bulldozer in the middle of Mission 3 and all of the transition sequences between stages are now done with the character entering the next level via a lift
column2: making it impossible to carry one weapon to the next area.

column1: Most of the enemy characters return from the original Double Dragon
column2: with some given facelifts
column3: but the stage bosses are all new. The enemies are as followed :

column1: * Williams - Has a wilder face and longer hair. He can now run towards the player and do cartwheels. He throws his knives in mid-air and sometimes carry a shovel which he throws towards the player.
* Rowper - Has a beard and eye-patch
column2: but otherwise is more or less identical to his original self. He carries shovels and can sometime pick up large objects.

column1: * Linda - She now has a mohawk and face paint. She can also jump off platforms and do the elbow strike against the player. In addition to the ball and chain
column2: she also carries grenades and knives.

column1: * Oharra - A strongman with a clean-shaved face. Replaces Abobo from the first game and has the same attacks.
* Bolo - A head-swap of Oharra with long hair and beard. Replaces the mohawked head-swap of Abobo from the first game.
* Jeff - Same as his original self
column2: but now carries grenades.

column1: * Burnov - The boss of Mission 1. An obese wrestler whose face is concealed with a mask. He grabs the player and throws similar punches in the face. After dying
column2: he will stand up and yell
column3: disappearing in front of the player and leaving only his clothes. In later encounters
column4: he will revive himself at least once.

column1: * Abore - The boss of Mission 2. A huge suspender-wearing strongman with Terminator-like sunglasses. His slaps and shoulder tackles do massive damage to the player.
* Chin Taimei - The boss of Mission 3. A Chinese martial artists armed with twin kali sticks. In addition to his energy-draining stick combo
column2: he also has a jump kick and sweep kick.

column1: * Willy - The boss of Mission 4. Looks like he does in the original game
column2: but now dresses in red. He still uses the same machine gun from the first game.

column1: * The clone - After defeating Willy
column2: the player will have to fight their character's evil self. This clone has all the techniques the player has
column3: but can also throw energy beams and possess the player's body to drain his energy."

959;defender;defender;Defender (c) 1980 Williams.

;Defender is a legendary sideways-scrolling shoot-em-up - the very first of its genre - in which the aim is to pilot a laser-firing spaceship and protect humanoids stranded on the planet's surface from swarms of alien abductors.

A long-range scanner at the top of the screen shows the positions of both the humanoids and the attacking aliens. The ideal strategy is to shoot down the alien ships before they reach the humanoids. If a humanoid is captured
column2: the alien abductor can still be destroyed
column3: but the player must then catch the falling humanoid and return it to the safety of the planet's surface before it falls to its death.

column1: If an alien is allowed to carry its victim to the very top of the screen
column2: the humanoid will mutate
column3: becoming a permanent part of the alien that captured it. This new and deadly mutation will then immediately join in the alien attack.

column1: The challenge becomes more intense as action progresses. Fighter ships and their mines will soon join the abductors. There are also mother ships that must be destroyed; these are particularly difficult as a direct hit smashes the mother ship into a swarming mass of mini-ships that must also be wiped out. Throughout the entire mission
column2: the player must act quickly or face possible destruction by the cosmic baiter
column3: a fast and dangerous enemy.

column1: Players have two escape options to use as a last resort. The first is the 'smart bomb'
column2: which destroys all on-screen enemies. The second option is 'hyperspace'
column3: which randomly teleports the player's ship to another part of the level. This is highly risky as it may place the player's ship in a position more dangerous than the one it left.

column1: If all humanoids are successfully abducted
column2: the planet will explode in a blinding flash and the waves remaining until the next planet is reached take place in outer space
column3: and consist solely of destroying enemy waves."

column1: Players have two escape options to use as a last resort. The first is the 'smart bomb'
column2: which destroys all on-screen enemies. The second option is 'hyperspace'
column3: which randomly teleports the player's ship to another part of the level. This is highly risky as it may place the player's ship in a position more dangerous than the one it left.

column1: If all humanoids are successfully abducted
column2: the planet will explode in a blinding flash and the waves remaining until the next planet is reached take place in outer space
column3: and consist solely of destroying enemy waves."
