column1: 3139;radarzon;radarzon;"Radar Zone (c) 1982 Century Electronics.
3140;radm;radmu;Rad Mobile (c) 1990 Sega.
;Another in the long line of ground-breaking racing games from Sega
column2: Rad Mobile is a twenty stage race across America; starting in Los Angeles and finishing in New York. With the game's release
column3: Sega yet again introduced new gameplay elements to the genre
column4: primarily in the form of dynamic weather effects. Sega's 1989 racer
column5: ""Turbo Out Run""
column6: also included limited weather effects
column7: but they were far less prominent as a gameplay feature and a good deal less impressive than they are here.

column1: Another Sega innovation is that many of Rad Mobile's stages have banked corners; with the car's cockpit view tilting to match the driving surface. Some stages also have police patrols
column2: and players must either avoid or outrun the police cars or risk being pulled over. Being pulled over will result in a loss of valuable seconds.

column1: In addition to the tight time limit
column2: rival drivers (represented as red cars) and heavy
column3: two-way traffic
column4: players now had to contend with heavy rain
column5: thick fog and darkness. Windscreen wipers and headlights had to be manually switched on by the player which
column6: together with the first-person in-car view
column7: gave a more realistic and interactive feel to standard but undeniably superb racing action."

column1: 3141;radr;radr;"Rad Rally (c) 1991 Sega Enterprises
column2: Limited.

column1: ;An update of Sega's ""Rad Mobile""
column2: Rad Rally offered a choice of 4 different courses (Sunset
column3: Rain
column4: Night and Mountain). A fully working rear view mirror was introduced and arcade operators were also given the option of a link-up cabinet for 2-player
column5: head-to-head racing."

column1: 3142;radrad;radrad;"Radical Radial (c) 1982 Nichibutsu USA Corp.
;This is an interesting take on the shooter genre
column2: with three unique sections in each stage. You control a tire with the ability to jump and shoot. When you jump
column3: you can only be hit by the enemies in the first stage.

column1: In the first level
column2: you need to dodge or jump over rocks as bat-like enemies rush down the screen
column3: weaving across it. Occasionally a string of enemies will appear that give a bonus of 1000 if you hit them all. You can also pick up bonus items worth 300 points each.

column1: In the second level
column2: you are driving down a busy road. You need to doge cars as they erratically move across the screen. Occasionally an ambulance will drive up the screen
column3: and if it hits a vehicle it will go flying across the screen. Watch out for the blue trucks in this section. Midway through this part
column4: a green truck appears which drops stars. They are worth 500 each. There are broken down vehicles on the road
column5: along with oil slicks. The pickups worth 300 points make a return.

column1: The third level is a bonus round. You continue driving down the road
column2: but now there are only oil slicks. You need to collect as many point pickups as possible. If you die in this section
column3: it jumps to the next level
column4: and you do not lose a life. You get a bonus if you get every pickup. You are then given a bonus based on your time for the last stage.

column1: There is a difficulty spike at the third stage. The extra life is at 50000. You only get one extra life during the course of the game. The game is infinite."
3143;raflesia;raflesia;"Rafflesia (c) 1986 Sega.
;A deep space shooter from Coreland - it has a similar eerie feel to it as in other space shooters such as ""Brain"" and ""4-D Warriors"".
The game scrolls vertically as you maneuver your ship through hordes of enemies while collecting the tears of Rafflesia to power up your weapons. Each sector has a large boss enemy to defeat.
Can you survive to reach the final battle against Rafflesia himself?"
3144;ragnagrd;ragnagrd;"Shin-Oh-Ken (c) 1996 Saurus.

;Pre-rendered pixelation puts somewhat of a damper on this Japanese fantasy fighter. Eight selectable characters and three end bosses.

;A great maze chase game.
The players take the lead of beautiful Rika Midorikawa
column2: a heroine of bikers
column3: in order to rescue her kidnapped brother
column4: she must ride her 3 wheeled jet vehicle to challenge and explores the labyrinths while collect all the dots and pick the power-ups to defeat or avoid all the enemies in each stage
column5: to open the exits and destroy the big bosses and win to rescue his captive brother."

column1: 3154;rainbow;rbisland;"Rainbow Islands - The Story of Bubble Bobble 2 (c) 1987 Taito.
;In this sequel to the legendary ""Bubble Bobble"" - released a year earlier - one or two players (who
column2: unlike 'Bubble Bobble'
column3: no longer play simultaneously) take on the role of Bub and Bob

3164;rampage;rampage;Rampage (c) 1986 Bally Midway.
;Rampage is a classic B-movie inspired smash-em-up in which up to three players take on the roles of three mutated monsters - George the giant ape
column2: Lizzie the giant lizard and Ralph the giant wolf - who move from city to city destroying skyscrapers and vehicles
column3: while eating or killing any people that get in their way.

column1: The monsters' health can be damaged in a number of ways: by being shot by National Guardsmen
column2: by being hit by another monster
column3: by falling from a building
column4: by being hit by police cars or tanks
column5: by going underwater
column6: by being struck by lightning
column7: or by eating something bad
column8: such as dynamite. Health is replenished by eating food found in damaged buildings.

column1: If the players' health gauge diminishes completely
column2: the monsters will revert back to their original human form and walk sideways off the screen. Rampage has a ""buy back in"" option
column3: however; if players chose to continue the game before the human figure leaves the play area
column4: the game will continue from that stage.

column1: Rampage is set over the course of 128 days in cities across North America. The game starts in Peoria
column2: Illinois and ends in Plano
column3: Illinois. In Plano
column4: players receive a mega vitamin bonus which heals all the monsters and provides a large point bonus. After this
column5: the cycle of cities repeats five times. After 768 days
column6: the game resets back to Day One.

column1: * Examples of bonuses and hazards found inside damaged buildings:
Food: Milk
column2: Turkey
column3: Hot Toast
column4: Fruit

column1: Bonus: Flower Pot
column2: TV Set
column3: Money Bag

column1: Hazard: Cactus
column2: Poison
column3: Toaster

column1: * Examples of bonuses and hazards found outside damaged buildings:
Bonus: Auto (or Truck)
column2: Commuter Train
column3: Person in Manhole

column1: Hazard: National Guard Tank
column2: Police Car
column3: Storm Cloud

column1: Further bonus points can be earned by grabbing a fleeing 'Townie' from a building window. This has two benefits: 1) While holding the Townie
column2: all swat team members disappear from the building windows and 2) accumulating points are scored during the time the Townie is held."

column1: 3166;rampart;rampart;"Rampart (c) 1990 Atari Games.

;Rampart is a superb arcade puzzle game in which up to three players must build up a castle using Tetris shaped pieces to form a castle wall and enclose their keep. Each player must then place a limited number of cannons inside their castle wall before the timer expires. Once the cannons have been placed the battle itself begins. Players must target their cannons onto the enemy's castle (or
column2: in the one-player game
column3: enemy ships and peons) and destroy as much of the enemy army as possible before the time limit expires.

column1: Once the battle is over the players must repair their castles
column2: again using tetris shapes. The players' Keep must be completely encircled with castle wall or the game is over. In the single-player sea attack game
column3: any enemy ships that manage to reach the coast nearest the player will unload peons that will attack the player's castle by land."

column1: 3176;rayforce;rayforce;"Rayforce (c) 1993 Taito Corp.
;A great vertically scrolling shooter
column2: featuring a lock-on secondary weapon.

column1: The player is provided with a powerful ship called the RVA-818 X-LAY
column2: which is outfitted with two weapons: a primary weapon that fires straight lasers and increases in power when the player accumulates power-ups
column3: and a secondary lock-on missile launcher
column4: which can also be increased in power
column5: that can target up to eight enemies at once by moving the targeting reticle. This weapon is used to attack enemies that appear on a lower plane than that of your aircraft
column6: which are inaccessible to the player's primary weapon.

column1: The plot centers in the distant future
column2: human governments
column3: across the planet Earth
column4: construct a massive supercomputer
column5: named ""Con-Human"". The purpose of this computer is to govern the planet's environmental systems
column6: verifying proper nutrients and care is provided to ensure the culture of humans and animal alike.

column1: However
column2: disaster strikes when
column3: after a cloned human's mind is linked with the system
column4: Con-Human becomes sentient and insane. It begins to induce calamities across the planet
column5: constructing corrupt clones of existing organisms
column6: destroying its human masters and exterminating the nature it was intended to protect
column7: apparently intending to replace everything with what Con-Human considers improved versions of themselves.

column1: After prolonged war
column2: Con-Human has succeeded in exterminating 99.8% of humankind
column3: with the remnants fleeing to space colonies. Meanwhile
column4: Con-Human remakes the very interior of Earth. As a result
column5: Earth
column6: as humanity knew it
column7: has utterly ceased to exist
column8: transformed into a planet-sized mobile fortress that is in fact Con-Human's body. Con-Human intends to use the transformed Earth to seek out and destroy the colonies
column9: erasing all remaining traces of old life from the universe and leaving only the new life that it personally created. Now
column10: taking the full-scale offensive
column11: mankind develops powerful ships
column12: one of them the RVA-818 X-LAY starfighter
column13: to fight the oppressive machine by destroying the now-infected Earth entirely."

column1: 3178;raystorm;raystormj;"レイストーム (c) 1996 Taito Corporation.
;(Ray Storm)
3-D follow up to Rayforce featuring a lock-on laser system.
A sequel of RayForce that does not follow the main plot ""Con-Human"" storyline
column2: to this time the plot consists of eight stages taking place between August 4 and August 7
column3: 2219 AD; the first three stages take place on Earth
column4: the last three at the fictional planet Secilia
column5: and two between them in the orbits of Earth and Secilia
column6: respectively. Whereas RayForce players must head toward Earth to destroy it
column7: RayStorm players start at and move away from the planet. The plot of the game is exposed minimally during play
column8: with only dates and place names given at the start of each of its first seven stages. An ""Extra Mode"" included with home versions of the game displays maps before the first seven stages and a closing crawl after completing the game
column9: which further illustrate the plot; the map for the fifth stage
column10: for example
column11: shows that a ""gravity catapult"" at the Moon is used to travel from Earth orbit to Secilia orbit.

column1: In a future where space travel has existed since 2119. Humans explored space
column2: and within 100 years Earth established a twenty-colony Star Federation extending to Orion
column3: with each colony kept under martial law. The colonies then mutinied against the Federation: they took control of the major colony Secilia
column4: formed the Secilia Federation and defeated Earth's forces after many battles. After Earth's surrender
column5: all of its inhabitants had been transferred to the colonies. The Secilia Federation suppressed colonial opposition and sent out a force to destroy the planet completely. However
column6: by then the R-Gray
column7: a aircraft made with parts salvaged from 13 different Secilia ships
column8: is completed and deployed to carry out OPERATION RAYSTORM
column9: a desperate attempt to defend Earth from the Federation."

column1: 3187;rckman2j;rockman2j;"Rockman 2 - The Power Fighters (c) 1996 Capcom.

;Building upon the previous game, you must battle Dr. Wily's evil robot criminals with the help of Megaman, Protoman, Bass & Duo. Features cool 2-D graphics and the same tried & true Mega Man controls. Pay attention to Dr. Light's advice and you may reach Dr. Wily's fortress and come out victorious!
3188;rdaction;rdaction;Rad Action (c) 1987 World Games.
3189;reactor;reactor;Reactor (c) 1982 Gottlieb.
;The player controls a cursor that can move freely within a screen-sized arena
column2: the nuclear reactor. The center contains a sun-type gravitational power source
column3: the slowly overheating reactor core. The surrounding wall or the sun
column4: if touched results in death. The cursor is controlled with a trackball by the player
column5: who has to roll it fast in one direction in order to overcome the momentum of gravitation imposed by the sun. Swarms of enemy objects named after various radioactive particles float around in the reactor arena
column6: obeying simple physical laws. These enemies can freely bounce into the walls at low speeds
column7: have a repulsive force against each other and actively attack the player cursor. Boss types often break up into several smaller particles.

column1: The object is to survive the sun and walls while gaining the highest score possible. It takes a delicate touch. Rather than moving the cursor/avatar left
column2: right
column3: up and down as in many arcade games
column4: it is controlled by gravity and moves freely; with the player only being able to accelerate it rather than control its movements directly. Meanwhile the enemy particles are getting so aggressive that it can get very difficult to avoid being pulled in by the sun or touching a wall.

column1: The basic gameplay consists of accelerating the cursor just at the right times so that it circles the reactor core with enough speed to have control via its own momentum when the enemy particles try to knock it off course
column2: and then to place decoys and actually use the acceleration of the ball itself to knock enemies into control rods
column3: traps or the reactor core. By pressing the primary button the player cursor can go into high power mode
column4: providing higher repulsion of enemies and conversely higher risk to the player.

column1: To ease the task the player also has a certain number of decoys at their disposal. Pressing the secondary button places a decoy to attract the enemies
column2: luring them into two traps in the corners of the screen for bonus points
column3: into destroying reactor rods or directly into the walls to kill them. Destroying a row of reactor rods gives the player one more decoy
column4: as well as resetting the size of the slowly swelling reactor core.

column1: A time limit is enforced by the slowly swelling reactor core
column2: which limits the space to move about in the arena. Although the reactor doesn't actually melt down
column3: the decreasing space provides for gradually increasing difficulty. After defeating the first wave of enemies
column4: the solid reactor core changes into Vortex core
column5: unlike the Protect core
column6: is lethal to touch (thus making such levels significantly harder)."

3192;redalert;redalert;Red Alert (c) 1981 GDI
column2: Incorporated.

column1: ;FIRST ATTACK IN DAYLIGHT - BOMBERS IN FORMATION WITH ATTACKING AIRCRAFT. This sequence is introduced both audibly and visually : Red alert. Enemy aircraft approaching. 20 jet fighters approaching. Destroy all fighters by 11:00 hours
column2: or MIRV will be launched.

column1: In this sequence
column2: bombers in formation move from left to right across the screen
column3: and then from right to left
column4: etc. During the attack
column5: some break formation and attack the launcher. The aircraft drop bombs in an attempt to hit the launcher. Also during the attack
column6: a special red colored aircraft flying above the aircraft formation appears and drops a red colored megaton bomb that slowly descends on the country. When hours reach 11:00
column7: present fighter attack is interrupted by a flashing CAUTION on screen
column8: followed by appearance of the MIRV.

column1: The MIRV slowly descends
column2: then breaks up into several bombs. They
column3: in turn
column4: also break up into several bombs. As a result
column5: a shower of bombs slowly descends on the country.

column1: Player participation during the attack is to destroy all aircraft by firing rocket launcher. During the attack
column2: player is to avoid direct hits by bombs - each of which costs him one rocket launcher. Also during the attack
column3: the player must destroy the red bomb before it lands
column4: or one rocket launcher is destroyed.

column1: When MIRV appears
column2: player must destroy it completely - otherwise the landing of any one will cost the player one launcher.

column1: SECOND ATTACK BY HELICOPTERS - DROPPING PARACHUTE BOMBS. Introduced by : Helicopter squadron attacking! Destroy helicopters by 16:00 hours
column2: or MIRV will be launched.

column1: Player participation during attack is to destroy all aircraft by firing rocket launcher. During the attack
column2: player is to keep his launcher away from red areas created by exploding bombs - or lose a launcher. Both helicopters and bombs may be destroyed by rockets. However
column3: if the parachute
column4: but not the bomb
column5: is hit
column6: the deflated parachute will drop the bomb much faster.

column1: MIRV attack
column2: if launched
column3: is a repeat of the first sequence above.

column1: THIRD ATTACK AT NIGHT - HEAVY BOMBERS IN FORMATION. Introduced by : Red alert.  Night attack by bombers.
The player is aided by two searchlights. The object is to destroy all aircraft. When all aircraft are destroyed
column2: game progresses to next frame (country). During the attack
column3: the player must avoid direct hits by bombs. No time limit is imposed. No MIRV will be launched.

column1: GAME FRAMES. Game repeats above cycles through the following countries
column2: respectively : FRANCE
column3: USA
column4: ITALY
column5: GREAT BRITAIN
column6: GERMANY
column7: and JAPAN. However
column8: as the game progresses from frame to frame
column9: the action of the game is stepped up.

column1: HOW LAUNCHERS ARE LOST. Rocket launchers are lost by :
* A direct hit by a dropped bomb
* Red bomb dropped by red plane lands anywhere
* Launcher is in red area created by exploding parachute bomb
* MIRV lands anywhere"
3193;redbaron;redbaron;"Red Baron (c) 1980 Atari
column2: Incorporated.

column1: ;Red Baron is a realistic flying simulation. Your player is a World War I fighter pilot searching the skies for the enemy. The horizon shifts and tilts as he maneuvers the joystick. Three dimensional hills and valleys sweep by below.
Suddenly out of the horizon
column2: an enemy biplane appears. The pilot dives
column3: climbs
column4: lines up the plane in his sights! He fires a deadly hail of tracers and the enemy airplane tumbles to earth.

column1: But watch out
column2: there are more coming. The first four planes are relatively slow. As time progresses
column3: the player moves more quickly and the enemy planes take more evasive action
column4: adding to the difficulty and challenge.

column1: Next the player faces ground targets. An observation blimp floats into view over a low rise of hills. Bright ground objects start to appear
column2: a tank
column3: a pill-box
column4: then dimmer targets
column5: a pyramid
column6: a building. They make good targets for strafing runs but danger can appear at any time.

column1: As the game progresses
column2: tanks
column3: pill-boxes and blimps will begin shooting back.  The game is composed of randomly alternating series of ground and plane phases. Finally

column1: 3208;repulse;repulse;"Repulse (c) 1985 Sega.
;Repulse is a 1985 arcade game by Sega. It was renamed 99: The Last War when licensed to Kyugo (who developed the hardware) and Proma. There's also a bootleg version of it named Son of Phoenix.

column5: that bring to the player a new shot(much faster than the normal one) and refills the ship's force field meter."

column1: 3209;rescraid;rescraid;"Rescue Raider (c) 1987 Bally Midway.

;Rescue Raider is a multiple-screen shooter arcade game that was released by Bally Midway in 1987; it was the last title to run on Bally and Sente's SAC-I hardware. The player uses two 8-way joysticks to take  control of a futuristic vehicle. The left joystick is for moving while the right one is for firing. There is also a single button
column2: with which to cycle through the three different types of special weapons. Its mission is to gather secret documents which shall reveal what an area of the radar map on the screen's right side is hiding - and it can also take enemy soldiers as hostages
column3: refuel and earn more powerful weapons."

column1: 3211;rescue;rescue;"Rescue (c) 1982 Stern Electronics.
;The player pilots a rescue helicopter and must try to rescue numerous airmen who have parachuted into the sea below. The rescue chopper is under constant attack from enemy helicopters
column2: while sharks swim in the ocean below and will kill any floating airmen they come across. Later levels also have enemy subs and ships all intent on foiling the rescue mission. Players must be careful to avoid the falling wreckage of any enemy helicopters they have just destroyed
column3: and also need to be wary of hitting any parachuting airmen with their 'copter blades
column4: as this will kill the airmen instantly.

column1: In a very similar vein to Williams' legendary ""Robotron""
column2: also released in '82
column3: the rescue chopper is armed with a gun that can fire in eight different directions
column4: irrespective of the direction the rescue chopper is flying in. In addition to the eight-way gun
column5: the 'copter can also drop missiles from its underside
column6: which is essential for destroying enemy subs and ships.

column1: To complete a stage
column2: players must pick up a set number of fallen airmen from the sea (determined at the start of each level) and deposit them safely onto a nearby island."

;Ribbit! is a one or co-operative two-player abstract arcade game and is an unofficial sequel to Konami's seminal 1981 release
column2: ""Frogger"".

column1: Unlike its legendary prequel (in which players had to guide a frog to his home at top of each screen without being killed) the aim here is to guide a toad around a screen
column2: eating benign insects - such as Ants and Dragon-flies - while avoiding harmful ones - such as Spiders and Rats. A level is only complete once a set amount of insects have been eaten.

column1: Ribbit's stages take place over a number of different locations
column2: including a sandy desert
column3: a beach and - in tribute to the original game - on a fast flowing river with logs and turtles acting as platforms.

column1: Bonus points are awarded if a stage is completed within 60 seconds - with the amount earned dictated by how quickly the stage is completed. A bonus round also appears after every third stage
column2: in which players must run over as many of either flowers or mushrooms as possible to make them bloom."

column1: 3219;ridefgtj;ridingfj;"Riding Fight (c) 1992 Taito Corporation.

An end-of-level boss awaits the players and must be destroyed before the players can progress to the next level.

;Riot City is a side-scrolling beat-em-up for one or two players who take on the roles of 'Paul' or 'Bobby'
column2: two talented fighters who are given the task of breaking a drug syndicate known as ""MID"". It has also been discovered that Paul's girlfriend has been kidnapped by the syndicate and must be rescued.

column1: MID's hideout is located on Riot Island
column2: an island full of abandoned
column3: run-down buildings that has since become a slum. Locations include apartments
column4: a hospital
column5: a factory and a casino.

column1: Riot City is practically a direct copy of Capcom's superb 'Final Fight'
column2: with both gameplay and graphical style heavily copied from the 1989 classic. One gameplay difference is that Riot City does not allow players to pick up and use weapons as they can in Final Fight
column3: although bonus items found in various containers can be collected."

column1: 3242;ripcord;ripcord;"Rip Cord (c) 1979 Exidy.

;The goal of the game is to jump out of the plane and land safely on one of the many targets down below. The challenge is to avoid the numerous enemy helicopters that occupy the sky in between your plane and the ground.
You control the timing of your jump with the Jump button
column2: at which point your parachutist begins hurtling toward the ground out of control. Pressing the D-Ring button shortly afterwards releases the chute and slows your descent. More importantly
column3: it allows you at this point to control your left/right position via the paddle control to help you avoid the enemies."

column1: 3243;ripoff;ripoff;"Rip Off (c) 1980 Cinematronics.

;RIP OFF is a 1- or 2-player action game that offers features guaranteed to capture and prolong player interest : an accelerating competitive level with a clearly visible object and a team competition option that allows players to combine scores as well as skills in defense strategy against a futuristic enemy.
The center of the playfield is occupied by a selectable number of triangular fuel cells that pulsate with radioactive energy. The player commandeers a land craft that turns left
column2: right
column3: accelerates and fires torpedo energy bursts activated by push-buttons mounted on the ""bridge"" control panel. All is quiet as the background audio repeats an ominous low frequency tone. Suddenly
column4: alien craft enter in waves from the edges of the playfield attempting to attach their vehicles to the fuel cells and drag them off to restock their own dwindling supplies. The player maneuvers his land ship into position and fires a volley of torpedoes at the first invader
column5: causing his vehicle to explode in a thunderous roar and a flash of light. A second invader retaliates by firing short range laser bursts at the defender ship while a third invader escapes
column6: dragging off a precious fuel cell. The background audio quickens its pitch and tempo as another wave of sleeker
column7: faster invaders attack and maneuver to rip off fuel canisters - and the battle rages on!

column1: GAME PLAY

The 1-player mode is activated when a coin is accepted and the player pushes the 1-player button. As play begins the first player's vehicle appears on the right side of the screen and moves slightly forward. The enemy vehicles then appear in pairs from various points on the edge of the screen and gravitate toward the player and the triangles. The enemies fire lasers while they move. The player scores points by either shooting the enemy or colliding with him before the enemy can shoot the player
column2: collide with him or drag his triangle off the screen. When a player's vehicle is exploded
column3: it reappears on the right side of the screen where it began.

column1: When a player has sufficient points to achieve a bonus level
column2: the enemies will appear three at a time instead of in pairs and their point value increases. Each bonus level increases the enemies' point value
column3: as well as their ability to seek out and destroy the player. When all the triangles have been dragged off the screen
column4: the game is over and the unit reverts to attract mode.

column1: The 2-player mode is activated when two coins have been accepted and a player pushes the two player button. As play begins
column2: the first player's vehicle appears on the right side of the screen and the second player's vehicle appears on the left. Both vehicles move forward slightly. Enemy vehicles then appear in groups of three and attack the players and seek to drag off the triangles. Players score points by colliding with the enemy vehicles or shooting them. No points are scored by shooting or colliding with the other player. Should the players' ships collide
column3: an explosion will occur and the players' vehicles will reappear at the points where they began.

column1: In the 2-player operator selectable opponent mode
column2: individual scores are displayed after each wave of attackers are destroyed or successfully leave the screen. In the team mode
column3: the combined score of both defenders is displayed. At the end of the game
column4: when all fuel canisters have been removed
column5: the individual high score for the day is displayed at the bottom of the screen and the high team score is displayed at the top.

column1: A player achieves bonus levels in which the value of each invader vehicle is increased by the displayed amount of the bonus. There are six different types of invader vehicles
column2: each wave becoming increasingly offensive and more difficult to destroy. The point bonus is in effect after six waves
column3: the full compliment of ship types
column4: have been destroyed. There are three similar craft in a wave
column5: and in the two player mode twelve waves must be eliminated before bonus goes into effect.

column1: There are no time units per game credit
column2: and the battle goes on until all fuel canisters have been ""ripped off"" from the playfield. The length of play is solely dependent upon the skill of the player - but it takes an experienced
column3: practiced captain to hold off the swift invaders for long!"

column3: resulting in his being caught by Wile E Cayote. A 'Seed Meter' at the top of the screen indicates Road Runner's seed enery level.

column1: Road Runner's colourful
column2: beautifully-drawn graphics capture the spirit and humour of the legendary cartoons perfectly. The music and sound effects are also faithful to the cartoon series."

column1: 3268;robby;robby;"Robby Roto (c) 1981 Bally Midway.

;When playing this game. YOU are ROTO's mentor. He takes his directions ONLY from YOU and will do your bidding exclusively. YOU determine the strategies he will use to defeat the evil monster VOLTAR who has invaded the Earth
column2: stealing all types of treasures and burying them deep within the earth. VOLTAR also takes hostages and seals them in vaults deep within the earth.

column1: There is only one way to save the hostages and recover the stolen treasures. We must send in ROTO. He will follow VOLTAR right into his own home tunnels to rescue the hostages and recover the stolen treasures VOLTAR has salted away.
To say the least
column2: this makes VOLTAR more than just a little bit upset with ROTO. To help protect his stolen treasures and kidnapped hostages. VOLTAR has developed a breed of giant SPIDER that can sense ROTO's location and that can also travel through solid earth. These SPIDERS attempt to corner and capture ROTO. And to direct their hunt for ROTO
column3: VOLTAR turns himself into a TROLL that can travel through solid earth.

column1: If and when ROTO is captured by the SPIDERS or the TROLL
column2: he is forcibly ejected from VOLTAR’s tunnels and you loose one player.

column1: As your skill level increases and you get into the higher racks of the game
column2: the ability of the SPIDERS and the TROLL to sense ROTO's location increases. This makes ROTO's chances of survival considerably smaller And VOLTAR
column3: being what he is
column4: has reinforcements in the form of a set of disembodied TEETH that he can call on to help him track ROTO down and put the bite on him. These TEETH also have the ability to travel through solid earth.

column1: ROTO has no reinforcements he can call on to help him defend himself against his enemies. He has ONLY YOUR SKILL at maneuvering and forming strategies plus one use of the MAGIC button (which makes ROTO and any hostages he has with hlm invisible to all monsters for a short period of time) per rack to keep him safe as he carries out his rescue missions.

Bonus ROTOs are awarded to you periodically throughout the game: after you complete every third rack of the game. Each recaptured treasure and rescued hostage has an assigned point value as listed below. In the 2 times and 3 times racks
column2: the values of all items are doubled or tripled respectively."

column1: 3269;roboarmy;roboarmy;"Robo Army (c) 1991 SNK [Shin Nihon Kikaku].

;Two robotic soldiers attempt to stop the robots and their master from enslaving the human race.
3270;robocop;robocop;RoboCop - The Future of Law Enforcement (c) 1988 Data East.
;A single player
column2: side-scrolling platform shoot-em-up based on the 1987 movie of the same name. The game's story mirrors that of the film
column3: with former cop Murphy
column4: now a half-human cyborg called 'RoboCop'
column5: on a quest to bring down the evil OCP corporation.

column1: RoboCop features nine levels of action
column2: with two of the game's nine stages being into-the-screen target ranges
column3: in which players can try to accrue bonus points and earn extra health. Wooden crates occasionally bar RoboCop's progress
column4: but these can be punched to remove them. Marked crates can be smashed to reveal one of three Weapon power-ups; Three-way Gun
column5: Dual Laser and the incredibly powerful Cobra Gun.

column1: The film's incidental music plays throughout the game and RoboCop's speech is sampled directly from the original film."
3271;robocop2;robocop2;"RoboCop 2 (c) 1991 Data East.

;An arcade-only sequel to the 1988 original, placing less of an emphasis on platform action than the face game and concentrating almost exclusively on the shooting aspect.

3277;robocp2u;robocop2ua;RoboCop 2 (c) 1991 Data East.
;In the 21st century
column2: a blast of cosmic radiation bombarded Terra-12
column3: a deep-space outpost of Earth
column4: hideously mutating all transplanted life. A fleet of savage beings followed the radiation wave and invaded the planet
column5: and began the systematic destruction of all remaining sentient life. Years of battling the alien 'governors' have gone by
column6: and now only one hope survives to avenge the desperate Terran colonists.

column1: The player controls the Atomic Robo-Kid through six stages of increasing difficulty
column2: facing an alien ""governor"" boss
column3: which are so large as to be considered levels themselves
column4: followed by a ""duel"" level against other Robo-Kid sized robots. Many levels branch into others
column5: giving the player the choice over which zone to enter next
column6: increasing replayability.

column1: Robo-Kid can collect four different weapons. Whichever weapon is selected is lost when Robo-kid loses a life. In addition to his default gun
column2: Robo-Kid is able collect powerups for a shield that activates on enemy contact
column3: rapid fire
column4: and speed powerups. The player can also encounter a friendly dinosaur-looking robot that sells weapons and shields to Robo-kid using extra lives as currency."

column1: 3281;robotbwl;robotbwl;"Robot Bowl (c) 1977 Exidy.
;You have a top down view of a bowling alley with score cards shown on each side. The only thing in the game that uses an actual animation is the bowler himself
column2: the robot has a several frame animation when he walks. Everything is (of course) shown in glorious monochrome black and white. The game begins with your robot bowler running up to the alley (his feet move faster than he does
column3: which makes it look like he is running on a conveyor belt or something). You then have three seconds to roll the ball
column4: before it will roll of its own accord. The game is controlled with five buttons
column5: they are left
column6: right
column7: shoot
column8: hook left
column9: and hook right. When Exidy was making this game
column10: they had to make a decision about how the hooking worked
column11: and it seems that they decided that ""Robots are telepaths
column12: and can effect the balls movement after it is thrown!"". You see you can't even hook the ball until after it is thrown. This makes it very easy to pick up the spare. The game makes up for that little trick by making 'splits' very common (the 7-10 split and the 4-7-10 split come up all the time). These are pretty annoying
column13: but you can usually learn how to clear them out (except the 7-10 split
column14: I still haven't figured out how to clear that one)."

column1: 3282;robotron;robotron;"Robotron: 2084 (c) 1982 Williams.
;Set in the year 2084
column2: Robotron is a single-screen shoot-em-up in which super-intelligent self-aware robots known as 'Robotrons' - designed and built to help mankind - have revolted against their creators and vowed to either reprogram the humans into Robotrons or
column3: failing this
column4: wipe-out the human race entirely.

column1: The player must destroy the robots and rescue the Earth's remaining human families. The player's only weapon is a multi-directional Anti-Robot Laser Gun. Used effectively
column2: it will give players the power to destroy all the Robot waves
column3: with the exception of the indestructible 'Hulk' unit.

column1: At the start of the attack wave
column2: players will have three chances to wipe out the enemy and advance to the next wave. Every 25
column3: 000 points players are granted another chance to complete their mission.

column1: MAN
column2: WOMAN
column3: CHILD: These are the only three types of human clones left on Earth. Defenseless and easy prey to the Robots
column4: they are totally dependent upon players for their survival and will wander aimlessly until the player makes contact with them. Touching them will place them under the player's protective powers and earn them the following points: 1
column5: 000 for rescuing the 1st human; 2
column6: 000 for the 2nd: 3
column7: 000 for the 3rd; 4
column8: 000 for the 4th; 5
column9: 000 for the 5th; and 5
column10: 000 for every additional human saved. At the beginning of each new wave and when the player loses a turn
column11: rescue scoring will again begin at 1

column1: - ROBOTRON UNITS -
TANK: Its goal is to kill the player by firing rebounding Shells. Annihilate the Tank for 300 points; the Shell for 50 points.
BRAIN: Red alert. The Brain is the most clever and dangerous of the Robot species. Its two-pronged attack will be launched every fifth wave. If it collides with the player
column2: it will electrocute them where they stand. It also possesses the devastating power to fire Cruise Missiles which will follow the player until either contact is made or they are shot and destroyed. Kill the Brain for 500 points; demolish the Cruise Missile for 75 points.

column1: The victims of the second prong of the Brain's attack are the defenseless humans. If captured
column2: a human will be irreversibly transformed - literally re-programmed by the Brain's incredible mind powers - into a Prog: a Robot that will viciously turn against its own protector
column3: the player. Annihilate the Progs for 100 points or meet a violent death at their hands.

column1: SPHEROID: This pulsating sphere may at first look harmless
column2: but it is the mothership which spawns deadly Enforcer Embryos. Players must try to explode the Spheroid before it ejects the Embryos to earn 1
column3: 000 points.

column1: ENFORCER: The Embryos grow into evil Enforcers. Kill them for 200 points. Let them live and they will lessen the player's chance for survival by launching Enforcer Sparks. Destroy the Sparks for 25 points.
HULK: In all attack waves except every fifth
column2: the Hulk will stalk his prey. He alone of the Robot species cannot be killed. The player's Laser Gun can only slow him down or divert him from his objective of crushing all life from the humans and the player. Players must avoid this Robot at all costs or the mission will be lost at the outset.

column1: GRUNT: The least sophisticated species of Robot is the Grunt. He has no weapon and possesses only minimal intelligence. This does not mean he is to be dealt with lightly. He will single-mindedly pursue players to capture and destroy them. Kill him and score 100 points.
ELECTRODES: The pulsating
column2: immobile Electrodes will attempt to block the player's path. A collision with them means instant death. Fortunately
column3: the Grunts will also be annihilated by contact with the player. Electrodes must be avoided or destroyed with the Laser Gun. In each new attack wave they will assume a different shape
column4: but remain just as deadly if contact is made."

column1: 3284;rockclim;rockclim;"Rock Climber (c) 1981 Taito.
3285;rockmanj;rockmanj;Rockman - The Power Battle (c) 1995 Capcom.

;Have you ever pictured a Rockman game that allows to skip all the platform elements and just grapple against the bosses? That's pretty much the main idea in this game! Choose from Rockman, Protoman or Bass and battle against classic bosses in the series. Features great 2-D graphics, solid control, and a nice use of strategy (since the right order of weapons will rid you of specific enemies in no time!).
3286;rockn;rockn;Rock'n Tread (c) 1999 Jaleco.
3287;rockrage;rockrage;Rock'n Rage (c) 1986 Konami.

;Roc'n Rope is an incredibly difficult yet playable platform game featuring four different levels. The player takes on the role of a an archaeologist whose mission is to return the missing tail feathers to the golden Phoenix. The archaeologist is armed with a harpoon gun and uses it to fire a rope into a platform above
column2: in order to climb up the rope and progress up the level. This is vaguely similar to the superb 'telescopic arm' feature that appeared in Capcom's superb ""Bionic Commando"".

column1: All levels are patrolled by enemies in the form of dinosaurs and cavemen and all are deadly to the touch. Some cavemen will pull on the harpoon rope while the archaeologist is climbing it. This will result in the player falling from the rope and losing a life. The archaeologist is armed with a light ray that will kill the enemies.
A breakdown of the game's four levels :
* The first level is possibly the most difficult in the game. Players begin at the bottom left of the screen and must work their way up to the Roc
column2: who is sitting at the upper right of the screen. There are many layers of ledges coming out from the sides of the screen. While the middle of the screen is open to the sky (except for a few floating platforms). To reach the top
column3: players must use the harpoon gun to climb diagonally back and forth until they reach the top (ensuring that the Phoenix feathers have been collected on the way).

column1: * The second level is set underground. There are a lot of dinosaurs on this screen and far fewer platforms than on the first level. Many of the platforms stretch completely across the screen
column2: so there aren't many pitfalls to be wary of. Once again
column3: players must get the archaeologist to the top of the screen to complete the level.

column1: * The third level is set outdoors. A 'ferris wheel' style rotating platform sits in the center of the screen
column2: but this can be avoided if players don't wish to use it. The easiest route to the top is on the right-hand side of the level.

column1: * The fourth and final level is shaped a little like a mountain. The player's main concern here is a large waterfall in the center of the screen. Players must time their harpoon climb just right to avoid being killed by the deadly waters. Once this level is finished
column2: the game starts over with an increased level of difficulty."

column1: 3291;rodland;rodland;"Rod-Land (c) 1990 Jaleco.
;Rod-Land is a cute and colourful platform game for one or two players in which two fairy sisters - 'Tam' and 'Rit' - must rescue their kidnapped mother from the 'Maboots Tower' fortress.

The fairies are armed with the 'Rods of Sheesanomo' - two magical rods that enable the fairies to catch enemies in a force-field and slam them into the platforms to kill them - and must clear each level of enemies to move onto the next and eventually reach and infiltrate the Tower.
As well as the magical rods used for attacking enemies
column2: the fairies can also create a magical ladder - in a fashion very similar to that used in Taito's ""Rainbow islands"" - which can be utilised anywhere on a level and allows players to reach other platforms or escape from pursuing enemies. Each player can utilise only one magically-created ladder at any one time and the creation of a new ladder removes the previously-created one.

column1: A level is only completed when all enemies have been killed. Some defeated enemies drop bonus items
column2: such as fruit
column3: missiles and bombs.

column1: Each of the game's levels features brightly coloured flowers. If players manage to collect all of these
column2: the 'Extra Game' mode begins. During this time-limited mode all of the level's enemies turn red and move much faster. If the enemies are killed in time
column3: they drop an alphabetic letter that can be collected to spell the word 'EXTRA' and earn players an extra life."

3298;roldfrga;roldfroga;The Return of Lady Frog (c) 1993 Microhard.
;The Return of Lady Frog is an adult puzzle game where the player uses bombs to clear the background and completely reveal the nude photographic image underneath.

Each bomb clears away a nine square grid from the background. Bombs can also be used to clear gray square barriers.  But bombs do no damage to the balloons. if a balloon rolls over the bomb as it explodes then it snuffs out the explosion and reveals nothing. In order to clear the balloons the player can shoot bottle-rockets at them. The balloons explode to drop items for points or break apart into smaller balloons. Balloons labeled with a scull and crossbones cannot be killed and must be avoided. If a player is hit by the balloons then the player is killed. The game is over when the player loses all of his lives."

3304;rollingc;rollingc;2in1: Rolling Crash + Moon Base (c) 1979 Nichibutsu.

;Rolling Crash is a 2-D maze racing game with changes to add to the variety of play. You control your car through the maze to pick up the dots while at the same time avoiding the car, or cars, that are constantly trying to ram you. Successfully get through one maze and many more await you. This is good practice for freeway driving in the big city.
3305;rompers;rompers;Rompers (c) 1989 Namco.
;The player must take up control of Chap a gardener wearing a straw hat
column2: who must collect all the keys in sixty-one maze-inspired gardens in order to rescue his girlfriend
column3: Rumina. He can push the walls in the gardens over to crush the various enemies that pursue him
column4: but they are immediately be resurrected in the form of eggs which hatch after a few seconds. Each round also has a preset time limit to ensure that the player does not dawdle - and once it runs out
column5: a green-haired female vampire known as Tsukaima who cannot be crushed by the walls appears. The game's enemies include white blobs known as Pyokorin
column6: flame-breathing pink Triceratops-esque creatures known as Kerara
column7: armadillos known as Gororin which can roll over Chap
column8: purple seals known as Todorin which can breathe ice
column9: sponges known as Bekabeka
column10: which can push walls onto Chap
column11: turquoise blobs known as Fumajime Pyokorin
column12: which occasionally pause to take a long drag on their cigarettes
column13: helmet-wearing creatures known as Nachibo
column14: which take two crushes to kill
column15: wolves known as Taggus which can throw bombs at Chap
column17: which can spin webs for Chap to run into - and this game's main antagonist
column18: an evil scientist named Gurerin who only appears in the final round
column19: where players not only have to collect all the keys
column20: but also push the walls onto his four clones (two of whom can breathe fire
column21: the other two can breathe ice).

column1: A cutscene called ""The Rompers Show"" also appears after every tenth round
column2: and once Chap has rescued Rumina at the end of the game
column3: they both go back to free Tsukaima (who
column4: ironically
column5: is trapped under a wall
column6: given that she cannot be crushed by them in the game)
column7: and wrap her feet up with bandages; Chap then starts to carry Tsukaima off on his back
column8: which angers Rumina as he went through a lot to save her."

column1: 3307;rongrong;rongrongg;"Puzzle Game Rong Rong (c) 1994 Nakanihon.
;Rong Rong is a style of solitaire mahjong
column2: much like ""Shanghai"" with 3 modes of play
column3: 'sexy girls'
column4: 'rong rong'
column5: and 'battle mode'. All 3 modes feature the same basic style of gameplay. Rong Rong is the basic story mode where finishing each level furthers the storyline. 'Battle mode' is a two player game where two players on a split-screen compete to clear the same board of tiles first. 'Sexy girls' mode involves clearing the board to reveal a scantily clad model in the background. In 'Sexy girls' mode there are additional mini-games between levels which
column6: when completed successfully reveal more risque images of the girl featured in the level."

3309;rougien;rougien;"Rougien (c) 1982 Sanritsu.

;A space shooter style game, with a interesting graphics effects. In this game you controlling a Space Shuttle in his mission to destroy the enemy forces from the vast galaxy.
3310;roundup;roundup;Round-Up [Upright model] (c) 1981 Centuri.

;The object of the game is for the player to maneuver his white robot in 1 of 4 directions within a maze, capture a red character robot as they move about the maze, and race to the center to change the 9 white balls located there to red. The player may only change one white ball to red at a time after he has captured a red robot, and must evade 4 chaser monsters in the process. Bonus point may be earned when capturing the elusive 'red king' that appears on the screen. Capture him and momentarily immobilize the chasers, but do not come in contact with the yellow robots--or your much-needed red robots will be changed to white and force you to change strategy. Play is over when the chasers have captured all of the player's robots. But, should the player be successful in changing all of the balls in the center to red, the pattern clears and a different challenge is presented. A 3x3 or 4x4 tri-colored pattern will appear at the bottom of the screen and a slightly different tri-colored cube of corresponding size will appear at the center of the screen. The player may earn bonus points by moving the directional arrow and rearranging the colors of the cube at the center of the screen to match the sample pattern presented at the bottom of the screen. The player is given 90 seconds to rearrange the cube as many times as he can. Action returns to the maze whether you win or lose the cube challenge. All in all, an exciting and challenging game where patience and skill are required.
3311;route16;route16c;Route 16 (c) 1981 Centuri
column2: Incorporated.

column1: ;Route 16 is a challenging race car game
column2: integrating special features to excite the beginner as well as the seasoned player. The vivid video screen is fascinating
column3: and is complimented by exceptional audio during game play.

column1: The red car is controlled by the joystick feature
column2: and is pursued through 16 different routes (mazes) by three chase cars. The search mode reveals an overview of all 16 routes
column3: and the search mode appears whenever the car exits a route. In the search mode
column4: the player car becomes a red cube
column5: and the chase cars become yellow cubes.

column1: Whenever the player car exits one route
column2: there is a one second delay for a total overview of the game.

column1: Each route has dead-ends
column2: zig-zags
column3: and multiple entrances and exits.

column1: Some routes have the dollar symbol ($)
column2: and the player scores 200 points each time this symbol is cleared. The dollar symbols randomly chance to oil slicks
column3: and when encountered
column4: the oil slicks slow down the player car.

column1: The question mark symbol (?) is surrounded by check points and will either reveal a bomb symbol or a bell mark after the player car clears the check point. The bell will add 800 points to the player's score when cleared. Player skill is tested here to avoid the bomb if it appears.
Some routes have a flag symbol
column2: and when the player car clears the symbol
column3: the pursuing cars become dollar symbols
column4: and every effort should be made by the player to chase them down
column5: and add extra points to his score.

column1: One route has a flickering bonus car symbol. When the symbol appears
column2: clear it and earn an additional player car.

column1: One route has an additional game feature. When the player car enters the maze
column2: it is pursued by an attacking monster. The player car cannot clear or collide with the monster
column3: but must avoid it
column4: or be destroyed.

column1: The high-speed button is another feature of Route 16. When pushed
column2: the player car is accelerated to escape the chase cars. Usage of the high-speed button reduces the player car's fuel. At the end of each round
column3: bonus points are added to the player's score for remaining fuel.

column1: After all the symbols are cleared
column2: the round ends. In successive rounds
column3: additional dollar symbols ($)
column4: and additional enemy chase cars are added."

;A space-themed vertically scrolling shoot'em up that is very similar to

column1: 3323;rthun2;rthun2;"Rolling Thunder 2 (c) 1990 Namco.
;A straight sequel to the superb 1986 original
column2: Rolling Thunder 2 sees one or two players taking control of secret agents in this scrolling
column3: platform shoot-em-up. The agents once again find themselves up against the sinister GERDRA organization and its many armed agents. Gameplay is very similar to the original
column4: with doors both releasing enemies and hiding weapons and ammunition for the players to collect.

column1: Rolling Thunder 2 improves on its illustrious predecessor in a number of ways; the most obvious one being the vastly improved and incredibly colourful graphics. The most striking improvement
column2: however
column3: is the addition of a simultaneous
column4: co-operative two player mode; which adds immeasurably to the game's appeal. For the sequel
column5: the one player agent is a woman
column6: with a second player taking the role of a male agent."

column1: 3325;rthunder;rthunder;"Rolling Thunder (c) 1986 Namco.

;Rolling Thunder is a single-player scrolling platform shoot-em-up in which a James Bond-esque secret agent codenamed 'Albatross' has been ordered by the Rolling Thunder anti-espionage unit to stop the criminal organization known as Geldra. Albatross must also rescue captured field agent
column2: Lelia Blitz and overthrow Geldra's leader
column3: Maboo.

column1: Rolling Thunder's gameplay takes place on two levels of platforms
column2: with the player able to jump or drop to platforms as and when required. Albatross begins the game armed with only a standard-issue pistol and a limited amount of ammunition. If the pistol's ammunition runs out
column3: the player can only fire a single slow ""chaser"" bullet - with only one allowed on-screen at any one time - until more ammo is acquired.

column1: Each level is littered with doors; most of these contain constantly emerging enemies and must be carefully passed; some
column2: however
column3: also provide ammunition and new weapons. Ammo rooms are clearly marked while weapons rooms have re-enforced metal doors. A weapons room gives the player a fully automatic assault rifle that allows for continuous firing by holding down the shoot button. As with the pistol
column4: the assault rifle has a limited amount of ammunition.

column1: The majority of Rolling Thunder's protagonists are hooded soldiers known as ""Maskers"". Maskers are dressed in various colors
column2: which determines both their strength and attack pattern. Some Maskers do not shoot
column3: but throw grenades instead
column4: while others will shoot their gun while crouching
column5: making their shots much harder to avoid.

column1: Other enemies includes ninjas
column2: mutated bats known as Gelzos
column3: panthers
column4: shrieking yellow creatures known as Blogas and lava men.

column1: Albatross must travel through two different segments or ""stories"" - each composed of five stages - making for a total of ten stages. The stages in Story 2 are essentially a harder version of their Story 1 counterparts
column2: featuring more traps and different enemy placement. At the end of the final stage
column3: the player must battle the Geldra leader Maboo to rescue Leila and complete the mission."

column1: 3327;rtype;rtypej;"R*Type (c) 1987 Irem Corp.

;R*Type is a sideways-scrolling shoot-em-up in which the evil Bydo Empire rules the galaxy through fear and intimidation and it's up to the player - piloting their heavily-armed R-9 space ship - to battle through eight tough levels to the heart of the Bydo stronghold and defeat them.
The game's revolutionary weapons system is its real stroke of genius. The first of numerous innovations that R*Type bought to the genre is the beam weapon: when the fire button is held down
column2: a 'power meter' starts to charge up; once the meter is full
column3: releasing the fire button unleashes a very powerful plasma burst capable of inflicting much greater damage to enemy ships or even destroying numerous enemies simultaneously. The trade-off is that charging the weapon takes up valuable seconds
column4: giving the Bydo ships time to attack.

column1: The most significant addition to R-type's arsenal is the now-legendary 'Force Pod'. This takes the form of an invincible
column2: detachable laser-firing pod that can be attached to either the front or rear of the player's ship
column3: or can be detached completely
column4: after which the pod sits some distance either ahead or behind the player's ship
column5: tracking its movements and providing additional fire power. When attached to the R9 ship
column6: the pod acts as a shield. This forms a crucial part of R*Type's gameplay and has to be fully utilised to navigate certain sections of the game
column7: such as the huge mothership that comprises the game's 3rd stage.

column1: R*Type's levels are designed to make full use of its unique weapons system
column2: making for very linear and demanding gameplay in which losing or picking up the wrong weapon at the wrong time often leads to an instant death. Its intelligent
column3: precise and demanding level design
column4: gave the world its first truly 'strategic' shoot-em-up."

column1: 3328;rtype2;rtype2;"R*Type II (c) 1989 Irem.
;The sequel to the hugely successful original finds the evil Bydo Empire once again intent on the destruction of all mankind in this sideways scrolling
column2: six-level shoot-em-up.

column1: The innovative weapons system of the original game - the 'Beam Weapon' and 'Force Pod' - make a welcome return and remain unchanged for the sequel.
The tight
column2: demanding gameplay and high emphasis on correct usage of the weapons system also return - although the sequel is
column3: if anything
column4: even more demanding than its already unforgiving predecessor; with more durable enemies and trickier level design.

column1: R*Type II features three new weapon shot types:
* Green - Search Laser - fires semi-homing lasers that can bend at 45° angles.
* Grey - Shotgun Laser - fires large shells that travel a short distance before exploding powerfully.
* Scatter Bomb - drops bombs to the ground; when these explode
column2: the explosion scatters forwards along the ground. This is a supporting weapon that can be equipped instead of missiles.

column1: In addition to the new weapons
column2: R-type II's Beam Weapon has received an upgrade. As with the first game
column3: holding down the fire button makes a power gauge fill up
column4: releases the button then unleashes a powerful plasma shot. For the sequel
column5: however
column6: continuing to hold down the button causes the gauge to charge up further. This 'double-charged' gauge flashes blue and red and releases an even more powerful plasma burst."

column1: 3330;rtypelej;rtypeleoj;"R*Type Leo (c) 1992 Irem.
;R-Type Leo is a horizontally-scrolling shoot-em-up and is the third and final arcade release of this classic series (although numerous console-only sequels would follow
column2: see 'Series' for details).

column1: Mankind are currently at peace with their former adversaries
column2: the Bydo Empire
column3: and have taken the opportunity to undertake a massive project called 'Project Paradise'. This involved the construction of an artificial terrestrial-like planet called 'Eden'
column4: created as a safe haven should humanity once again find itself under threat. However
column5: soon after construction is completed
column6: 'Major' - the bio-computer system responsible for maintaining Eden - malfunctions
column7: taking control of the planet's defences and launching an attack on mankind. It is up to the newly-developed 'R-9 Leo' fleet to fly in and stop Major's assault on its creators.

column1: R-Type Leo deviates from the gameplay style of its predecessors by removing the use of both the 'Force Pod' and the 'Wave Cannon'. The new weapons are called 'Force Bits' (later identified in ""R-Type Final"" as ""Psy Bits"") and the 'Bit Shot'. The three 'Force Bit' weapon types are:
* Red - Claw Laser: a powerful horizontal laser beam and horizontal traverse wave
* Blue - Mirror Laser: fires multiple
column2: ricocheting lasers.

column1: * Green - Search Laser LRG: fires semi-homing lasers that can bend at 90 degree angles.
Unlike previous 'Bit' devices
column2: the 'Force/Psy Bits' are capable of firing either forwards or backwards (their direction dictated by the movement of the ship itself). Finally
column3: the 'Wave Cannon' is replaced by a 'Bit Shot'
column4: in which the Psy Bits detach from the ship and collide with the nearest enemy. The Bits can only do this for a limited time before running out of energy
column5: and must be recalled to the ship to recharge.

column1: R Type Leo consists of 6 stages and is the first game in the series to allow 2 players to play simultaneously."
3331;rtypeleo;rtypeleo;"R*Type Leo (c) 1992 Irem.
;R-Type Leo is a horizontally-scrolling shoot-em-up and is the third and final arcade release of this classic series (although numerous console-only sequels would follow
column2: see 'Series' for details).

column1: Mankind are currently at peace with their former adversaries
column2: the Bydo Empire
column3: and have taken the opportunity to undertake a massive project called 'Project Paradise'. This involved the construction of an artificial terrestrial-like planet called 'Eden'
column4: created as a safe haven should humanity once again find itself under threat. However
column5: soon after construction is completed
column6: 'Major' - the bio-computer system responsible for maintaining Eden - malfunctions
column7: taking control of the planet's defences and launching an attack on mankind. It is up to the newly-developed 'R-9 Leo' fleet to fly in and stop Major's assault on its creators.

column1: R-Type Leo deviates from the gameplay style of its predecessors by removing the use of both the 'Force Pod' and the 'Wave Cannon'. The new weapons are called 'Force Bits' (later identified in ""R-Type Final"" as ""Psy Bits"") and the 'Bit Shot'. The three 'Force Bit' weapon types are:
* Red - Claw Laser: a powerful horizontal laser beam and horizontal traverse wave
* Blue - Mirror Laser: fires multiple
column2: ricocheting lasers.

column1: * Green - Search Laser LRG: fires semi-homing lasers that can bend at 90 degree angles.
Unlike previous 'Bit' devices
column2: the 'Force/Psy Bits' are capable of firing either forwards or backwards (their direction dictated by the movement of the ship itself). Finally
column3: the 'Wave Cannon' is replaced by a 'Bit Shot'
column4: in which the Psy Bits detach from the ship and collide with the nearest enemy. The Bits can only do this for a limited time before running out of energy
column5: and must be recalled to the ship to recharge.

column1: R Type Leo consists of 6 stages and is the first game in the series to allow 2 players to play simultaneously."
3332;rtypepj;rtypejp;"R*Type (c) 1987 Irem Corp.

;R*Type is a sideways-scrolling shoot-em-up in which the evil Bydo Empire rules the galaxy through fear and intimidation and it's up to the player - piloting their heavily-armed R-9 space ship - to battle through eight tough levels to the heart of the Bydo stronghold and defeat them.
The game's revolutionary weapons system is its real stroke of genius. The first of numerous innovations that R*Type bought to the genre is the beam weapon: when the fire button is held down
column2: a 'power meter' starts to charge up; once the meter is full
column3: releasing the fire button unleashes a very powerful plasma burst capable of inflicting much greater damage to enemy ships or even destroying numerous enemies simultaneously. The trade-off is that charging the weapon takes up valuable seconds
column4: giving the Bydo ships time to attack.

column1: The most significant addition to R-type's arsenal is the now-legendary 'Force Pod'. This takes the form of an invincible
column2: detachable laser-firing pod that can be attached to either the front or rear of the player's ship
column3: or can be detached completely
column4: after which the pod sits some distance either ahead or behind the player's ship
column5: tracking its movements and providing additional fire power. When attached to the R9 ship
column6: the pod acts as a shield. This forms a crucial part of R*Type's gameplay and has to be fully utilised to navigate certain sections of the game
column7: such as the huge mothership that comprises the game's 3rd stage.

column1: R*Type's levels are designed to make full use of its unique weapons system
column2: making for very linear and demanding gameplay in which losing or picking up the wrong weapon at the wrong time often leads to an instant death. Its intelligent
column3: precise and demanding level design
column4: gave the world its first truly 'strategic' shoot-em-up."

;Export release. Game developed in Japan. For more information about the game itself

column1: - TRIVIA -
Rygar was released in May 1986.
The differences between the US and Japanese (Argus no Senshi) are :
* The demo sequences are different.
* The Japanese version seems to have more hidden powers
column2: stars and an extra free life.

column1: * The US version is more biased towards stars and explosions.
- UPDATES -
The differences between the US (set 1) and US (set 2) are :

* 'Set 2' has a bug in the code which lets p2 start a game when p1 is already playing. You need to set a dip-switch to enable this behavior (it is usually on by default). If you press '2' while p1 is playing a single player game
column2: 'Set 2' will check that you have 1 or more credit before it registers that you're now in a 2 player game
column3: but it won't deduct the credit. That's a bad bug and probably accounts for why a bug-fix version was released.

column1: * In 'Set 2'
column2: if p2 starts while p1 is already playing
column3: it says 'playre2' instead of 'player2' at the top right.

column1: * The first screen of 'Set 2' says 'ALL RIGHT RESERVED' - missing an 'S' - that's fixed in 'Set 1'
- SERIES -
1. Rygar - Legendary Warrior (1986
column2: Arcade)

column1: 2. Rygar [Model NES-RY-USA] (1987
column2: NES)

column1: 3. Rygar - The Legendary Adventure (2002
column2: PS2)

column1: 3. Rygar - The Battle of Argus (2009
column2: Wii)"

3353;s1945;s1945;Strikers 1945 (c) 1995 Psikyo.

;In 1945, the second world war ended. Soon, there was peace, but an organization of high-ranking military officers from all over the world form a global army known as CANY. Their mission was to conquer the world. CANY activity was found in areas like the Soviet Union, America, Japan, and even Germany. It is revealed that CANY had weapons never seen before from rockets to mechanical walkers. The world quickly formed a group of pilots and planes called the Strikers whose mission is to rid of CANY from the world.

;Year 1999, fall. This weapon group which is automated with the 'nano-machines' repeated  attack with non discrimination and the metropoles of each country were in a devastating state. A fear of the extensive nuclear warfare with the strategy nuclear missile error morphism hit the world!!! Barely the unit of each country which prevents the invasion of the 'nano- machine' is summoned because of the unmanned weapon eradication  maneuvers. So, fighting with the weapons of the entire world was not enough. The Strikers start the attack on the enemy center! By the way of the time of half a century, new legend of special force STRIKERS now starts!

The first 4 stages are in random order

column3: bombs
column4: and gold bars for points. Each plane has a unique 'supershot' which is charged by damaging enemies and fired by holding then releasing the fire button. Supershots can be stored
column5: although the number varies from plane to plane. Using a Bomb results in a large friendly fighter swooping onto the screen and blocking shots while returning fire for a few seconds.

column1: After the player beats the final boss
column2: the game starts again from the beginning
column3: albeit at a much higher difficulty level. All level are similar to the ones in Strikers 1945 II. Only one of the 4 bosses that are randomly chosen and the 6th boss is changed."

column1: 3359;sabotenb;sabotenb;"Saboten Bombers (c) 1992 NMK.
;A platform game with gameplay similar to Snow Bros. and Bubble Bobble.
Saboten Bombers is a single screen platform game. The gameplay consists of throwing bombs at the enemies
column2: and avoiding being hit by the enemy bombs. There are a variety of enemies and colorful backgrounds. The game has over 50 levels
column3: and also a versus mode. The game has many collectables

column1: 3360;sadari;sadari;"Sadari (c) 1993 NTC.
3361;safari;safari;Safari (c) 1977 Gremlin.

;This game was in black and white, not greyscale (like many early games used), but just 2 colors, black and white. But the characters and animals were large, and very detailed for just using a single color. There were 4 different animals that you could hunt. Snakes and lions were both rather slow moving, and good for 100 points each. Wild boars would run quickly across the screen, but would net you 200 for a kill. Finally, vultures were small and would move around erratically near the top of the screen (being worth 300 points if you could hit them). Touching any of the beasties meant instant death, but it mattered little, because this game played on time limits anyway. Death only meant that you would lose a few seconds waiting for your intrepid big game hunter to reappear (the game lasted 90 seconds total).
3362;safarir;safarirj;Safari Rally (c) 1979 SNK.

;At the flick of a switch, a white car approaches. You must avoid it and select the safest course, in a maze. When the first formation of dots is extinguished, 2 opposite cars dash at you from the upper screen. You must avoid them and run over the Lion and Snake in order to score bonus mystery points... Never be off guard, skid zones are dangerous! When 4 patterns are cleared, 3 cars rush at you!! Only skilled players make it!!
3363;sailormn;sailormn;Pretty Soldier Sailormoon (c) 1995 Banpresto.
;A 1 or 2-player sideways scrolling beat-em-up sees the Sailor Senshi fighting their way through five levels of anime-based combat. Each Sailor Soldier - chosen from a selection of 5
column2: stiletto and mini skirt-wearing combatants - can punch
column3: kick
column4: jump
column5: and throw their enemies; before finally reaching the traditional end-of-level boss.

column1: As with Capcom's ""Final Fight""
column2: and indeed many other games of the genre
column3: items that aid the player are either dropped by beaten enemies or revealed after hitting certain obstacles and containers. Food can be used to replenish lost health and various trinkets can be picked up for bonus points. Finally
column4: magic crystals can be found and are needed to activate the 'special attack' move. This works in a similar way to Sega's ""Shinobi""
column5: with every enemy on the screen taking a hit.

column1: Players must have at least one crystal to use the Special attack and up to 5 crystals can be carried at once. The more crystals the player holds when the special attack is utilized
column2: the more effective it is against the game's enemies. Each level features its own unique
column3: anime style animation. On level five
column4: Sailor Soldier's signature attack move
column5: from the original Japanese anime upon which the game is based
column6: makes an appearance."

3370;salamand;salamand;Salamander (c) 1986 Konami.
;Salamander is a 1 or 2 player sequel to 1985's superb shoot-em-up
column2: ""Nemesis"". While it retained the same basic gameplay and feel of its predecessor (particularly the superb and innovative weapons system)
column3: Salamander featured both superior graphics and a more imaginative approach to level design. The earliest example of the latter appears towards the end of the very first level
column4: in which imposing
column5: organic obstructions grow before the players' eyes. The game's third level - the infamous 'lava' level - is another good example of Salamander's superb design; with huge solar flares constantly erupting both above and below the player's ship that must be carefully navigated to avoid instant loss of life. Salamander introduced further variety to the action with the introduction vertically-scrolling levels
column6: which alternated with the standard side-scrolling levels.

column1: Salamander's weapon power-up system is as follows :
* SPEED UP : Five speed levels.
* MISSILE : Press missile button to launch.
* LASER : Your forward rockets turn into deadly lasers.
* RIPPLE LASER : Use shoot button to fire.
* FORCE FIELD : Protect your ship with barriers.
* MULTIPLE : Increase your fire power by up to four times.
Multiple special powers can be obtained
column2: but the LASER cannot be used in conjunction with the RIPPLE Laser."

3404;sbrkout;sbrkout;Super Breakout (c) 1978 Atari.

;Super Breakout allows the player(s) to select any one of three different action-packed Super Breakout games by turning the game select knob on the control panel to the desired game. The three available Super Breakout modes are the following :
* Double Breakout : before serving the ball
column2: the Double Breakout playfield contains 52 orange bricks (4x13) at the top of the screen and 52 green bricks (4x13) immediately below the orange brick wall.

column1: Two paddles are displayed at the bottom end of the screen. When the serve pushbutton is pressed two balls are served. If the first ball served is missed
column2: it counts as a missed serve and goes against the players allotted serves per game; otherwise the second ball is served. If the second ball served is missed after striking the first served ball
column3: the player may continue with the first ball.

column1: * Cavity Breakout : before serving the ball
column2: the Cavity Breakout playfield contains 44 orange bricks and 52 (4x13) green bricks located immediately below the orange brick wall. At approximately 3 columns in and 2 rows down into the orange brick wall
column3: from both the left and the right side of the wall
column4: two cavities appear. These two cavities occupy the space of 4 bricks (a 2x2 brick area).

column1: One paddle is provided in this game
column2: and only one ball is served
column3: unlike Double Breakout. When enough bricks are removed to release a captive ball from its cavity
column4: the score doubles for each brick removed by any of the two balls in the playfield (as long as the served and freed ball remain active in the playfield). If the third ball is freed and all three balls are played in the playfield
column5: the score triples. If any one of the balls is missed and lost
column6: the score returns to double points. If the second ball is missed and only one ball remains in the playfield
column7: points are then scored as normal.

column1: * Progressive Breakout : before serving the ball
column2: the Progressive Breakout playfield contains 4x13 brick walls (one blue and the other green). The blue brick wall
column3: which consists of 52 bricks
column4: is at the top. Then occurs a space equivalent to this wall. In the middle of the screen is a green brick wall consisting of 52 bricks.

column1: The brick walls move or 'scroll' toward the paddle at a rate determined by the number of hits on the ball. As the bricks are knocked out and the walls progressively creep up on the player's paddle
column2: new bricks enter the playfield at a progressively faster rate; four rows of bricks are always separated by four rows of blanks.

column1: As the brick walls scroll down
column2: their colors change which indicates a new point score for that brick at that instant of time."

3411;sci;sci;S.C.I. - Special Criminal Investigation (c) 1989 Taito.
;A direct sequel to 1988's ""Chase H.Q.""
column2: S.C.I. once again puts the player in charge of an unmarked police car - this time a Nissan 300ZX T-Top Turbo - in which the player must chase and capture a criminal mastermind before the time limit expires. Graphically
column3: S.C.I. is very similar to its predecessor
column4: although there are slight improvements with both a better use of colour and the introduction of some new weather effects; such as the rain on the first stage. Unlike the first game
column5: the player is armed with a gun; this is used to take out criminals and roadblocks as the player races against the time limit
column6: and also to capture the criminal mastermind and make an arrest before the time limit expires."
