column1: 3416;scobra;scobra;"Super Cobra (c) 1981 Konami.
;The object of the game is to invade ten SUPER COBRA defense systems of increasing difficulty and safely pick up the BOOTY.
Use the joystick to move up
column2: down
column3: accelerate and decelerate. Use the Laser and Bombs to destroy defenders. Hitting tanks scores Mystery Value worth 100
column5: or 300 points. Rockets
column6: Tanks
column7: Missiles
column8: and UFO's may all fire at invader. Hit fuel tanks for extra fuel for CHOPPER. The Chopper uses up fuel as it flies
column9: except in between defense levels.

column1: At 10000 points
column2: the player is awarded a BONUS CHOPPER.

column1: At the end of the game
column2: the player can continue at the defense level he left off on by depositing extra coins and pressing the discharge button on the left-hand side of the panel.

column1: If the Booty is destroyed on the BASE level
column2: the player may try again. When the Booty is safely recovered
column3: a Bonus Chopper is awarded and play resumes at defense level Number 1 where the fuel is used up faster and the defenders fire more often.

column1: SUPER COBRA Defense Level Descriptions :
*  Fuel Tanks appear on every defense level.
*  Tanks appear and fire on all levels except level 8 where they do not fire.
Level 1 - Player must maneuver the chopper over mountainous terrain against fast and slow firing rockets.
Level 2 - Chopper faces Arcing missiles over a mountain terrain.
Level 3 - Smart Bombs flying in groups of four over mountainous terrain. Rockets appear
column2: but do not fire.

column1: Level 4 - Single Smart Bombs over mountainous terrain. Again
column2: Rockets appear but do not fire.

column1: Level 5 - Chopper flies through a cavern-like terrain against Falling Mines.
Level 6 - Rapidly firing
column2: Roving Tanks over mountainous terrain. Rockets appear
column3: but do not fire.

column1: Level 7 - Maneuver through a field of meteors which explode when hit with bombs or three times with Laser
column2: plus a single
column3: green
column4: shadow meteor directly in front of Chopper which explodes when hit five times with Laser. Rockets appear but do not fire.

column1: Level 8 - Chopper flies over mountainous terrain against rapidly firing UFO's. Tanks and Rockets appear
column2: but do not fire.

column1: Level 9 - Chopper faces arcing missiles over tall buildings.
Level 10 - Firing rockets in a Building Maze.
Base - Player must maneuver the Chopper over tall buildings against arcing missiles and rapidly firing tanks to reach the Booty and safely carry it away."

column1: 3421;scontraj;scontraj;"Super Contra - Alien no Gyakushuu (c) 1988 Konami.

;The sequel to ""Contra"" - released a year earlier - is set in the year 2634 and begins with the disturbing news that the alien invaders from the first game - a race known as the Red Falcon - have renewed their attack on Earth and have infiltrated military bases and possessed most of the federation forces troops.
The heroes of the first games - Bill Rizer and Lance Bean - are once again called upon to defend the Earth and defeat the alien invaders.
Super Contra plays identically to its predecessor
column2: with the usual mix of run-and-gun gameplay. The main difference is that the into-the-screen stages of the original Contra have been replaced with overhead stages. In addition
column3: power-up icons are now represented as the actual weapons wielded by the characters
column4: instead of the traditional letter-based falcon icons and players can now upgrade their weapon by picking it up twice in a row.

column1: Another new gameplay addition is that players can now control the height of their jump; holding the joystick up and pressing the jump button allows for a higher jump; likewise the player can perform low jumps by holding down-right or down-left while pressing the jump button.
The available weapons are as follows:
* Machine Gun - Fires bullets at auto-fire. The upgraded version increases the firing rate to a near-ridiculous speed.
* Bomb Launcher - Fires bombs that spread fire when they hit their target. The upgraded version causes bigger explosions.
* Laser Rifle - Fires a powerful laser beam once per shot. The upgraded version fires a larger beam.
* Spread Shot - Fires a three-way shot. Increases to a five-way spread after the upgrade.
* Mega Shell - Available only in the top-view stages. After picking it up
column2: players can launch it by pressing the jump button and kill all on-screen enemies.

column1: Super Contra's five stages are:
* Area 1 - Outer Base (side-view) - A military base overrun by possessed soldiers. Bosses include a manned tank and a possessed helicopter. At the end of the level
column2: players must destroy a core protected by a pair of snipers and a grenade thrower to gain entrance to the next area.

column1: * Area 2 - Inner Base (top-view) - A tank hanger filled with manned tanks and cannons
column2: in addition to enemy soldiers. The end-of-level boss is the Hyper Electric Magnetic Tank Magnus
column3: which is manned by three gunners.

column1: * Area 3 - Jungle (side-view) - Enemies come from trees as players progress through the level. The heroes will sometimes have to cross a lake
column2: and players can duck into it to avoid enemy fire. Towards the end of the level
column3: the heroes are faced with alien eggs that produce facehugger-like creatures (the same ones featured in the original game). The end-of-level boss is an alien shrine with a skull.

column1: * Area 4 - 1st Alien Lair (side-view) - This takes place inside an alien nest. The enemies are now xenomorph-like creatures and mutant mouths that shoot alien spawns. The sub-boss is an alien hovercraft composed of skulls
column2: while the end-of-level boss is a flying alien.

column1: * Area 5 - 2nd Alien Lair (top-view) - The final stage
column2: filled with mouths emerging from the ground
column3: flying heads and spider-like creatures. The final boss is Gaver
column4: a giant alien head with snake-like arms."

3423;scramblb;scramblb;Scramble (c) 1981 Konami Industry Company
column2: Limited.

column1: ;Scramble is a sideways scrolling shoot-em-up in which a single player takes control of a spaceship and must try to fight through six different enemy-packed levels - destroying as many fuel tanks and ground intallations as possible - before reaching the enemy base and destroying it.
Contact with any scenery
column2: ground installations
column3: enemy ships or projectyles results in an instant loss of life. The Scramble ship is armed with both a blaster and bombs. The blaster is forward-firing only while the bombs drop downwards to target ground-based enemy installations and to collect fuel from fuel dumps.

column1: The fuel dumps are of particular importance
column2: as the player ship's fuel gauge constantly depletes as the player progresses through the game and the only way to re-fuel is by bombing the fuel tanks that are located on the ground throughout the levels. Fuel usage increases as the game progresses
column3: until fuel usage actually outstrips the amount of fuel dumps available and the game becomes impossible.

column1: Scramble is rightly considered to be a classic and was the world's first ever 'multi-level' shoot-em-up."

3427;screwloo;screwloo;Screw Loose (c) 1983 Mylstar Electronics.
;The player controls a blue robot character named ""Robop"" around a 3-D perspective playfield grid
column2: while shooting enemies and gathering items for points and beware the Inchworm it will steal your robotics hands!

column1: Your character
column2: Robop
column3: must navigate his way around a playfied shooting records
column4: snipes and bees to earn points. Gathering hamburgers
column5: nuts
column6: briefcases and atoms will light up the bulbs. The levels advance when all the bulbs have been lit. Robop must avoid the inchworm and pick up his hands if they become detached from his body. The game ends if all Robop hands are pushed off the screen by the inchworm or he is destroyed by the Cherry Bomb.

column1: The left joystick moves Robop
column2: while the right joystick fires. The joystick buttons activate Robop's Super!Charge that both speeds him up and shields him from attack."

column1: 3428;scross;scross;"Stadium Cross (c) 1992 Sega.
3429;sctionza;sectionza;Section Z (c) 1985 Capcom Company
column2: Limited.

column1: ;As a sole astronaut
column2: you must penetrate the alien Balangool space craft and destroy the evil 'L-Brain'. Make your way through 27 alphabet-labeled levels to find his lair.

column1: The player maneuvers the space ranger throughout the enemy space station
column2: which consists of 26 alphabetically ordered corridors known as ""sections""
column3: starting from Section A and ending at the titular Section Z. The game is divided into five stages
column4: each consisting of five sections (with the final stage having six sections to accommodate the spare letter). The player will fight an enemy boss at the end of each stage
column5: concluding with the final battle against the ""L Brain"" at Section Z. The game's stages alternates between horizontal-scrolling stage (left or right) and upwards vertical-scrolling stages. The player will lose a life every time they get hit by enemy fire. Additional lives can be obtained if the player achieves a high enough score. The game will be over if the player loses all of their lives
column6: although a chance to continue will be provided.

column1: The controls consists of an eight-way joystick and two buttons
column2: one for shooting and the other for changing the character's aim to the left or right. This allows the player to shoot at one direction while moving away towards the opposite. The player will shoot their rifle towards the left or the right with the fire button
column3: while dropping bombs at the same time to the ground. By destroying certain dome-shaped containers
column4: the player can obtain one of three power-up items represented by letters: S
column5: P
column6: and B. S increases the player's mobility speed
column7: while P increases their firing power; each can improved for up to three increments. However
column8: these power-ups will be lost whenever the player loses a life. The B item will simply give the player bonus points"

3435;sdodgeb;sdodgeb;くにおの熱血闘球伝説 (c) 1996 Technos Japan Corp.
;(Kunio no Nekketsu Toukyuu Densetsu)

The popular game of Dodge Ball is a rather unique sport in which teams of three players try to knock each other out with the help of special moves and team attacks. In this game you take control of a team and must beat all other teams (you can even recruit the other team's leader after beating them!) in order to face the  current Dodge Ball champion and take the title. Features cool anime style graphics
column2: catchy music & great sound effects
column3: plenty of moves at your disposal and a solid challenge level. Dodge Ball anyone? :)"

column1: 3436;sdtennis;sdtennis;"Super Doubles Tennis (c) 1983 Data East.
3437;sdungeon;sdungeon;Space Dungeon (c) 1981 Taito America Corp.
;Each level of Space Dungeon consists of 36 rooms arranged in a six-by-six grid. Rooms are connected by open doorways of various sizes. One room in each level is the entrance
column2: where the player begins
column3: and another is the Collect Bonus room. Other rooms may or may not contain laser defenses
column4: hostile aliens
column5: or various bits of treasure. The goal in each level is to navigate using an automap to the room containing the ""Collect Bonus"" area
column6: visiting as many rooms and collecting as much treasure as possible along the way.

column1: The player's only weapon is a laser cannon
column2: which fires a pulsing
column3: solid beam in any of eight directions. Like Robotron: 2084 (1982)
column4: but preceding the release of that game
column5: the controls for Space Dungeon are a pair of 8-directional joysticks: one for moving
column6: one for shooting. Space Dungeon may have been the first twin-stick shooter.

column1: Higher scores are awarded for exiting each level with more treasures. A 10
column2: 000-point bonus is awarded if the player visits every single room on the level
column3: whether or not all treasures on the level have been collected. Since an extra ship is awarded to the player every 10
column4: 000 points
column5: this
column6: and the large point values of the treasures (especially the later ones) created an interesting tension between securing the treasures already collected or risking losing ships to acquire more. If the player's ship collides with an enemy or any of their spore shots before reaching the ""Collect Bonus"" cube
column7: all collected treasure is dropped in the room where the ship was destroyed. This room is designated on the map by an X."

column1: 3438;seabass;seabass;;
3439;searchar;searchar;"SAR - Search and Rescue (c) 1989 SNK.

;When a pioneer spaceship vanishes mysteriously. An investigation reveals that the spaceship crashed near a ravine due to unknown circumstances. Now two SAR (Search and Rescue) operatives are on a mission to find out what happened, and eliminate the alien threat.
3440;seawolf;seawolf;Sea Wolf (c) 1976 Midway.

;The game screen is a side view of a underwater scene (with the surface towards the top). You control a crosshair at the surface level. The object is to shoot as many ships as possible, before the time runs out. Your torpedoes are launched from the bottom of the screen, and must move upwards to hit the enemy ships (while avoiding the mines that float at different levels of the water). Your submarine can shoot 5 shots before it has to reload (an automatic action that takes about a second). Your game will be extended if you reach a certain score before time runs out (the score is operator adjustable).
3441;seawolf2;seawolf2;Sea Wolf II (c) 1978 Midway.

;The game screen is a side view of a underwater scene (with the surface towards the top). You control a crosshair at the surface level. The object is to shoot as many ships as possible, before the time runs out. Your torpedoes are launched from the bottom of the screen, and must move upwards to hit the enemy ships (while avoiding the mines that float at different levels of the water). There are several different types of enemy ships, from slow moving destroyers, to fast moving PT boats. An 'explosion' light will flash inside your periscope each time you score a hit. Your submarine can shoot five shots before it has to reload (an automatic action that takes about a second). Your game will be extended if you reach a certain score before time runs out (the score is operator adjustable).
3442;secolove;secolove;Second Love (c) 1986 Nichibutsu.

;Mahjong, like love, is better the second time around.
3443;secretab;secretab;Secret Agent (c) 1989 Data East.

;Secret Agent is a side-scrolling platform shoot-em-up which the player takes on the role of a James Bond-esque secret agent who must fight his way through a terrorist group called 'CWD' to reach the final Boss confrontation and prevent a stolen nuclear missile being launched.
The player starts the game armed only with a pistol
column2: and this has a limited amount of ammunition. Once the ammo has run out
column3: players can only kick their enemies. Machine guns are occasionally dropped by defeated enemies and can be picked up and used. Also
column4: Golden Gun components are sometimes dropped; there are six of these in total and once all have been collected
column5: the player is rewarded with a very powerful golden rifle. This weapon kills all enemies instantly but will only last for twenty-five seconds
column6: indicated by a meter at the top-right of the screen.

column1: Most of the game's eight stages are platform-based
column2: but there are also two underwater scuba levels and a motorbike chase. All of the game's end-of-level bosses reappear on the final 'underground lair' level.

column1: While not officially licensed as a James Bond game
column2: Secret Agent is unmistakably meant to represent both the Bond character and movie series. The Bond villain Jaws shows up at the end of stage two and another famous Bond villain
column3: Odd Job also appears. Another memorable Bond reference is the use of a Shaun Connery impersonator who tells players that they have done a Great job upon completion of a level."

column3: starting from Section A and ending at the titular Section Z. The game is divided into five stages
column4: each consisting of five sections (with the final stage having six sections to accommodate the spare letter). The player will fight an enemy boss at the end of each stage
column5: concluding with the final battle against the ""L Brain"" at Section Z. The game's stages alternates between horizontal-scrolling stage (left or right) and upwards vertical-scrolling stages. The player will lose a life every time they get hit by enemy fire. Additional lives can be obtained if the player achieves a high enough score. The game will be over if the player loses all of their lives
column6: although a chance to continue will be provided.

column1: The controls consists of an eight-way joystick and two buttons
column2: one for shooting and the other for changing the character's aim to the left or right. This allows the player to shoot at one direction while moving away towards the opposite. The player will shoot their rifle towards the left or the right with the fire button
column3: while dropping bombs at the same time to the ground. By destroying certain dome-shaped containers
column4: the player can obtain one of three power-up items represented by letters: S
column5: P
column6: and B. S increases the player's mobility speed
column7: while P increases their firing power; each can improved for up to three increments. However
column8: these power-ups will be lost whenever the player loses a life. The B item will simply give the player bonus points"

;Senjyo is an arcade game developed in 1983 by Tehkan (now known as Tecmo). The gameplay involves the player controlling a fixed turret on a tank shooting oncoming alien enemies through a cross-hair target. A certain number of enemies must be destroyed to progress to the next stage. The original arcade cabinet was a cocktail table.

3463;sexyparo;sexyparo;Sexy Parodius (c) 1996 Konami Company
column2: Limited.

column1: ;The 3rd sequel in a hugely successful series of games that was originally intended to be little more than a parody of Konami's own successful ""Gradius"" series. As the previous ""Parodius"" games
column2: ""Sexy Parodius"" again gives the player a choice of increasingly bizarre ships to control; ranging from a sexy girl riding a missile
column3: to a stick man on a paper aeroplane.

column1: The game plays much the same as its prequels
column2: as well as the 'Gradius' series it sets out to parody. One new addition to the game-play is the introduction of branching paths through the game. Each level has a specific task
column3: such as collecting the golden coins on the second level
column4: the completion or failure of which dictates which level players will be faced with next.

column1: Due to the powerful Konami GX hardware the game runs on
column2: Sexy Parodius's colorful and inventive visuals represent the pinnacle of the series."

column1: 3469;sf2accp2;sf2accp2;"Street Fighter II' - Champion Edition [Accelerator Pt+.II] (c) 1992 Testron.
;Accelerator Pt+.II (aka Final Victory) is a hack of ""Street Fighter II' - Champion Edition"":
1. It is possible to change characters partway through the fight (with Start button).
2. All characters may perform any special move in the air.
3. M. Bison's Psycho Crusher does not make a sound when it is performed.
4. Ryu's dragon punch (with HP) moves across the entire screen.
5. Ryu's Hurricane kick (with HK) moves across the entire screen.
6. Ken and Ryu ""Fireballs"" LP : bounce slowly across screen. MP : angle downward. HP : angle upward."

column1: 3471;sf2cej;sf2cejb;"Street Fighter II' - Champion Edition (c) 1992 Capcom.
;This was the first official sequel to the legendary one-on-one fighting game
column2: Street Fighter II - The World Warrior.

column1: As with its predecessor
column2: battles take place over a series of 'best two-out-of-three' rounds. The objective of each round is to deplete the opponent's 'vitality' before the timer runs out. If both opponents knock each other out at the same time
column3: or if the timer expires with both fighters having equal amounts of vitality remaining
column4: a 'Double KO' or 'Draw Game"" is declared and additional rounds will be played to sudden death.

column1: New gameplay additions included the ability to play as any of the four boss characters (increasing the playable roster from eight to twelve) and the option for both players to use the same characters in two-player fights
column2: with an alternate colour scheme introduced to distinguish them from each other. Some minor gameplay revisions were also made to balance the characters out.

column1: Additionally
column2: while in World Warrior one-player games could last up to ten rounds in the event of there being no clear winner (at which point the game made the player lose by default)
column3: in the ""Champion Edition"" this was reduced to just four rounds.

column1: Playable characters:
* Ryu - a Japanese martial artist seeking to hone his skills.
* E. Honda - a sumo wrestler from Japan.
* Blanka - a beast-man from Brazil who was raised in the jungle.
* Guile - a former USAF special forces operative from the US.
* Ken - Ryu's former training partner and rival
column2: from the US.

column1: * Chun-Li - a Chinese female martial artist and Interpol officer.
* Zangief - a pro wrestler from the former Soviet Union.
* Dhalsim - a yoga master from India with stretchable limbs.
* Balrog - an American boxer
column2: similar in appearance real-life boxer
column3: Mike Tyson.

column1: * Vega - a Spanish cage fighter who uses a unique style of ninjutsu.
* Sagat - a Muay Thai master
column2: scarred by Ryu at the end of a previous tournament.

column1: * M. Bison - leader of the criminal organization
column2: 'Shadaloo'."

column1: 3476;sf2j;sf2j;"Street Fighter II - The World Warrior (c) 1991 Capcom.

;Street Fighter II - The World Warrior is the legendary fighting game that defined the fighting game genre. One or two players can choose from eight selectable World Warriors and must defeat the other seven
column2: before finally taking on four non-selectable 'boss' characters.

column1: Each fighter is as distinctive in feel and fighting style as they are in physical appearance
column2: with each protagonist possessing several fantastical 'special moves' (the first genuine example of such in the fighting genre) to accompany the usual array of kicks
column3: punches and throws. These special moves
column4: while being difficult to execute due to the complexity of the joystick and buttons combinations required
column5: allows the fighter to inflict huge amounts of damage on their opponent.

column1: Street Fighter II is a fighting game in the truest sense of the word
column2: with deceptively deep and strategic gameplay ensuring that experienced players would destroy simple 'button mashers' with relative ease."

column1: 3491;sf2tj;sf2hfj;"Street Fighter II' Turbo - Hyper Fighting (c) 1992 Capcom.
;This is the second SFII follow-up. Here's what's new:
* Gameplay is SIGNIFICANTLY sped up to intensify the pace of the game.
* More special moves (ie. Chun Li's fireball
column2: Dhalsim's Yoga Teleport) are added for each character except for M. Bison.

column1: * New color schemes are added for each character (but the color schemes for the stage backgrounds are still the same as they were for Champion Edition).
* The addition of mid-air special moves for Chun Li
column2: Ryu and Ken are introduced.

column1: * Platform graphics (resembling the medal ceremonies in the Olympics) are added to each character's ending
column2: featuring the character you completed the game with at the first-place platform
column3: M. Bison at the second-place platform
column4: and Sagat at the third-place platform. The musical setting for this display is the music from the home stage of the character standing on the 1st-place platform (If you completed the game with Sagat or M. Bison
column5: the one you used stands on the 1st-place platform
column6: the other one on the 2nd-place platform
column7: and Vega occupies the 3rd-place platform)."

;Space Fever High Splitter is another of Nintendo's takes on the ""Space Invaders"" franchise
column2: only with a twist : if you don't quite hit the alien in the middle
column3: you'll split the alien in two
column4: both of which you'll have to shoot. The alien crafts are arranged in rows and they slowly move left and right across the screen. When the row reaches the edge
column5: the ships drop down a row and move in the opposite direction (one exception : see below). As you shoot more enemies the speed will increase
column6: as will the number of enemy bullets. You have four blocks above you that absorb the enemy shots until they are worn through
column7: and being hit by an enemy shot will cost you a life. Sometimes a UFO will fly along the top of the screen; hit it and you'll get points and a smaller alien
column8: hit the smaller alien and get more points.

column1: There are three different game modes for 1- or 2-player games :
Game A : aliens go down two
column2: up one
column3: down two
column4: up one.

column1: Game B : aliens show up in one up-and-down row
column2: they add a row each time they reach the edge and turn around.

column1: Game C : The same as ""Space Invaders"" - all the aliens move as one 'block' in the same direction."

;A great underwater shooter game.

The player start on an dive propulsion vehicle that can fire torpedoes. The mission is to rescue all the hostages and avoid or shoot all enemies that come your way to attack you. If your vehicle runs out of fuel can explode to avoid this must be attentive to the fuel indicator
column2: if your tank is almost finished press the dismount button to get off the vehicle. Now the player is swimming freely and your weapon is a powerful harpoon. If you kill the owner of another dive vehicle you can mount it and use torpedoes again. The number of hostages to rescue increases with each level. When all the hostages have been rescued
column3: the level ends."

;A golf game from Sega.
3550;sgunner;sgunner;Steel Gunner (c) 1990 Namco.

;Some major trouble is brewing in the city of Neo Arc. A radical terrorist group known as S.T.U.R.M. is causing problems to the citizens of Neo Arc by kidnapping a well respected quantum physicist and his assistant in order to create an abominable war machine. However there's a ray of hope which come in the form of the police department's counter-terrorist force called Steel Gunner. Now the battle is set for it's up to both Steel Gunner Officers Cliff and Garcia to stop the seemingly merciless wrath of S.T.U.R.M. and it's leader : Gatse Bernard
3551;sgunner2;sgunner2;Steel Gunner 2 (c) 1991 Namco.
3552;sgunnr2j;sgunner2j;Steel Gunner 2 (c) 1991 Namco.

;Move your player through a maze-like level in this shoot'em up. Shoot enemies and collect treasures and keys.
3554;shadfrce;shadfrceu;Shadow Force - Henshin Ninja (c) 1993 Technos.
;Shadow Force is a side-scrolling platform beat-em-up for one or two players
column2: who choose to play as one of four Ninjas and must use all the means at their disposal to free the world from the grip of the evil Dr. Wong and his terrifying 'Theaser' organization.

column1: Shadow Force has 6 buttons: 2 for punches (low and high) 2 for kicks (low and high) 1 for jumping and 1 for possessing an enemy. Additional attack moves can be utilised by moving the joystick up or down and pressing punch and kick buttons. It's also possible to combine punch and kick attacks to obtain different combos and while the enemies can do the same
column2: the number and variation of their attacks is generally lower than those available to the players.

column1: In addition to being able to possess nearby enemies
column2: Shadow Force also features something else new to the side-scrolling beat-em-up genre; at the end of each stage players take part in a bonus round consisting of a one-on-one fight.

column1: Players can choose to start on any one of the first three stages and the game features 14 different possible endings."

3562;shangon;shangon1;Super Hang-On (c) 1987 Sega.
;Super Hang-On is a checkpoint-based racing game and is the sequel to the acclaimed ""Hang-On""
column2: released two years earlier. As with the prequel
column3: players take control of a superbike and must race over twisting road-based circuits
column4: avoiding rival bikers and trying to reach the end-of-stage checkpoint before the time limit expires.

column1: For the sequel
column2: Sega introduced the hilly
column3: undulating roads that had been executed so superbly in 1986's ""Out Run"". The gameplay was further enhanced with the introduction of the 'turbo' button. Upon reaching the bike's maximum speed of 280kph
column4: players could press and hold the turbo and push the bike up to 324kph - something that was necessary to beat the game's extremely tight time limits. This had to be used carefully
column5: however
column6: as the increase in speed made the bike harder to control and accelerating at the wrong time would invariably see a head-on collision with either rival bikers or the road-side objects that litter the stages.

column1: Players could chose to race on any one of four courses: Africa
column2: Asia
column3: America and Europe. Africa is the easiest and shortest of the four
column4: with each subsequent course becoming both more demanding - with tighter bends and more aggressive rival racers - and having a greater number of stages to have to beat. Africa
column5: for example
column6: is made up of only six stages
column7: while the hardest course
column8: Europe
column9: has eighteen stages."

3567;sharrier;sharrier1;Space Harrier (c) 1985 Sega.

;Space Harrier is a sprite-scaling 3D shoot-em-up set in the 'Fantasy Zone'; a surreal world composed of abstract structures and a checkerboard landscape. The game's enemies are as abstract as its setting; with creatures including prehistoric Mammoths
column2: alien pods
column3: giant mushrooms and
column4: at the end of most stages
column5: a huge
column6: fireball-spitting Chinese Dragon.

column1: The player's on-screen counterpart carries a portable jetpack under his arm which allows him to fly. The player can also run along the ground to avoid overhead structures and enemies.
In addition to its flight capability
column2: the jetpack is also equipped with a laser
column3: used to destroy both the game's many enemies as well as some (but not all) obstructions
column4: such as the trees and floating rocks on the first stage.

column1: Space Harrier has a total of 18 stages
column2: each with a boss fight at the end. Three exceptions are the bonus stages (5th and 12th) and the 18th stage
column3: which is a 'boss rush' featuring some of the bosses encountered up to that point."

column1: 3568;shdancbl;shdancbl;"Shadow Dancer - Kage no Mai (c) 1989 Sega.
;A loose sequel to 1988's ""Shinobi""
column2: Shadow Dancer stars a young Ninja who
column3: together with his faithful canine companion
column4: must battle against a terrorist group. The terrorist group have planted a number of time bombs throughout the metropolis. The Ninja and his dog must set out to gather up all the explosives placed by the evil gang and to annihilate the criminal mastermind.

column1: Game-play is very similar to that of the original Shinobi
column2: and features the jumping and projectile weapon-based game-play of its illustrious older brother. However
column3: a new and crucial attacking move has since been added to the Ninja's arsenal. Pulling DOWN on the joystick and pressing the ATTACK button sends the hero's dog to attack the nearest enemy. This will stop the enemy from attacking the player as he wrestles with the dog. The enemy must be killed quickly
column4: however
column5: or the dog itself will be killed. If the dog is attacked
column6: he will turn into a small puppy
column7: and once the player has killed a set number of enemies
column8: the puppy will grow to be a full-sized dog who can once again be used to attack enemies."

column1: 3571;sheriff;sheriff;"Sheriff (c) 1979 Nintendo.
3574;shimpact;shimpact;Super High Impact (c) 1991 Midway.
3575;shinobi;shinobi3;Shinobi (c) 1987 Sega Enterprises
column2: Limited.

column1: ;Shinobi is a scrolling platform beat-em-up in which the player takes on the role of Joe Musashi
column2: a Shinobi Ninja
column3: who must fight his way through 5 tough missions - each made up of between 3 to 5 stages - in his quest to rescue the kidnapped Ninja children of the Iga clan; now hostages of an evil Ninja syndicate called ""Zeed"". To complete a mission
column4: the player must rescue all of the kidnapped children on each level
column5: with the number of hostages remaining displayed on a meter in the bottom left corner of the screen.

column1: The Shinobi Ninja begins each level armed with either 'shuriken' throwing stars or a gun for long-range attacks; and a Samurai sword for close-range combat. In addition
column2: the Ninja also has one 'Magic Attack' per level; a smart bomb which kills or damages all on-screen enemies. A points bonus is awarded whenever a level is completed without the Magic Attack being used. An end-of-level guardian awaits the player at the end of each mission
column3: and each takes several hits before it is killed. Once a boss is defeated
column4: the player is taken to a bonus stage in which a large number of Ninjas will try to 'jump' from the back of the screen to the front to attack the player. A bonus life is awarded if the player manages to kill all of the Ninjas without being attacked.

column1: Shinobi was a huge success for Sega
column2: and deservedly so. Its perfectly realized blend of platform and fighting action and is as fine an exponent of the 'easy to get into
column3: difficult to master' gameplay ethic as video games have seen."

column1: 3578;shinobl;shinobl;;
3579;shippumd;shippumd;"疾風魔法大作戦キングダム-グランドプリ (c) 1994 Eighting / Raizing.
;(Shippuu Mahou Daisakusen - Kingdom-Grandprix)
A vertically scrolling shooter with a racing theme. You have the choice of either firing (when the button is pressed) or boosting (when the button is held)."
3580;shiryu2;shiryu2;"Strider Hiryu 2 (c) 1999 Capcom.
;A direct sequel to the superb 1989 original
column2: the player once again takes on the role of Strider Hiryu; a ninja who wields a deadly plasma-ejecting cypher called the 'Falchion'. Players start the game by selecting one of three difficult missions
column3: with a fourth becoming available once the initial three are completed. Completing the fourth mission will unlock the final 'boss' mission
column4: in which the player must battle a number of bosses which includes the rogue 'Strider Hien' from the first Strider game. Once all missions are completed
column5: the character of Strider Hien - who wields two ranged cyphers - is unlocked.

column1: To add variety to the tight gameplay
column2: Capcom included special unlockable and powerful skills to aid players on their missions. These included the Savage Slash ('Midare-Giri' in Japanese)
column3: Hassou Jump
column4: Boost (unlimited if missions defeated by Hien) and rapid slash.

column1: Strider 2 features improved graphics - now rendered in pseudo 3-D - but with hack-and-slash gameplay largely unaltered from the first game. One difference to the original is a greater emphasis placed on boss encounters."
3581;shisen;shisen;"Shisen-shou - Joshiryou-hen (c) 1989 Tamtex.

;Szechuan-style solitaire mahjong.
3582;shisen2;shisen2;Shisen-shou II (c) 1993 Tamtex.
3583;shocking;shocking;Shocking (c) 1997 Yun Sung.
;Shocking is a charming action adventure game wish some puzzle elements.  You are a werewolf seeking to return to your normal form and this quest will lead you to save the world.

Each round features a new objective to complete in order to clear the single screen level and continue on your journey.  There are 12 rounds in each stage and each stage ends with a boss battle.  Interspersed within the stages are various mini-game challenges where the player can earn extra lives.
The game is over once you have lost all of your lives."
3584;shocktr2;shocktr2;"Shock Troopers - 2nd Squad (c) 1998 SNK.
;More of an update than a full-blown sequel
column2: Shock Troopers - 2nd Squad picks up where the first game - released a year earlier - left off. Once again
column3: one or two players face the might of a terrorist army who are threatening to destroy the world by launching a newly developed weapon-of-mass-destruction if their wishes - to be given absolute control of the newly-founded nation of Billberk - aren't granted.

column1: Like many Neo Geo sequels
column2: 2nd Squad doesn't particularly do anything the original didn't do. There are some improvements
column3: however; graphics have been given a brush up and level design is a little more imaginative than that of the already impressive original."

column1: 3585;shocktra;shocktroa;"Shock Troopers (c) 1997 SNK.
;Shock Troopers pits the players against a mighty terrorist group who are holding a girl hostage
column2: in order to force her grandfather to surrender a powerful drug which will enable the terrorists to control the minds of the grandfather's soldiers and create a huge
column3: unstoppable army.

column1: Shock Troopers is a multi-directional scrolling shoot-em-up for one or two players that builds upon the foundations laid by Capcom's 1985 classic
column2: ""Commando (Capcom)"" and also borrows heavily from Commando's sequel
column3: '""Mercs"". As well as enemy troops
column4: players must contend with tanks
column5: choppers and assorted military vehicles
column6: and must also be careful to avoid any of the landmines that litter the levels. Extra weapons and health can be picked up from destroyed enemy vehicles
column7: as well as being found in enemy supply crates. Shock Troopers is effectively three games in one as players can chose one of three different routes; each made up of different levels. The game also offers greater variety of gameplay than other of the genre; with levels having the players travel on the back of fast moving vehicles
column8: climbing a rock face etc."

column1: - SERIES -

3588;shollow;shollow;"Satan's Hollow (c) 1981 Bally Midway.
;Satan's Hollow is a 1- or a 2-player game. When playing this game
column2: the Rocket Launcher is under YOUR control. YOU make it move back and forth across the screen to launch Rockets that will eliminate your attackers. These attackers are displayed in groups
column3: called 'racks'
column4: across the top of the screen. The first rack is made up of a small number of attackers. The second rack is made up of a larger number of these attackers. And intermixed with the racks of attackers is a rack with only a single fire-breathing Devil's head.

column1: The attackers and the Devil's Head will try to wipe out your Rocket Launcher. If they do
column2: you lose one player. In emergencies
column3: you have a Shield which goes all around your Rocket Launcher for a short period of time. It is activated by pushing the Shield button on the control console. BUT BE CAREFUL!! This consumes a lot of power and will only last a VERY SHORT TIME!

column1: Each attacker eliminated will cause a Bridge Section to appear at the lower left corner of the screen EXCEPT : when there is already a Bridge Section there or when you have a Bridge Section in tow under your Rocket Launcher. Pick these Sections up with your Rocket Launcher and move them over to build a Bridge across the gorge at the right side of the screen leading into the land of SATAN.
When you complete your Bridge into the land of SATAN
column2: you can cross it and do battle with him. If you win you will be rewarded by increased fire power for your Rocket Launcher. If SATAN defeats you
column3: you lose one player.

column1: As your skill level increases
column2: the number of attackers is increased and the speed that the fire-breathing Devil's Head moves is increased also.

column1: Bonus Rocket Launchers are awarded to you periodically throughout the game as you reach or pass certain preselected point values. Each attacker has an assigned point value.
The object of the game is to HAVE FUN while constantly improving your skills as you play
column2: eliminating as many attackers as possible each time to get the highest score."

3608;sicv;sicv;Space Invaders (c) 1978 Taito.

;Space Invaders is quite simply the most influential video-game of all time. A single player moves an armed 'laser base' left or right along the bottom of the screen and shoots the endless waves of aliens marching relentlessly down the screen towards earth.
There are four buildings (shields) at the bottom of the screen that the player can hide behind
column2: but these will eventually be destroyed by either enemy missiles or by direct contact with the invaders themselves. The player's shots will also destroy the shields.

column1: The aliens' descent quickens as they are eliminated

column1: 3609;sidearjp;sidearmsj;"Hyper Dyne SIDE ARMS (c) 1986 Capcom.
;An evil alien race called the 'Bozon' are trying to wipe out Mankind
column2: and Lieutenant Henry and Sergent Sanders are given the responsibility of saving the Human Race. They each climb into a Mobilsuit - a jet-powered
column3: heavily armoured combat suit - and set out on their mission.

column1: Side Arms is a horizontally - and occasionally vertically - scrolling shoot-em-up for one or two players. Each player has two fire buttons
column2: one for shooting ahead and one for shooting behind; crucial for a game in which enemies attack from all directions. Shooting certain enemies will reveal power-ups - displayed as 'POW' icons - and shooting the icons will either change their type
column3: or reveal a special weapon.

column1: Finally
column2: Side Arms features a unique power-up. These power-ups are hidden in the level and can be collected by shooting at their location with any weapon. By collecting a circle icon that flashed between the Greek 'Beta' and ok
column3: both players can join together to become a single
column4: highly powerful combat unit capable of firing in eight different directions. When a two-player unit is joined
column5: BOTH players' controllers can control the unit's movement
column6: which can cause the unit to not move if players decide to go in different directions to each other. The player who picks up this power-up will control the main weapon from his current list only and the other player will be able to fire the secondary eight-direction weapon. The eight-direction weapon can be fired by single presses or automatically by holding either fire button.

column1: In a two-player game
column2: this form will break apart after one hit to the unit
column3: returning to both players individual units. In a one-player game it will break apart after two hits
column4: causing the second unit to be destroyed.

column1: Appearance of the super unit and the eight-directional weapon is dependant on which player gets the power-up. First-player unit is a primarily orange unit that fires red triangle projectiles one way. Second-player unit is a blue unit that fires blue boomerangs that fly out and return causing a slower rate of fire.
The 8 available power-ups are :
* Speed-up (POW symbol)
* Speed-down (Reverse POW symbol
column2: shows just before reaching Auto I or II)

column1: * Bit - (3 level power-up)
* Spread Gun - (3 level power-up)
* Mega Bazooka Launcher (2 level power-up)
* 3-Way Shot (2 level power-up)
* Auto I (Chain gun)
* Auto II (3-Way Auto)
Players are able to carry all of the game's available weapons simultaneously and can switch between each one to suit the situation. All weapons can also be powered-up by collecting a similar option."

3615;sidetrac;sidetrac;Side Trak (c) 1979 Exidy.

;Side Trak is a black & white man-versus-machine game where the goal is to pick up all of the waiting passengers with your train while avoiding the computer-driver 'killer engine' which aims to take you out in a head-on collision. You can control your train via the 'fast' button which allows you to temporarily increase your speed on the tracks. You can also use the joystick to switch between several tracks at various junction points.
Each time you make a complete circuit around the track and pass the start marker on the outside track
column2: another car is added to your train."

3622;simps2pa;simpsons2p2;"The Simpsons (c) 1991 Konami.
;A jewel heist gone wrong sees Mr Burns's sidekick
column2: Smithers
column3: kidnapping Maggie and making his escape. Between one and four players take on the role of either Homer
column4: Marge
column5: Lisa
column6: or Bart in this colorful
column7: horizontally-scrolling beat-em-up from Konami. Each Simpsons character possesses an attacking move specific to them; Marge is armed with a vacuum cleaner
column8: Lisa has a skipping rope
column9: Bart has his skateboard
column10: and Homer fights with his fists. The players must battle their way through a variety of Simpsons-themed levels - such as Springfield and Krustyland - fighting goons
column11: thugs
column12: zombies
column13: drunks
column15: and several Simpsons regulars. Many Simpsons characters that don't appear as enemies have 'cameo' scenes in the game (Otto working at a burgerstand in Krustyland
column16: for example). The archetypal 'boss' character awaits the players at the end of every stage. The game ends with a final showdown with the evil Mr. Burns in his luxurious mansion.

column1: The Simpsons was designed to Konami's typically-high production standards and was
column2: like the 'Ninja Turtles' games that appeared a couple of years' earlier
column3: very faithful to its source material. The colorful
column4: smoothly-animated sprites captured the spirit of the legendary cartoon superbly
column5: and the game's many humorous touches were timed to perfection."

column1: 3626;sindbadm;sindbadm;"Sindbad Mystery (c) 1983 Sega.

;Described as an Intelligent Puzzle Game on the title screen, the player uses a 4-way joystick to take control of the Sindbad, and direct him around various different mazes to collect thirty question marks to reveal the parts of the maze on a treasure map at the top of the screen, while avoiding the various enemies. Once he collects one question mark in a particular part of the maze it will reveal the location of a treasure item for that round. Sindbad will then have to dig up that spot to find the treasure item. Once this is done, he will receive the remaining value of the round's timer as a bonus.

column1: 3628;sinista2;sinistar2;Sinistar (c) 1982 Williams.

;Your intergalactic crystal-mining mission takes you to the antipodes of the known universe. But your parametric DeepSpace scanner faithfully displays the sector of the galaxy you presently occupy (including an area fully three parsecs across
column2: no less)!

column1: Keep the galaxy safe for all its sinizens! Fiendish Worker ships from the planet Sporg will attempt to fabricate a Sinistar from the remains of derelict planetoids in your very sector. You must not let them do this for two reasons :
1) These planetoids contain the life-sustaining crystals that your civilization requires for its vital technologies.
2) With the eminently unstable Sinistar in their possession
column2: the Sprogites can lay waste to any civilization in your sector. You alone stand in their way.

column1: You must mine the sinisite crystals. Williams has equipped you with the latest heuristic electret cannon technology. All you need to do is aim at a planetoid and shoot. Now collect your motherlode!
In fact
column2: only with sinisite can you manufacture sinibombs to eradicate the Sinistar. But you must also rebuff the Workers and disintegrate their even more aggressive comrades-at-arms
column3: the evil skelomorphic Warriors! Intelligent beings everywhere depend on your courage
column4: your dedication
column5: your reserve
column6: your shrewd command of tactical invention! It's up to you
column7: space cadet!"

3634;sisv;sisv3;Space Invaders (c) 1978 Taito.

;Space Invaders is quite simply the most influential video-game of all time. A single player moves an armed 'laser base' left or right along the bottom of the screen and shoots the endless waves of aliens marching relentlessly down the screen towards earth.
There are four buildings (shields) at the bottom of the screen that the player can hide behind
column2: but these will eventually be destroyed by either enemy missiles or by direct contact with the invaders themselves. The player's shots will also destroy the shields.

column1: The aliens' descent quickens as they are eliminated
column2: making them harder to hit. A flying saucer will fly across the top of the screen at regular intervals and can be shot to earn extra points."

3640;skullxb1;skullxbo1;Skull & Crossbones (c) 1989 Atari Games Corporation.
;Skull & Crossbones is a swashbuckling adventure in which players portray two pirates competing for food
column2: drink
column3: booty
column4: and revenge. Players use a joystick and button to control the unique sword-fighting action.

column1: The game begins with an encounter with the evil Wizard
column2: who robs our heroes of all of their booty. The pirates swear revenge and set off on a quest to destroy the Wizard and recover their treasure.

column1: The adventure takes them around the world. The pirates battle the fierce captains and crews of opponent ships. They encounter the soldier guards and the merciless Executioner in the Spanish castle. In the ninja camp they fight the Ninja Master and his followers. On the beach the heroes encounter the dreaded Medusa and a horde of wicked skeletons that rise from the dead.
Finally
column2: the pirates reach the Wizard's Island
column3: where they must again do battle against the shadow figures of the Executioner
column4: the Ninja Master
column5: and the Medusa before they can fight face-to-face with the evil Wizard. If they make it to the throne room and overcome the Wizard
column6: players are rewarded with a room full of treasure.

column1: Players use a joystick and sword button in a combination of defensive and offensive maneuvers to battle the various enemies. Players can learn the lunge and back-slash
column2: two. skilled sword-fighting moves that are the most effective.

column1: In order to increase the long-term appeal of the game
column2: players can select various difficulty levels of easy
column3: medium
column4: and hard to vary their paths through the game. By selecting the longer hard path
column5: players are rewarded with more food
column6: drink
column7: and booty along the way."

;This is quite a fun game, where you score points for landing on an ever decreasing patch of 'good' land. Why 'good'? As you descend without opening your parachute your landing point becomes smaller, but the points become higher, just don't leave pulling the ripcord too late because the Newtonian laws concerning gravity is working against you. Each time you successfully land the plane goes lower.

- TRIVIA -
Released in April 1987."
3655;skykid;skykid;"Sky Kid (c) 1985 Namco.

;Sky Kid is a 2-D, scrolling shooter type of game. You play as the character Sky Kid. Sky Kid flies around in a bi-plane and is assigned specific targets during the missions. These missions involved bombing specific targets. This would seem easy, however, there are a few obstacles Sky Kid must overcome to get to the target safely. First, the bi-plane is not equipped with the bomb. Sky Kid must pick up the bomb en route to the target. Second, there are both ground and air units that attempt to keep Sky Kid from accomplishing his mission. Last, Sky Kid may have to navigate through some very inhospitable terrain or navigate around cities in order to get to the target. The targets that Sky Kid must bomb will either be a fortress complex or a ship. As one moves farther up in the missions, it isn't uncommon to have multiple targets in one mission. Perhaps barnstorming would have been a better idea.

;Sky Raider is a two-dimensional, vertical scrolling game. You get to be the pilot of a bomber whose task is to destroy as many targets as possible in the allotted period of time. Fortunately for the player, it is a target-rich environment and the best part is that there are no defenses to fly through. That means you get to bomb targets at will without fear of any enemy fire. Who could ask for a simpler type of game.

column1: ;Sky Soldiers is a vertical scrolling Shoot em' Up developed by Alpha Denshi and released to arcades in 1988 by Romstar in North America and SNK for the rest of the world. The game features a time travel theme as well as an organized weapon select screen at the beginning of each stage.
Players travel back in time starting in Great Britain 1945
column2: Germany 1915
column3: Japan 1945
column4: Germany 1944
column5: Vietnam 1974
column6: France 1914
column7: Russia 1974 and finally the space station in the present time
column8: 2110. Each time stage has two levels
column9: both ending in a boss battle save for the final stage
column10: resulting in a total of 15 Areas.

column1: The ship's weapon system is accessed in the beginning of each stage. The ship’s main shot consists of a semi-automatic Wave Shot. The ship’s bomb weapons include forward firing missiles
column2: fireballs
column3: homing missiles and the buster bomb. The ship can be equipped with only one bomb weapon from either category at a time. The ship can only be loaded with a certain number of Bomb weapons and they can only be resupplied at the end of the level. The only pick-up item in the game is a parachuting human pilot shot down from malfunctioning fighter planes/jets; collecting these pilots results in random bonus points."

column2: Incorporated.

column1: ;The year is 1999. Television has adapted to the more violent nature of man. The most popular form of television remains the game show. One show in particular has dominated the ratings. That show is SMASH TV. The most violent game show of all time. Two lucky contestants compete for cash and prizes. Each contestant is armed with an assortment of powerful weapons and sent into a closed arena. The action takes place in front of a studio audience and is broadcast live via satellite around the world. Be prepared. The future is now. You are the next lucky contestant!
Smash TV Game Rules:
1. Move with LEFT joystick to avoid enemies and gather prizes (cash and game show gifts).
2. Fire weapons with RIGHT joystick and collect power-up icons for increased firepower.
3. Advance to next game arena when enemies are gone."

column1: 3703;snowbroa;snowbrosa;"Snow Bros. - Nick & Tom (c) 1990 Toaplan.
;One or two players take on the roles of snowmen Nick and Tom as they battle a variety of monsters over fifty platform-based
column2: single screen levels. The snowmen must throw snowballs at the enemies
column3: eventually encasing them completely in snow. The encased enemies must them be kicked in order to destroy them. This is achieved by standing next to the snowball and pressing the ""kick out"" button
column4: which sends the giant snowball flying around the screen
column5: killing any enemies that lay in its path. During every 10th level
column6: the players must face and defeat an end-of-level boss.

column1: A number of power-ups are available
column2: in the form of coloured potions. The power-ups are as follows :

column1: * Yellow = Long shot
* Red = Speed up
* Blue = Bigger snowballs (encases monsters quicker)
* Green = Inflates the players like a balloon and lets them fly around the screen
column2: killing any monsters they touch."

;Solar Fox is a space shooter and a Pac-Man type game all in one. The playing field is square and only has walls on the outside. Each wall has a moving cannon mounted that will fire odd shaped torpedoes at your ship. Scattered around the inside will be a bunch of pellets in various simple patterns. To complete each level you have to drive over
column2: or shoot all of the pellets. If done quickly enough the game will skip a level (going from 1 to 3
column3: etc)
column4: and award you point for the level skipped.

column1: If you select Novice difficulty at the beginning
column2: the Solar Fox's normal speed will be slow
column3: and pressing the Speed Button will speed it up. If you should select Expert difficulty
column4: its normal speed will be faster
column5: and pressing the Speed Button will slow it down. Every fourth rack is also a bonus rack
column6: and if you die in one
column7: it will not cost you a life. After clearing ten racks
column8: a player becomes a member of the ""10-Rack Club"" and the game will continue on as normal."

column1: 3713;solarq;solarq;"Solar Quest (c) 1981 Cinematronics.
;In the center of the screen is a sun. Any space ships or ship's fire coming in contact with the sun are destroyed. The sun exerts an increasing gravitational pull as play progresses.
A player controlled space ship is randomly located on the screen. The space ship's movement is controlled by rotate right
column2: rotate left
column3: and thrust buttons. For quick escapes
column4: the space ship can be thrust into hyperspace
column5: causing the ship to disappear and then reappear in a different location.

column1: The space ship possesses two weapons. The first weapon consists of shots fired by pressing the fire button. These shots will destroy any alien ships they strike
column2: but will disintegrate if they do not hit any targets. The second weapon is a nuke which is launched by pressing the nuke button. The nuke will continue to travel across the screen until either it strikes a target or the player detonates the nuke by pressing the nuke button a second time. The nuke will destroy all alien ships within a limited radius of the explosion.

column1: At the top of the screen is a display showing the player's score
column2: the number of ships remaining
column3: and the number of nukes a player has available.

column1: The game consists of different phases. Each phase begins with several alien ships appearing from random points along the edge of the screen. The number of the alien ships is determined by the phase
column2: with a maximum of eight ships for any single type of alien ship in a phase.

column1: The alien ships move across the screen in a random pattern. After a predetermined time
column2: dependent upon the phase
column3: the alien ships will begin to chase the player's space ship. The player must shoot the alien ships before his ship is rammed by an alien ship. In later phases
column4: the alien ships can shoot at the player's space ship as well as ram it.

column1: Any alien ship that is destroyed by the player will leave a survivor. The player can either capture or kill the survivor. Survivors cannot be killed with nukes. If the survivor is neither captured nor killed
column2: it will begin to drift towards the sun. Survivors disappear when they come in contact with the sun.

column1: If the player does not shoot any alien ships
column2: one or two ghost ships will appear and begin to chase the player's space ship. The ghost ship will shoot at the player's space ship during any phase. The length of time it takes for the ghost ships to appear shortens with each phase
column3: until at least one is always present. A ghost ship will not leave a survivor when it is destroyed.

column1: During a phase
column2: seven different types of alien ships will appear. It is possible for several types of alien ships to be on the screen at one time. A phase is completed after all the alien ships have been destroyed or a specific amount of time has elapsed.

column1: A player must be careful when using hyperspace. Excessive use will cause hyperspace to lock-out for a short period
column2: making a player's space ship more vulnerable. A player's space ship cannot be destroyed in hyperspace.

column1: As play continues
column2: each phase becomes successively more difficult; the number of alien ships increases
column3: the length of time before the alien ships attack shortens
column4: and the alien ships firing capability activates. When a player's space ship is destroyed
column5: play resumes at the same point. The game ends when all of a player's space ships are destroyed.

column1: 1- and 2-player options are available. In the 2-player mode
column2: players alternate until all their ships are destroyed. If 1-player receives more extra ships than another
column3: he will be allowed to play the extra ships even though his opponent's game is over.

column1: An extra nuke is awarded every 10
column2: 000 points. An extra space ship is awarded after capturing a specified number of survivors."

3719;solomon;solomonj;Solomon's Key - Solomon no Kagi (c) 1986 Tecmo.

;Solomon's Key is a single player platform/puzzle game in which the wizard Dana is on a quest to retrieve Solomon's key and vanquish the demon hordes that have broken through into his world. To achieve this Dana must advance through the fifty rooms of 'Constellation Space'
column2: before finally reaching the magical key.

column1: Dana is armed with a magic wand that can be used to both destroy and create granite blocks
column2: while blocks situated directly above Dana's head can be destroyed by repeatedly jumping up into them until they shatter. The blocks act as platforms
column3: as well as barriers to defend Dana from the numerous patrolling enemies. Each room contains a golden key
column4: retrieving this automatically opens the room's exit door and players must then try to find/create a safe route past the constantly spawning demons to reach the exit and progress to the next room.

column1: Bonus Items - some hidden inside pre-existing granite blocks - are scattered throughout each room. Collecting these earns the player extra points. Power-ups can also be found
column2: these appear as potion bottles with a flame emblazoned on them and a maximum of three can be carried at any one time. When a potion is used
column3: Dana shoots a fireball which will move along the walls and platforms until it hits and kills the first demon it comes into contact with.

column1: As well as bonus items and power-ups
column2: each room also contains a hand-bell. When collected this triggers the release of a trapped fairy
column3: the fairy will then slowly fly around the room and can be rescued for bonus points. An extra life is awarded for every ten fairies rescued.

column1: The game's levels are based on Zodiac star constellations. The main levels are divided into groups of four - making a total of fourty-eight standard rooms - with each group representing a separate constellation. In addition to the standard rooms
column2: each constellation also has a secret bonus room that can only be accessed by finding the given constellation's 'Seal'
column3: which is located in the last room of each group. There are three further secret rooms - 'Page of Time'
column4: 'The Page of Space' and the 'Princess Room' - that are only accessible if the player has found the 'Hidden Seals of Solomon'.

column1: The four room groups are:
1-4 Aries 5-8 Taurus 9-12 Gemini
13-16 Cancer 17-20 Leo 21-24 Scorpio
25-28 Libra 29-32 Virgo 33-36 Sagittarius
37-40 Capricorn 41-44 Aquarius 45-48 Pisces"
3720;solvalou;solvalou;"Solvalou (c) 1991 Namco.
;A great sequel
column2: with a first-person 3-D viewpoint.

column1: You be once again the pilot of mighty combat aircraft 'Solvalou' this time under a first-person view
column2: through the perspective of the pilot and armed with the classic weaponry the forward-firing gun for aerial targets
column3: and the bombs to destroying ground-based targets.

column1: Your pilot skills will be tested! destroy's all the air and ground enemies and dodge all his attacks
column2: to reach the end and destroy the giant mothership 'Andor Genesis' to restore peace in the planet."

column1: 3721;sonic;sonic;"Segasonic The Hedgehog (c) 1992 Sega.
;A scrolling
column2: isometric racing game for one to three players featuring Sega's legendary mascot
column3: 'Sonic the Hedgehog'. Sonic's nemesis
column4: 'Dr. Robotnik'
column5: is once again intent on World domination and is preparing to launch his latest attack from his new island base
column6: Eggman Island.

column1: When 'Sonic'
column2: 'Ray'
column3: and 'Mighty' drop in to thwart his plans
column4: Robotnik catches them with one of his devious machines. After finding themselves imprisoned in a tower
column5: the trio break free onto the island
column6: and proceed to make their escape and try to defeat Robotnik and his evil plans.

column1: Sega Sonic's gameplay retains elements of the original console games
column2: such as Sonic's ability to jump on the heads of enemies to kill them. The golden rings that Sonic collects are also included. Each level is littered with Dr Robotnik's devious traps; with lava flows
column3: collapsible platforms
column4: locked gates etc. all serving to hamper Sonic's progress."

column1: 3722;sonicp;sonicp;"Segasonic The Hedgehog (c) 1992 Sega.
;A scrolling
column2: isometric racing game for one to three players featuring Sega's legendary mascot
column3: 'Sonic the Hedgehog'. Sonic's nemesis
column4: 'Dr. Robotnik'
column5: is once again intent on World domination and is preparing to launch his latest attack from his new island base
column6: Eggman Island.

column1: When 'Sonic'
column2: 'Ray'
column3: and 'Mighty' drop in to thwart his plans
column4: Robotnik catches them with one of his devious machines. After finding themselves imprisoned in a tower
column5: the trio break free onto the island
column6: and proceed to make their escape and try to defeat Robotnik and his evil plans.

column1: Sega Sonic's gameplay retains elements of the original console games

column1: 3723;sonicwi;sonicwi;"Sonic Wings (c) 1992 Video System.

;Take your pick among 4 countries' ace pilots and take it to the skies to destroy enemy jets, hulking bosses and some strange hidden enemies in this solid overhead shoot'em up! Features solid 2-D graphic and a good level of challenge.
3724;sonicwi2;sonicwi2;Sonic Wings 2 (c) 1994 Video System.
;The first sequel to the superb vertically scrolling shoot-em-up ""Sonic Wings""
column2: players once again take control of a Jet fighter aircraft and take to the skies to destroy enemy jets
column3: boats
column4: helicopters
column5: gun emplacements and huge end-of-level bosses. The graphics are every bit as accomplished as those of the prequel and the game delivers a good level of challenge.

column1: The end-of-level bosses change from game-to-game; a nice touch that adds variety to an already solid game.
Players can choose to play as any one of eight different fighter pilots
column2: each of which pilots a different jet :

column1: * American F-117A Nighthawk piloted by Robo-Keaton.
* American A-10 Thunderbolt II piloted by Mao Mao.
* Japanese Fighter-Support X piloted by Hien.
* Japanese F-15 Eagle piloted by Captain Silver.
* International F-14 Tomcat piloted by Cindy and Ellen.
* International YF-23 Black Widow II piloted by Spanky.
* French Rafale piloted by Steve.
* British Sea Harrier FRS2 piloted by Bobby."
3725;sonicwi3;sonicwi3;"Sonic Wings 3 (c) 1995 Video System.

;The third game in this excellent series adheres to the solid shoot-em-up template set down by its predecessors. The player takes on the role of a Jet Fighter aircraft pilot whose mission is to combat world terrorism. The object of the game is to fly from country to country and destroy all opposition around the world
column2: before flying into outer space to combat the menace responsible for the terrorism. Each pilot has his own storyline that ties in with the game.

column1: One enemy shot destroys the player's plane and releases a special power-up that the plane may have been carrying. If the player's final ship is destroyed
column2: all power-ups and extra bombs are released and can be collected if the player chooses the 'continue' option
column3: or if a second player is still active. However
column4: on the final mission in Outer Space
column5: the player is forced to start again at the beginning of the space mission
column6: unless 2 players are active.

column1: Sonic Wings now features an array of 10 selectable pilots :
American Vought F4U Corsair piloted by Robo-Keaton.
American Northrop P-61 Black Widow piloted by the Blazers.
Japanese Mitsubishi A6M Zero-Sen piloted by Hien.
Japanese Aichi M6A1 Seiran piloted by Mao Mao.
Soviet Il-2 Stormovik piloted by Chaika and Pooshka.
Soviet Polikarpov I-16 piloted by Spanky.
German Dornier Do-335 Pfeil piloted by Malcolm ('Pfeil' is german for 'Arrow')
German Junkers Ju-87 Stuka piloted by Kowful and River.
British Westland Whirlwind piloted by Alex and Pictus.
British Fairy Swordfish piloted by Cindy and Ellen.
There are also 2 secret planes (see the TIPS AND TRICKS section for details) :
The Aka Usagi (Red Rabbit) piloted by Kotomi.
The Diabloon piloted by The Man.
Planes Spec. :
Vought F4U Corsair can have 3 power-ups and 5 bombs.
Northrop P-61 Black Widow can have 3 power-ups and 7 bombs.
Mitsubishi A6M Zero-Sen have 3 power-ups and 5 bombs.
Aichi M6A1 Seiran can have 2 power-ups and 5 bombs.
Il-2 Stormovik can have 2 power-ups and 7 bombs.
Polikarpov I-16 can have 4 power-ups and 6 bombs.
Dornier Do-335 Pfeil can have 3 power-ups and 4 bombs.
Junkers Ju-87 Stuka can have 4 power-ups and 7 bombs.
Westland Whirlwind can have 3 power-ups and 6 bombs.
Fairy Swordfish can have 1 power-up and 7 bombs.
Aka Usagi (Red Rabbit
column2: see below) can have 2 power-ups and 4 bombs.

column1: Diabloon (see below) can have 7 power-ups and 2 bombs."
3726;sonofphx;sonofphx;"Son of Phoenix (c) 1985 Associated Overseas MFR.
;Pirate version of ""Repulse"". See this entry for more information about the game itself.
- TRIVIA -
Son of Phoenix was released in November 1985."
3727;sonson;sonson;"Son Son (c) 1984 Capcom Company
column2: Limited.

column1: ;The game is a 2-D sidescrolling platformer. The screen scrolls automatically
column2: only stopping to fight major enemies. The screen features six continuous platforms that occasionally feature small gaps. Sonson and Tonton walk automatically across these platforms. Pressing up or down will cause them to jump up or down to the next platform. Pressing left causes them to move more slowly than the screen scrolls
column3: essentially continuing to move forward but at a reduced pace. Pressing right does the opposite - SonSon and TonTon will move across the platforms faster than the screen scrolls. The duo have only one attack - the ability to fire energy blasts from their staves. Touching an enemy or an unfriendly projectile causes the player to lose a life. If a player has any additional lives
column4: they will return to the screen riding on a cloud that will give them temporary invincibility. If the player presses the control stick in any direction
column5: the cloud will disappear and the character will resume its usual walking mode. The cloud will eventually disappear on its own if the control stick is not used.

column1: Power-ups come in the form of various fruits which produce points (with enough points giving the player an extra life). Gathering certain fruit will cause all enemies currently on a screen to turn into point-bearing fruits. Walking across certain platforms will randomly cause a bamboo shoot to sprout
column2: yielding many extra points. Keep in mind that it is possible to play the game co-operatively with partner who plays as TonTon."

column1: 3728;sonsonj;sonsonj;"Son Son (c) 1984 Capcom Company
column2: Limited.

column1: 3729;sos;sos;"SOS (c) 1979 Namco.
;The player controls a fighter plane called a 'Shinryaku' which is situated at the bottom of the screen
column2: while enemy planes fly down from above. The player may destroy them for 10 points each. Every few seconds
column3: an ""SOS"" signal will sound and an arrow will point to either side of the screen
column4: and the player must get there before it stops to receive 30 points and eliminate some of the enemy planes that have passed the Shinryaku. If 100 enemy planes make it past the Shinryaku
column5: the game is instantly over."

column1: 3730;sotsugyo;sotsugyo;"Sotsugyou Shousho (c) 1995 Mitchell.
3731;soukobdx;soukobdx;Soukoban Deluxe (c) 1990 Namco.

;A puzzle game where you control a boy who tries to push the boxes onto the blue circles.
3732;soulclbr;soulclbr;Soul Calibur (c) 1998 Namco
column2: Limited.

column1: ;The mystical sword of the legends
column2: the ""Soul Edge""
column3: ended up in the hands of the dreaded pirate Cervantes de Leon of Spain. For the next 25 years he stayed dormant on the remnants of a Spanish port town
column4: taking the souls of those who reached him during their search of the sword. His reign of terror was soon to start
column5: but through the joined efforts of Greek divine warrior Sophitia Alexandra and Japanese kunoichi Taki
column6: he was stopped and killed
column7: with one of the twin Soul Edge blades being shattered in the process. As it was about to tear itself apart
column8: young Prussian knight Siegfried Schtauffen approached the port town and battled Cervantes
column9: whose corpse had been momentarily reanimated through Soul Edge's will. After emerging victorious
column10: Siegfried's attention turned unto the sword. The moment he took the hilt of the cursed blade
column11: Soul Edge released a bright column of light into the sky. This was known as the ""Evil Seed""
column12: bound to bring calamity and death in its wake.

column1: Three years after those events
column2: Soul Edge uses Siegfried as its host
column3: and now Siegfried is Nightmare
column4: a knight wearing azure armor and sporting a hideously deformed right arm. Europe plunges into a vortex of slaughters as he and his followers claim souls to strengthen the blade in its weakened state. Unknown to them
column5: a group of warriors met on their journey to stop Soul Edge
column6: and with them three sacred weapons join once again."

column1: 3733;souledga;souledgeua;"Soul Edge (c) 1995 Namco.
;A great 3-D fighting game in which the combatants use hand-held weapons.
The game is set in the year 1584. The game tells the tale of warriors searching for the ultimate sword
column2: ""Soul Edge"". It has been given many names throughout the history
column3: such as ""The Sword of Salvation""
column4: ""The Sword of Heroes"" and ""The Ultimate Sword"" among others. Many strong warriors searched for years
column5: but very few actually found it. The sword
column6: currently in the form of a twin pair of long swords
column7: appeared mysteriously in an auction. It was taken by the dreaded Captain Cervantes and nothing was known of his fate thereafter. Now
column8: nine warriors from around the world search for the sword for different reasons. Some for power
column9: others for revenge; some believing it's a benevolent sword
column10: searching for its support; while others knowing of its evil nature
column11: seeking its destruction. Nothing is known for certain about the sword
column12: except for one thing: it brings misfortune to those seeking it."
