4239;tondemo;tondemo;Tondemo Crisis (c) 1999 Polygon Magic.
;A bizarre game
column2: featuring funny mini-games

column1: The game follows each member of a Japanese
column2: working-class family of four members on their bizarre adventures home from their daily routines to get birthday presents for the family's grandmother Haruko. The game consists of several action-oriented minigames strung together and book-ended with pre-rendered cutscenes. The game was designed and scripted by Kenichi Nishi and features music from the Tokyo Ska Paradise Orchestra."

column1: 4240;tontonb;tontonb;"Tonton (c) 1987 Dynax.

;Tonton the pig challenges you to mahjong!
4241;toobin;toobin;Toobin' (c) 1988 Atari Games Corp.
;Toobin' is a unique fantasy-adventure game. 1 or 2 players can race Bif and Jet
column2: the Toobin' dudes
column3: in their inner tubes
column4: down 45 different rivers. The players try to keep Jet and Bif afloat
column5: avoiding sharp objects
column6: gaining points
column7: and throwing cans at obstacles. Toobin' appeals to both males and females of all ages who both find it just 'fun to play'.

column1: Toobin' has a continuous buy-in feature so players can join in at any time. Toobin' has a color-coded control panel and players can identify Jet in the yellow inner tube and Bif in the black inner tube and red shorts.
Each player has a set of four buttons to steer Bif or Jet forwards
column2: backwards
column3: and sideways. Pressing the two Paddle Forward buttons moves the inner tube forward. Pressing the two Back Paddle buttons moves the inner tube backwards. Pressing only one Paddle button makes the inner tube turn. The player uses the Throw Can button to destroy obstacles in the river and stun riverside pests.

column1: Toobin' players can enjoy amusing game play and an incredible variety of rivers and environments for their long-term enjoyment.
The player races Bif or Jet against other players
column2: or against the game
column3: down Toobin's 45 different rivers
column4: paddling through six classes of play
column5: and cruising the 15 unique river environments. The player can choose almost 200 courses through the rivers
column6: finding his own way through rapids
column7: obstacles
column8: riverside pests and waterfalls.

column1: The player has to guide Bif or Jet around obstacles
column2: go through gates and pick up treasure to accumulate points to get more inner tube patches
column3: collect cans to throw at obstacles and to stun riverside pests
column4: and paddle fast enough to avoid the big 'gator lurking in all the rivers.

column1: At the finish line
column2: players are treated to a party. Each party grows in size until the player reaches the final super party at the end of the game.

column1: Inner-Tube Patches : At the beginning of each game
column2: the player has a certain number of inner-tube patches
column3: which represent game lives. A player receives extra patches by scoring the number of points required for another patch. The number of points required changes from level to level
column4: and is displayed in the lower left and right corners of the playfield. A player can also receive more patches by picking up patches floating in the rivers.

column1: Cans : The player must accumulate cans to throw at obstacles and pests. All cans are the same value. The player can pick up individual cans floating in all the rivers or six-packs hidden under obstacles or in back waters (Six packs give unlimited cans). The player throws the cans by pointing Bif or Jet at the obstacle and pressing the Throw Can button.
Most of the obstacles in the river can be eliminated by hitting them with a can.
Dangers : The player must avoid or eliminate dangers in the river and stun pests on the river banks. The dangers in the river include falling rocks
column2: floating logs
column3: deadly falling coconuts
column4: icebergs
column5: mines
column6: stampeding cattle
column7: snakes
column8: crocodiles
column9: barbed wire
column10: and thorny bushes.

column1: Dangerous riverside pests throw and shoot objects at Bif and Jet. The player can stun most of these objectionable characters with a can thrown in their direction. These pests include Casting fishermen
column2: Hillbillies
column3: Terrorists
column4: Devils
column5: Martians
column6: Street punks
column7: Pistolaros
column8: Natives
column9: Penguins
column10: Bears
column11: Dinosaurs
column12: and Cavemen.

column1: Big 'Gator : If a player is slow
column2: the big 'gator comes up from behind to discourage slow play and hurry the player through the gates. A loud thumping sound warns the player of its presence. One escape from the big 'gator is to quickly paddle downstream or pass through a gate. If the gator catches Bif or Jet
column3: one inner-tube patch is lost."

4254;topsecrt;topsecrt;Top Secret (c) 1987 Capcom.
;Top Secret is a scrolling platform shoot-em-up set ten years after the end of World War III
column2: with the player taking on the role of 'Super Joe'; an elite Commando tasked with infiltrating the enemy's heavily defended military base to discover their secrets plans and destroy their missile silos.

column1: To aid him in his mission
column2: Joe is equipped with a bionic arm; a telescopic grappling hook that is used to traverse the many platforms and ledges that make up the game's levels. The arm can also be used to temporarily stun enemies or knock them from platforms
column3: as well as to retrieve the bonus items
column4: wooden crates and weapons that are occasionally dropped into the war zone by parachute.

column1: As well as the bionic arm
column2: Joe is armed with a shotgun used to kill enemies and destroy obstructions. The shotgun can only be fired left and right
column3: however
column4: and cannot be used at the same time as the bionic arm. More powerful guns can be picked up throughout the game.

column1: Bionic Commando consists of five stages:
* Stage 1: Forest
* Stage 2: Enemy Outpost (The Forefront)
* Stage 3: Underground Base (Infiltration)
* Stage 4: Control Tower
* Stage 5: Stop the Missile
In the final level
column2: Joe must stop a nuclear missile from launching
column3: before a final confrontation with the game's final boss
column4: the leader of the enemy forces."

;(Tora-he no Michi)

'Ryu Ken Oh' raided villages and kidnapped small children to brainwash them and make them into soldiers. Master of 'Oh Rin' temple ordered his best student 'Lee Wong' to destroy 'Ryu Ken Oh' and save the children. To meet with 'Ryu Ken Oh'
column2: 'Lee Wong' must clear 4 stages and destroy big enemy at the end of each stage. 'Lee Wong' was given a magical jacket to jump and fly around
column3: and weapons from the master to destroy 'Ryu Ken Oh'."

4260;tornbase;tornbase;Tornado Baseball (c) 1976 Midway.

;The game is a very simple game of baseball, implemented with stick figures. The game is very simple in terms of rules, and anybody can pick up on how to play fairly quickly. This is a two player only title, with both people playing for a single quarter. The pitching player selects his pitch with one joystick, while moving his outfielders with a second one. The batting player only has a single button (that is a 'swing' button). Both players use the same set of controls, so they must switch spots in front of the machine midway through each inning. You get a four inning game for one quarter, although that number can be adjusted by the game operator.
4261;toryumon;toryumon;Toryuumon (c) 1994 Sega.
4262;totcarn;totcarn;Total Carnage (c) 1992 Midway.
;A pseudo-sequel to Williams' superb 1990 shoot-em-up
column2: ""Smash TV""
column3: Total Carnage is set in a futuristic parody of the first Gulf War. General Ahkboob
column4: himself an obvious parody of Sadam Hussein
column5: has set his vast army of infantry
column6: tanks and BioGenetic Mutants onto the world.

column1: 1 or 2 players must fight through the enemy-packed levels
column2: rescuing reporters and civilians as they go. Total Carnage retains the dual-joystick control of its predecessor
column3: but introduced new weapons
column4: enemies and large
column5: scrolling levels to the original game-play.

column1: As with ""Smash TV""
column2: Total Carnage features the infamous 'Pleasuredome'; accessible only if players manage to collect the 220 keys that are hidden throughout the game's levels. Total Carnage has a much higher difficulty level than that of ""Smash TV""."

column1: 4267;toutrun;toutrun2;"Turbo Out Run (c) 1989 Sega.
;Turbo Out Run is the first arcade-based sequel to the legendary 1986 original. It eschews the forked-road
column2: variable route gameplay of it's illustrious predecessor and instead opts for a set route point-to-point race across America. There are several new game-play additions
column3: however
column4: which help to differentiate 'Turbo Out Run' from the original.

column1: Firstly
column2: there's the 'Turbo' of the game's title; a turbo boost that greatly increases the car's speed when engaged. It must be used sparingly
column3: however
column4: as overuse will cause the engine to overheat
column5: rendering the turbo useless until such time as the engine has cooled (as indicated by an on-screen 'Overheat' meter).

column1: Weather conditions are another new feature
column2: with both snow and rain having an adverse effect on driving conditions and car handling. Road surfaces also vary greatly in quality
column3: with sand
column4: oil
column5: speed bumps
column6: safety barriers
column7: standing water and other debris all adding to the challenge.

column1: The final new addition is the ability to upgrade the player's car. This is possible upon completion of every four of the game's sixteen stages. Available power-ups are an improved turbo boost
column2: a more powerful engine
column3: or better gripping tires.

column1: Turbo Out-Run's sixteen stages are as follows:
* Stage 1: New York
* Stage 2: Washington D.C.
* Stage 3: Pittsburgh
* Stage 4: Indianapolis (1st car upgrade section)
* Stage 5: Chicago
* Stage 6: St. Louis
* Stage 7: Memphis
* Stage 8: Atlanta (2nd car upgrade section)
* Stage 9: Miami
* Stage 10: New Orleans
* Stage 11: San Antonio
* Stage 12: Dallas (3rd car upgrade section)
* Stage 13: Oklahoma City
* Stage 14: Denver
* Stage 15: Grand Canyon (Runs along Route 66)
* Stage 16: Los Angeles (End of game)"
4268;toutruna;toutrun3;"Turbo Out Run (c) 1989 Sega Enterprises

column1: ;Re-release. For more information about the game itself

4270;tp2m32;tp2m32;Tetris Plus 2 (c) 1997 Jaleco.

;This game features some very nice gameplay. There's the addition of an ingame character who wanders on the blocks while you play. Secondly there's a storyline for the game. You get different bonuses on your journey as you keep going on. The game gets quite challenging after you've played some levels.
4271;tp84;tp84;Time Pilot '84 - Further Into Unknown World (c) 1984 Konami.
;Time Pilot '84 is an eight-way scrolling shoot 'em up and is the sequel to 1982's 'Time Pilot'. As with the prequel
column2: the game's stages are set over different periods in time. Players must destroy a set number of enemy ships
column3: after which an end-of-level guardian appears. Once this is destroyed the player's ship warps to the next stage.

column1: The player's ship is armed with both a forward-firing gun and an infinite number of homing missiles. Each stage consists of both green and metallic enemies
column2: the green enemies can be destroyed with the standard gun
column3: but both metallic enemies and the end-of-stage guardian can only be killed with homing missiles. As the player's ship gets close to a metallic enemy
column4: a ""lock-on"" square will appear over it
column5: fired homing missiles will then follow and hit the enemy.

column1: Unlike the prequel
column2: which displayed the year in which each level was set
column3: the time periods of 'Time Pilot '84' are indicated by new enemies and different backgrounds."

column1: 4276;trackfld;trackfld;"Track & Field (c) 1983 Konami.
;Track & Field is a multi-event sports game. Up to four players compete against each other in six track and field events in this legendary
column2: genre creating and much-copied game from Konami. The game consists of two 'Run' buttons per player (one for each 'leg' of the athlete) and one action button.

column1: Only two players can compete simultaneously so on 3 and 4-player games
column2: players have to wait their turn.

column1: An extra life is awarded for every 100
column2: 000 points acquired.

column1: Each player must qualify in the current event before they can move on to the next.
Hit the two 'Run' buttons to build up speed and use action button to jump or throw.
The six events are :
1) 100-meter Dash - Run as fast as possible.
2) Long Jump - Run to the take-off board then choose angle of jump (42 is optimal).
3) Javelin Throw - Run to the line then choose angle of throw (42 is optimal).
4) 110-meter Hurdles - Run and time jumps over the hurdles.
5) Hammer Throw - As the athlete spins faster and faster
column2: time release of hammer and angle of throw (45 is optimal).

column1: 6) High Jump - The athlete will run to the bar
column2: just as he reaches it
column3: use Action button to start the jump and hold down the action button to reduce the angle of climb
column4: i.e. you start going straight up at 90 degrees if you tap the button just once. Use run buttons while in the air to gain extra height."

column1: 4277;trally;trally;"Thrash Rally (c) 1991 Alpha Denshi.
;Thrash Rally is a top-down perspective rally racing game for one or two players. Each race begins with players asked to choose a vehicle in which to race
column2: with each offering a different balance between handling
column3: acceleration
column4: vehicle endurance and top speed.

column1: There are two racing modes on offer. The first
column2: World Rally Championship
column3: features rounds that take place over lap-based circuits
column4: with each lap having to be completed within a set time limit. World Rally mode offers players a choice of six different rally cars.

column1: The second mode is the Paris-to-Dakar rally. This doesn’t feature laps but is a point-to-point race
column2: with each stage having to be completed within a set time limit. In addition to the six rally cars of the World Rally mode
column3: the Paris-to-Dakar Rally also allows players to race in either a buggy
column4: a motorbike
column5: or a truck.

column1: All tracks feature a variety of different road surfaces
column2: such as snow
column3: gravel
column4: sand or water. Many of the tracks also feature a variety of jumps and chicanes
column5: as well as track-based obstacles that should be avoided."

4281;trckydoc;trckydoc;"Tricky Doc (c) 1987 Tecfri.
;A one or two player platform game.
The protagonist
column2: is a mad scientist that inadvertently release his genetic creations in all the phases. Of course
column3: our mission is to enclose again all our creatures and avoid chaos.

column1: Tricky Doc will move through six levels full of enemies running trying to escape
column2: and you must go dodging
column3: crouch
column4: hitting
column5: jumping
column6: going up the stairs and spraying with a spray to paralyze and defend herself from all the naughty creatures to go to the next phase."

column1: 4282;treahunt;treahunt;"Treasure Hunt (c) 1982 Hara Industries.

;This game plays a lot like ""Donkey Kong"" except that the controls are not quite as smooth. There are five screens to master if you want to help Jack in his mission. You do not get to play each screen at first
column2: they are added on as you progress through the game. The first time through the game skips from screen one right to screen four.

column1: * The first screen is fairly simple
column2: you just have to climb to the top of the beanstalk. There are a few enemies
column3: but they can be defeated by simply tossing beans at them. You can find the beans scattered all around the stalk
column4: and picking one up adds one to your ammunition count (or two
column5: depending on the dip switch settings).

column1: * In the second screen
column2: Jack maneuvers through the clouds and attempts to cross the drawbridge into the castle
column3: but lions and birds stand in his way.

column1: * The third screen has Jack climbing the castle stairway in a scene that was obviously inspired by ""Donkey Kong"". Avoid the cat and the mouse and you can make it to the top.
* On the fourth screen you have to jump from platform to platform until you reach the giant's lair. There will be several treasures
column2: grab the flashing one and try to make your escape.

column1: * The fifth screen is the first one again
column2: except that this time you are climbing down the beanstalk
column3: and you have falling rocks to dodge
column4: and the giant himself may even be after you (that one depends on the level).

column1: After making it back to your house you get to watch a little intermission before going after the next treasure. There are four different treasures altogether. The last one is the princess
column2: when you have her the giant himself will follow you down the beanstalk
column3: and you must chop it down to defeat him. After rescuing the princess the game starts over with increased difficulty."

column1: 4285;triothep;triothepj;Trio the Punch - Never Forget Me... (c) 1989 Data East.

;A hilarious action game with three selectable characters : a brawler, warrior and ninja who can randomly power up/decrease after stage complete.
4286;triplep;triplep;Triple Punch (c) 1982 KKI.

;You're the carpenter and your task is to complete the squares until you've filled the screen. Sound easy? Not when you hear what's trying to stop you. A gorilla, ghost, eraser and burst of fire all wander the paths. The eraser erases uncompleted squares and the gorilla would love to hammer you. But you're not defenceless. With three swift punches you can knock them out, except for the fire which can't be stopped. Each level introduces a larger area to fill so keep moving!
4287;triplew1;triplew1;Mahjong Triple Wars (c) 1990 Nichibutsu.

;An RPG-style mahjong game with selectable characters and items.
4288;triplew2;triplew2;Mahjong Triple Wars 2 (c) 1990 Nichibutsu.

;An RPG-style mahjong game with lots of bonus items to be found.
4289;triplfun;triplfun;Triple Fun (c) 1993.
4290;triplhnt;triplhnt;Triple Hunt (c) 1977 Atari.
;Three shooting games in one unit; Hit the Bear
column2: Witch Hunt and Racoon Hunt. The operator can select any one of the three games for his location and change it periodically merely by putting new graphic panels in and adjusting a switch on the P.C. board.

column1: Hit The Bear is a modern video version of the classic bear shooting game. Realistically animated bears walk through a 3-D green forest. When hit
column2: the bear roars
column3: stands up and turns to walk in the opposite direction.

column1: The Witch Hunt game changes the setting to a mysterious haunted house where players shoot at ghosts appearing in the windows and witches and bats flying across the screen.
In Racoon Hunt
column2: players shoot at racoons climbing trees in an Autumn forest. The objective is to keep the racoons from reaching the top of the trees as they climb faster and faster as the score goes up."

4299;trivquiz;trivquiz;Triv Quiz (c) 1984 Status Games.
;Each player begins with 10
column2: 000 points. First the player sees the question. He then decides how many points he wants to play on that question. After he has wagered his points three answers will appear. The player now tries to select the correct answer. Each player receives a minimum of four questions. Bonus questions are earned based on high scores. Scores can reach into the millions. The player who achieves the highest score can enter their initials.

column1: Triv-Quiz lets the player choose from four challenging trivia categories : 'Sports'
column2: 'Entertainment'
column3: 'World Facts' and the 'Expert Challenge'. Thousands of questions are stored."

column1: 4300;troangel;troangel;"Tropical Angel (c) 1983 Irem Corporation.

;An abstract take on the 3d racing genre, Tropical Angel puts the player in control of a female water-skier who must dodge the many rocks that protrude from the water while attempting to steer through a set number of gates - in the form of a pair of flags - before the time limit expires. The acceleration button needs to be held down all the time while the 'trick' button makes the water-skiing girl spin through one-eighty degrees and proceed to ski backwards. The player cannot steer while traveling backwards, but will earn bonus points for the duration of the trick. As the game progresses, small ramps, buoys and sharks come into play. The small ramps can be jumped to add to the player's score, although they're always in difficult to reach locations. The buoys are usually very close together, but skiing between them earns bonus points. Finally, the shark will appear from time-to-time, running into it means game over, regardless of how much time the player has left.
4301;trog;trog4;Trog (c) 1991 Midway.
;1 to 4 players take on the role of a cute dinosaur
column2: selected from the four on offer : Rex (red)
column3: Bloop (blue)
column4: Spike (yellow) and Gwen (lavender). The game takes place in a prehistoric land called 'Og' and is made up of forty-nine different islands; the dinos must collect all of the dinosaur eggs that lay on the islands
column5: while avoiding the unwanted attention of a tribe of one-eyed cavemen
column6: called 'Trogs'. The dinos can punch the attacking Trogs; one punch will only stun a Trog but several punches will knock the enemy off the screen. There are 4 different Trogs who pursue the dinos :

column1: * Brown Trogs who use only their fists.
* Red Trogs who use clubs and create fires or holes in the ground.
* Blue Trogs who pop up out of the ground and roll stone wheels.
* Green Trogs who bounce around trying to crush you with their springs.
On each island
column2: after the dinos have gathered up all of their eggs
column3: they must make their way to the base labeled 'Home'; from here they will move on to the next island.

column1: Between each stage
column2: there is an intermission where the players' Dinos will dance
column3: with an on-screen caption proudly declaring 'Excellent!'
column4: 'Congratulations!'
column5: 'Nice Work!'
column6: 'Good Job!' or 'Dino-Mite!'. On occasion
column7: an intermission screen appears that shows a Trog planning another attempt to eat a Dino."

column1: 4308;tron;tron2;"Tron (c) 1982 Bally Midway.
;Tron is a 1- or 2-player game set inside the 'Tron' computer
column2: and is based on the ground-breaking Disney movie of the same name.

column1: Tron consists of twenty-two stages - or 'phases' - of play. Each phase consists of four separate games called ""domains""
column2: all of which must be completed before moving on to the next phase. Players can determine the order in which each of the four domains is attempted
column3: but the domain position is random and is only revealed once that domain has been chosen.

column1: The four domains that make up a phase never change throughout the game
column2: although both the difficulty level and number of enemies increases with each subsequent phase. The domains are as follows:

column1: * LIGHT CYCLES : The player controls a Light Cycle that leaves a blue light trail in its wake. The aim is to 'box in' the yellow enemy Light Cycles
column2: making them crash into either a cycle trail (theirs or the player's) or a wall. The player must also avoid any collision with either walls or light trails. The joystick controls the direction of the bike and the trigger controls its speed.

column1: * I/O TOWER : Destroy the Grid Bugs that emerge from the grid surrounding the tower. The bugs will multiply and fill the entire screen if not stopped. Players must attempt to clear a path to - and enter - the I/O Tower before the timer runs out. The stick controls the movement of the player's character and the spinner controls the direction of fire.
* TANK MAZE : Destroy all enemy tanks that are patrolling the maze. The player's tank can fire in all directions and can bounce shots off walls
column2: but can be destroyed by a single shot; while enemy tanks can only fire in the direction of travel but need three shots before they are destroyed. ""Recognizer"" tanks also feature in later phases; these Do NOT shoot but move quickly and will try to ram the player's tank. The joystick controls the movement of the player's tank and the spinner controls the direction of fire.

column1: * MCP CONE : Destroy the blocks in the descending
column2: rotating coloured column to clear a path and move the character up into the light cone above the blocks. A bonus is awarded if all of the blocks are destroyed. The stick controls the movement of the character and the spinner controls the direction of fire.

column1: Bonus lives are awarded periodically throughout the game as specific point scores are reached. Each enemy and item has an assigned point value (see the ""SCORING"" section for details)."

column1: Tatsujin is a vertical scrolling shooter arcade game
column2: featuring 8 levels with non-stop action and 5 bosses."

column1: 4316;truxton2;truxton2;"達人王 (c) 1992 Toaplan Company

column1: ;(Tatsujin Oh)
Gameplay is similar to the previous Tatsujin. Tatsujin Oh has six huge areas
column2: each with a boss at the end; the game ""loops"" these six areas forever. Lives are given out at 70000 points
column3: then every 200000 points after; players start with three.

column1: There are power-ups to increase ship speed
column2: add a smartbomb to your stock

4318;ts2;ts2a;Battle Arena Toshinden 2 (c) 1995 Capcom Company
column2: Limited.

column1:
;Battle Arena Toshinden 2 is a 3-D, weapons-based fighting game featuring a total of 15 different fighters - 11 main fighters, 2 hidden fighters and 2 bosses. Battles take place in a number of 3-D rendered arenas. Unlike most other 3-D fighters of the time - in which only the graphics are 3-D, with the actual fighting taking place on a 2-D plane - Battle Arena Toshinden features wholly 3-D gameplay that allows players to dive out of the path of their opponent's attacks.

4324;tshoot;tshoot;Turkey Shoot - The Day They Took Over (c) 1984 Williams.
;The year is 1989
column2: one year after the great gobble blight which plagued the world. One-third of the earth's populace was transformed by the ailment. The side effect of the turkey transformation is a tendency toward violence and comradery between these turkeys to organize for rabble-rousing in the urban areas. In February of '89
column3: a group of specially trained agents (the turkey terminators) was formed for the sole task of destroying the turkey menace...

column1: And so it begins. As a Turkey Terminator
column2: the player is given 100 missions and 3 weapons to eliminate all the turkeys
column3: leaving no 'left-overs'. He can take aim with his lethal laser gun using the position dot on the screen Screen-shot to hone in on his enemies with deadly accuracy. He can launch a lit grenade to annihilate all the turkeys within range or he can activate his gobble button (available one time each mission) to freeze all the turkeys for an instant
column4: making them 'sitting ducks'. Missions are varied and include reacting quickly to clever ploys such as turkey air raids
column5: turkeys disguising themselves as businessmen and turkey helicopter get-aways. Every 8th round is a rapid-fire bonus wave where the player has 15 seconds to eliminate as many criminals as possible. Shooting fire hydrants and trash cans as well as freeing bystanders who have been taken hostage also score bonus points.

column1: Three 'fowl-ups' are allowed and occur whenever any turkey... a Pilot Turkey
column2: Boss Turkey
column3: Cyborg Turkey or Thug Turkey... escapes or when an innocent bystander... a businessman
column4: shopper or policeman... is damaged."

column1: ;An early 3-D shoot'em up game.
Pilot your ship through vast zones and large tubular vortex levels full of enemies. The vast zones are similar in gameplay to William's Blaster
column2: while the tubular levels are similar to Konami's Gyruss. Upon the completion of the tubular levels
column3: the player must dock with the mothership.

column1: Good luck
column2: fighter pilot!"

column1: 4334;tugboat;tugboat;"Tugboat (c) 1982 Enter-Tech
;Each level contains exactly 28 buoys. Logs are placed at random and will be re-arranged upon losing a ship on the same level. Of the eight stages
column2: the first four are with a nice
column3: wide river channel. Each of these four stages increases in speed and the number of logs on it. Stages five to eight have a much narrower river and increase in speed on each stage.

column1: Level eight is believed to be unbeatable given the complex arrangement of densely clustered logs on a narrow river. The best strategy is to pass each of the 7 stages first without losing any ships and collecting as many buoys as possible. Then
column2: on stage 8
column3: collect as many buoys as possible until you crash. Once you crash
column4: the stage will re-start and rearrange the logs (giving the player a chance to re-negotiate the tight river).

column1: Bonus scoring is cumulative."
4335;tumblep;tumblep;"Tumble Pop (c) 1991 Data East Corporation.
;Tumble Pop is a platform game for one or two players in which the aim is to clear each level of enemies by sucking them into - then ejecting them from - a portable vacuum-cleaner.
Holding down the fire button sucks the enemies into the cleaner
column2: releasing the button causes them to be expelled back out. Ejected enemies act as projectiles that can damage and kill any other on-screen enemies that they collide with. All enemies must be killed before players can progress to the next stage.

column1: Throughout the game
column2: letters of the alphabet randomly appear in bubbles. These can be collected to eventually spell the word ""TUMBLEPOP"". Once this has been achieved players are transported to a time-limited bonus level
column3: giving them the opportunity to earn bonus points and extra lives.

column1: If players take too long to finish a stage
column2: a Dracula-like enemy appears. If it touches a player before all enemies have been eliminated
column3: a life is lost. This also applies to the Boss levels.

column1: The game feature ten stages
column2: with the first eight set in different parts of the World and the final two set in Outer Space. Each stage has its own themed enemies and level bosses and players can choose to start the game on any of the eight World-based stages. The levels and enemies are:

column1: *Moscow: Set at the Moscow-state circus
column2: enemies are clowns
column3: invisible conjurers and fire spitters. The boss is a giant clown hanging from helium balloons who juggles bombs.

column1: *Egypt: Set near the pyramids and Sphinx at Giza
column2: enemies include fire spitters and mummies. The boss is a giant genie who spits fireballs.

column1: *Paris: Set near the Arc de Triomphe
column2: all of the enemies are robots. The boss is a large flying robot that sends out flying hands.

column1: *New York City: Set near the Statue of Liberty and World Trade Center
column2: the enemies are pumpkin-headed zombies and octopuses. The boss is a giant octopus.

column1: *Rio de Janeiro: Set near the statue of Christ the Redeemer
column2: enemies are fire monsters. The boss is a fire dragon.

column1: *Antarctica: Populated by snowmen
column2: snowmen armed with shovels and hairy yeti-like monsters. The boss is a giant snowman wearing a bucket on its head.

column1: *Australia. Enemies are carnivorous plants
column2: cavemen and mud men. The boss is a giant two-headed carnivorous plant.

column1: *Japan: Set at Mount Fuji
column2: enemies are yureis
column3: kappas and skeletons. The boss is a giant pile of daruma dolls.

column1: *Outer Space: Enemies are grey aliens and spacemen with blaster guns. The boss is a flying robot.
*The Moon: All bosses from the previous worlds must be fought again. The game's final boss is a cyborg mad scientist controlling a giant robot."

4339;tunhunt;tunhunt;"Tunnel Hunt (c) 1979 Atari.
4340;tunhuntc;tunhuntc;Tunnel Hunt (c) 1979 Atari.
4341;turbo;turbo;Turbo (c) 1981 Sega Enterprises
column2: Limited.

column1: ;Sega's Turbo is a 3-D racing game from Sega in which the player must pass a set number of rival racers (usually 30) before the time limit expires. Success would see the player progress to the next stage. Turbo's gameplay was unique in that centered ENTIRELY on the passing of cars; while the tracks the player raced on had all of the usual bends and turns of the racing genre
column2: they existed purely for effect and at no point did the player actually have to STEER through them.

column1: Turbo was the world's first full-color
column2: sprite scaling racing game and not
column3: as many assume
column4: Namco's ""Pole Position"". Turbo was released a full year before the Namco legend and is a further example of how Sega has dominated and innovated within the arcade racing genre.

column1: Top scores were kept on a LED panel to the left of the screen (unfortunately these scores reset every-time you turn the game off)."

4344;turbofrc;turbofrc;"Turbo Force (c) 1991 Video System Company
column2: Limited.

column1:
;Turbo Force is even more of a direct predecessor to Sonic Wings than is Rabio Lepus: Turbo Force features vertical scrolling gameplay very similar to that of the Sonic Wings series along with a nearly identical power-up system. The only differences in power-ups are that the vehicle slowly loses power even if not damaged, and that instead of a bomb that can be deployed at the player's discretion, the special weapon detonates as soon as its power-up is touched.
4345;turbotag;turbotag;Turbo Tag (c) 1985 Bally Midway.

;An overhead view demolition derby type game where the player has to ram into cars while turbo charged before they park, and avoid the red tag car, or else the turbo charger will be lost, and the player will travel slow. If any car hits the player's car while not turbo charged, the player loses a life. There are other bonus items that can be picked up for points. Collecting all 4 will send the player to the bonus round. There are bombs that the player also has to avoid to prevent losing a life. The round is ended by collecting the T-U-R-B-O letters.
4346;turfmast;turfmast;Big Tournament Golf (c) 1996 Nazca Corporation.

;An absolutely superb arcade golf game in which one or two players choose from a selection of six different golfers, each possessing different strengths and weaknesses. Four eighteen-hole golf courses are available: Germany, Japan, Australia and U.S.A. The two game modes on offer are one-player stroke play against the CPU, or stroke or match-play against a second player.
4347;turpin;turpin;Turpin (c) 1981 Sega.
;See Konami's original ""600 [Model GX353]"" for more information about the game itself.
- TRIVIA -
Turpin was released in October 1981.
This title is similar in concept to ""Frogger""
column2: but closely resembles the much later ""Super Pac-Man"" in gameplay."

column1: 4348;turtles;turtles;"Turtles (c) 1981 Stern Electronics.
;Export release. Game developed by Konami as '600'. See original ""600 [Model GX353]"" for more information about the game itself.
Differences between Turtles and 600:
1) In Turtles you're playing against other bugs/turtles. In 600 you're up against race cars.
2) In Turtles you grab each KidTurtle and bring them home. In 600 you must grab up all KidTurtles before the exit appears.
3) In Turtles you must grab bombs from the center when they appear
column2: in 600 you're given a certain amount of energy
column3: which each bomb uses.

column1: 4) The wall graphics are a bit more blocky in 600. Also
column2: the cut scenes in between racks in 600 only show one ladder
column3: with the turtle climbing alone."

;Inside King Tut's tomb are treasures beyond your wildest dreams. They can be yours... if you dare to take them. Supernatural creatures roam the mazes of the tomb guarding the treasures at all costs. column1: 4356;twineag2;twineag2;"Twin Eagle II - The Rescue Mission (c) 1994 Seta Company
column2: Limited.

column1: ;Twin Eagle II is a vertical scrolling shooter where one or two players pilot heavily armed helicopters through three stages with three areas each.
At the start of each stage
column2: the players select their path of attack through the three areas.  Areas with ground level enemies and targets are presented in a 3/4 isometric view
column3: while areas with no ground targets feature scrolling landscape images.  Players use their guns to attack flying enemy aircraft and bombs to attack ground targets such as tanks
column4: rocket launchers and high-rise skyscrapers.  If things get too hairy
column5: the player can use a missile barrage to clear the screen of enemies and enemy firepower.  Destroying some buildings reveal primary colored trucks which drop weapon power-ups and point items when destroyed.  Each area features a boss at the end
column6: which must be destroyed to advance past the area.  The final stage features one additional boss before the end of the game."

column1: 4357;twineagl;twineagl;"Twin Eagle - Revenge Joe's Brother (c) 1988 Seta Company
column2: Limited.

column1: ;A vertical shoot-em-up that places the player's helicopter against multiple attacking targets in the air
column2: sea
column3: and land. Collecting the weapon and speed power-ups throughout the game is vital since the gameplay is quite difficult.

column1: The object of the game
column2: which is not explained further
column3: is to avenge Joe's brother - which is probably not assumed to be the player
column4: but presumably a friend of the player who lost his brother to the enemy. (It uses bad English grammar on the subtitle of the screen
column5: using ""revenge"" as a verb
column6: as apposed to ""avenge"".  That being said
column7: it's a pretty tight game otherwise.)  To do so
column8: you must destroy the fortress on the very last level. When you start the game and it scrolls onto the starting screen
column9: the background contains the different levels that you must survive. The starting position of the various enemies does not vary from game to game."

;Conversion Kit for Tron. For more information about the game itself
column2: please see the original Two Tigers dedicated release; ""Two Tigers [No. 0A79]"".

column1: Two Tigers Conversion Kit has significantly different gameplay and stuff to the dedicated release:
* No speed function.
* Speed is constant.
* Steering controlled by an optical encoder on a spinner.
* Different interface locations.
* Ship graphics vary.
* All Stages occur during the day.
* All crashes include pilot escape with parachute.
* Ships shoot to crosshairs.
* Player planes have background engine sound.
* Different high score music.
* Dogfight involves shooting down the opponent's aircraft and avoiding the crosshairs.
* Sea level is halfway up the screen
* Only Bally / Midway appears in attract mode.
* There is no Hero table for Dogfight mode.
* Cloud graphics have middle line mirrored horizontally for better appearance.
* Ships have a wake."
4364;twotigra;twotiger;"Two Tigers (c) 1984 Bally Midway.

;Two Tigers is a 2-D shooter. The game starts by telling you how may hits you must make on the ship before you can claim credit for sinking it. You then will go to the next screen which has your fighter/bomber in the middle of the screen. A gunsight will also be somewhere in the sky (the gunsight is actually the spot where anti-aircraft fire will be hitting at). Soon the sky is filled with enemy planes and a ship enters the screen from the left side. You mission will be to do whatever it takes to put the required number of holes into the enemy ship to sink it. You have at your disposal a single bomb and the enemy planes themselves for achieving your goal. Along the way, other things may assist (if you shoot them) such as mines and fuel drums. The game will go until you fail to sink 2 ships. If you are in 2-player cooperative mode, then the number of holes to sink a ship will be increased. The same rules apply, though, for sending it to the bottom of the sea.

4388;uopoko;uopokoj;Puzzle Uo Poko (c) 1998 Cave.

;Uo Poko is a puzzle game for one or two players (co-operative). The aim is to clear the screen of coloured glass balls by dropping like-coloured balls down onto them. Connecting three or more like-coloured balls creates a chain reaction and causes them to disappear.
Balls are launched into the play area via a joystick controlled 'pinball-plunger' and as in Pinball
column2: the further the plunger is pulled back
column3: the further the coloured ball will travel. Mastering the strength and distance required is essential in order to drop each ball accurately onto its target. To allow players to learn how to use the plunger
column4: the first two stages feature a guide line which shows exactly where a ball will drop. From the third stage onwards
column5: players must use their judgement alone.

column1: Bonus points are awarded if a stage is completed quickly enough. If too much time is taken
column2: however
column3: the bottom of the stage will start to rise
column4: pushing the balls already in play towards the top of the screen. If the top of the screen is reached
column5: the game is over.

column1: Uo Poko features thirty stages of play."
4389;upndown;upndown;"Up'n Down (c) 1983 Sega.
;Up'n Down is an abstract racing game viewed in a forced third-person perspective.
The goal of the game is to collect coloured flags
column2: while avoiding the enemy vehicles and obstacles that litter each course. The flags needed are displayed at the top of the screen and are coloured as follows: Light green
column3: blue
column4: red
column5: olive
column6: dark green
column7: magenta
column8: yellow and black. If the flags are collected quickly enough
column9: bonus points are awarded. Collected flags remain visible on the track but are changed to white in colour.

column1: In addition to the enemy vehicles
column2: other hazards to be negotiated include potholes
column3: broken bridges
column4: steep hills and sharp corners. The player's vehicle can jump over both obstacles and vehicles
column5: and if players land their vehicle on an enemy vehicle
column6: the enemy is destroyed. Jumping at the wrong time
column7: however
column8: can send the player's vehicle into the path of an enemy
column9: or off the track completely
column10: resulting in the loss of a life. Players can also control the speed of their vehicle and even move in reverse.

column1: Each round is progressively more difficult than the last
column2: with more obstacles and enemy vehicles littering the courses."

4424;vball;vballb;"U.S.Championship Beach Volley - V'Ball (c) 1988 Technos Japan Corp.
;The player takes control of a pair of beach bums named George and Michael who make their living playing beach volleyball against locals. One day
column2: they find a flyer for a nationwide beach volleyball tournament offering the winning team a $2
column4: 000 cash prize.

column1: In single-player mode
column2: one person controls both characters on a team. In two-player mode
column3: the players either cooperate by playing on the same team or compete against each other by controlling opposing teams. The American version allows the game to be played by up to four players (if the cabinet allows it). The single-player mode consists of two cycles with four stages: the Minor Circuit and the Major Circuit. The stages in the game are Daytona Beach
column4: New York
column5: Los Angeles and Hawaii. After completing the Major Circuit
column6: the player faces against the U.S. Navy team
column7: set in a naval base.

column1: The controls consist of an eight directional joystick and two buttons for jumping and receiving. The characters perform several moves including power spiking
column2: back spiking
column3: jump-serving
column4: blocking and diving.

column1: There are a few minor differences between the Japanese and American releases. The Japanese release features an opening cut-scene explaining the plot. Between matches
column2: intermission sequences depict the main characters visiting a car dealership to purchase a vehicle. As the player progresses
column3: the cars increase in quality
column4: shifting from used cars to new cars during the Major Circuit. The American release removes these cut-scenes
column5: but extends the multiplayer support to up to four players with multiple game modes: 1 or 2 players against the computer
column8: or 2-on-2."

column1: 4425;vball2pj;vball2pj;"U.S.Championship Beach Volley - V'Ball (c) 1988 Technos Japan Corp.
;The player takes control of a pair of beach bums named George and Michael who make their living playing beach volleyball against locals. One day
column2: they find a flyer for a nationwide beach volleyball tournament offering the winning team a $2
column4: 000 cash prize.

column1: In single-player mode
column2: one person controls both characters on a team. In two-player mode
column3: the players either cooperate by playing on the same team or compete against each other by controlling opposing teams. The American version allows the game to be played by up to four players (if the cabinet allows it). The single-player mode consists of two cycles with four stages: the Minor Circuit and the Major Circuit. The stages in the game are Daytona Beach
column4: New York
column5: Los Angeles and Hawaii. After completing the Major Circuit
column6: the player faces against the U.S. Navy team
column7: set in a naval base.

column1: The controls consist of an eight directional joystick and two buttons for jumping and receiving. The characters perform several moves including power spiking
column2: back spiking
column3: jump-serving
column4: blocking and diving.

column1: There are a few minor differences between the Japanese and American releases. The Japanese release features an opening cut-scene explaining the plot. Between matches
column2: intermission sequences depict the main characters visiting a car dealership to purchase a vehicle. As the player progresses
column3: the cars increase in quality
column4: shifting from used cars to new cars during the Major Circuit. The American release removes these cut-scenes
column5: but extends the multiplayer support to up to four players with multiple game modes: 1 or 2 players against the computer
column8: or 2-on-2."

column1: 4432;vendettj;vendettaj;"Crime Fighters 2 (c) 1991 Konami.
;Evil is lurking in Dead End City. In a turf war
column2: the Dead End Gang has kidnapped Kute Kate from the rivals
column3: the Cobras. The Cobras set out to save her and stop the expansion of the Dead End Gang in Vendetta.

column1: The Dead End Gang is looking to expand their territory
column2: so the Cobras must infiltrate every area around the city. First
column3: they must gain entrance to Dead End City. Relying on their fighting skills
column4: the Cobras face a multitude of enemies. However
column5: each member is up for any challenge from the Dead End Gang. The Cobras are a powerful team consisting of: Blood
column6: an ex-prize fighter; Hawk
column7: a former professional wrestler; Boomer
column8: trained in the martial arts; and Sledge
column9: an ex-military convict. Together they must destroy members of the Dead End Gang to get to the leader
column10: Faust
column11: who knows where Kute Kate is being held.

column1: With fists of fury
column2: the Cobras make their way through various areas of Dead End City. They search the construction site for Kate
column3: battling the humanoid weapon The Missing Link to gain information. From there
column4: they are sent on futile chases through other sections of the city
column5: including downtown
column6: the waterfront
column7: and the slums
column8: where the final confrontation with Faust takes place. Throughout the game
column9: the Cobras can pick up special weapons and food for more energy. Each player also has his own 'special attack' method to help defeat the toughest enemies.

column1: Once Kute Kate is rescued and Dead End City is liberated
column2: the Cobras victoriously start back to their home turf. However
column3: much to their surprise
column4: the entrance to their town is blocked by Dead End Gang bosses. The Cobras must gear up once more for the ultimate showdown to restore peace to Dead End City."

column1: 4434;venture;venture;"Venture (c) 1981 Exidy.
;Venture is a 1- or 2-player ""Gauntlet"" style game (although Venture pre-dates the Atari legend by 4 years) set in a multi-level dungeon. The player
column2: armed with a bow and arrow fights through enemy infested levels in the quest to collect treasure.

column1: Each dungeon is represented as a floor plan
column2: populated with a number of ""Space Invader"" like monsters. Numerous rooms and their corresponding doors are clearly marked; these rooms are the treasure rooms and each one must be cleared. When the player enters a room
column3: the viewpoint zooms in on the action and the room takes up the whole screen. Each room has a treasure or weapon guarded by one or more creatures. Players must try to retrieve the treasure while avoiding (or killing) creatures and obstacles. Only in the rooms themselves can players use their bow and arrow.

column1: When the treasure is successfully taken out of the chamber
column2: bonus points are awarded. The screen image then returns to the original
column3: zoomed-out floor plan and the player moves on to the next room of their choice. Once a room has been cleared of its item
column4: the player no longer has access to that room. The player must collect all of the treasures on the current level before descending to another dungeon."

column1: ;Export release. Game developed in Japan. See the original Japanese release for more information about the game itself; ""Dogosoken"".

Released in October 1986 in USA and EUROPE. In this Export release
column2: the voices were changed to speak English dialogue. For example
column3: upon starting the game the player would be greeted by a giant floating head who would exclaim
column4: ""Warriors! Show some guts! You can't escape me! Come get me if you can! Ha ha ha ha haa!"" At this point the floating head would fly off screen and the gameplay commenced. After the player loses a life

column6: let's fight!"" upon returning to the game.

;A excellent isometric shooter game.
The player controlling a spaceship through futuristic and claustrophobics space corridors
column2: while fighting on endless battles against swarms of assorted enemies and powerful giant mechanical bosses. You will have at your disposal a main weapon consisting a pulse laser which can be charged up for increased damage and three bombs: one that can make a wave of fire that starts from behind the player's ship and scrolls ""up"" the screen
column3: another that makes a powerful circular nova-like blast
column4: and one that shoots several mini-missiles capable of homing in on multiple targets. The game has 6 great stages in total."

column1: 4456;vimana;vimana;"Vimana (c) 1991 Toaplan.
;Players control their ship over a constantly scrolling background; the scenery never stops moving until the final level is reached. Players have three weapons at their disposal: the standard shot
column2: a charge shot and a bomb weapon.

column1: The standard shot weapon is a twin-shot weapon capable of strengthening in size and power with upgrades. However
column2: the player has to tap the fire button to fire rapidly; once the button is held down
column3: the ship charges a stronger version of the normal shot capable of spreading out across the entire screen in twelve directions. The player’s bomb weapon
column4: the Circle Bomb
column5: encircles the ship once activated and seeks out enemies upon an additional tap of the bomb button.

column1: There are a total of four items for the player to pick up shot strength
column2: circle bomb
column3: points
column4: and and extra life."

4462;vindice3;vindictre3;Vindicators (c) 1988 Atari Games Corp.
;As team commander of the SR-88 Strategic Battle tanks
column2: you must face the evil invading forces of the Tangent Empire. They're invading the galaxy with 14 space stations designed to defeat your team. Turrets and highly mobile armoured tanks are constantly on patrol to protect the fortifications that Tangents have built.

column1: With limited supplies and weapons
column2: you must make a last stand and attempt to defeat the invaders. The most powerful weapon in your arsenal is the SR-88 Battle Tank
column3: but their fuel supply is very volatile. You must constantly replenish its fuel by picking up fuel canisters throughout the stations' many levels.

column1: Battle stars can be found along the way. These are vital to enhancing your tank and adding weapons. Process generators can convert the battle stars into powers and weapons while in transit between levels and stations. Only with these customized tanks can the evil Tangent Empire be conquered.
As you defeat each station
column2: demolish its control room and take the supplies the fleeing Tangents have left behind. Proceed in their mothership to the next station for another battle."

column1: 4470;viofight;viofight;"Violence Fight (c) 1989 Taito Corp.
;Control different characters with various fighting styles and engage in single or two-player bouts.
In the early 1950's
column2: a game called Violence Fight was popular in the US crime world. Fighters from all over the USA would compete against each other to become that year's champion. The winner stood to make a considerable amount of money.

column1: In downtown LA
column2: a manager called Blinks is training up a new fighter called Bad Blue. He is a strong contender to become the champion and desperately needs the prize money."

column1: 4471;viostorm;viostormeb;"Violent Storm (c) 1993 Konami Company
column2: Limited.

column1: ;Violent Storm is a sideways-scrolling beat-em-up for up to three players set in the aftermath of World War III. The survivors of the war are attempting to rebuild their world but are being terrorised by violent gangs . Three vigilante heroes called 'Boris'
column2: 'Wade' and 'Kyle' are trying to protect the citizens but are hampered in their efforts by the evil and corrupt 'GELD' gang. As the heroes are patrolling the streets
column3: they see their friend
column4: Sheena
column5: kidnapped by the gang. The vigilantes must fight through seven enemy-packed stages to rescue their friend and destroy the gang.

column1: As well as the standard punch and kick moves
column2: each character also has a special attack. This move is powerful enough to fell several enemies at once
column3: but with the trade-off that each time a special attack is executed
column4: some of the player's health is lost. Health levels can be replenished by finding the food that lies hidden in breakable crates and barrels.

column1: Some of the gang members will drop a weapon when they are felled. These weapons can then be picked up and used by the players. Destructible crates and barrels also contain weapons and random bonus items. Stunned enemies fall to the ground and can still be attacked while prone."

4500;vspinbal;vspinbal;Vs. Pinball (c) 1984 Nintendo.
;A great pinball simulator game from Nintendo.

Enjoy a familiar pinball game where the player controls the paddles of a virtual pinball machine. The game has two screens to represent the traditional pinball table and one for a bonus mode. Play begins when the player launches a ball with the plunger from the first screen the bottom of the pinball table through the top of the screen to the second screen. Play will move to the first screen if the ball falls through the bottom of the top screen and will return to the top screen if the ball is hit back through the space at the top of the first screen. The player controls the flippers on either screen to deflect the ball to keep it from falling off the bottom of the lower screen.
Pinball has some many bonnus and also had a secondary Breakout like mode
column2: which the player reaches by hitting the ball into a bonus hole that takes the player to a bonus stage where they control Mario carrying a platform. The object of this mode is to rescue Pauline. The player achieves this by bouncing the ball on the Mario's platform and hitting various targets
column3: the destruction of which also earns them points. When the blocks under her are all gone
column4: she will drop. you must catching her on Mario's platform to earns  bonus points
column5: but you must release pauline it in one of the side platforms and not let it fall
column6: while holding the ball bounce to continue to earn points until the ball falls and go to start."

column1: 4510;vulgus;vulgusa;"Vulgus (c) 1984 Capcom Company
column2: Limited.

column1:
;Vulgus is pretty simple. You just pilot a spaceship and blast countless enemies. That is what is fun about this game. There is nothing complicated, just pure blasting. You only have two weapons, your blaster, and a limited supply of bombs. This title uses the time honored top-down vertically scrolling format. The background moves eternally forward, but you can move all around the screen, and can make the screen scroll both left and right. Your enemies consist of an assortment of fairly realistic looking spacecraft, some of which have a distinctive 'insectoid' look to them. This game is endless and it doesn't seem to have a level format. You just move forward and shoot. The backgrounds will change from time to time from planetary surfaces to space scenes and eventually they will start repeating once you blast this particularly large alien formation.

4513;wacko;wacko;Wacko (c) 1982 Bally Midway.

;Wacko is a colorful single screen shooter, with excellent graphics for the time. You maneuver Kapt'n Krooz'r around the screen in his spaceship. The terrain is an orange moon scene, various cartoonish monsters dot the landscape. You must blast the monsters in pairs to make them vanish. Later levels introduce even more complex rules as to what can be shot. You control your ship with the trackball, while using the joystick to aim and shoot. The controls feel natural with a little practice, but the game quickly becomes very difficult on the higher levels.
4514;wakuwak7;wakuwak7;Waku Waku 7 (c) 1996 Sunsoft.

;A hilarious parody of different styles of anime and video games featuring seven selectable characters and a nasty end boss! It's worth playing for the dialogue alone.
4515;wallc;wallc;Wall Crash (c) 1984 Midcoin.

;A rather simple breakout-style game. There are a few powerup blocks which will provide the player with some assistance along the way. Powerups include: bomb, double bases, and bonus points.
4516;wallst;wallst;Wall Street (c) 1982 Century Electronics.
;Wall Street is a rather odd and unique game consisting of two stages.
Stage one consists of controlling two rescue workers who must prevent suicidal stock brokers from plummeting to their deaths and instead bounce them into a waiting ambulance.
Stage two entails controlling a broker who runs around town collecting money (which they must return to the yellow base) while being chased by tanks
column2: which the player can shoot."

column1: 4518;wardner;wardner;"Wardner (c) 1987 Taito Corp.
;Two young children
column2: Pyros and Erika
column3: have unexpectedly strayed into a wonderland called 'Wardner's Forest'. Upon entering the magical forest
column4: the young girl is changed into a crystal ball by evil warlock and ruler of the forest
column5: 'Wardner'. She is taken to a secret place deep inside the woods. The brave young Pyros
column6: armed only with a magical flame as a weapon
column7: sets out to rescue his female companion from the clutches of the evil Wardner and bring her safely home.

column1: At the end of every level
column2: Pyros enters a shop. The player can use any gold that has been collected on route to buy useful items; such as extra health
column3: time and more powerful weapons. Wardner is an accomplished and playable platform game with smooth
column4: colourful graphics and finely honed gameplay."

column1: 4519;wardnerj;wardnerj;"Wardner no Mori (c) 1987 Taito Corp.

;Atari's Warlords depicts a third-person view of four castles. The player-controlled Warlords and computer-controlled Black Knights use shields to defend their castle walls from the fireballs that ricochet around the playfield.
Players can capture and catapult the fireballs at opposing castles
column2: using their shield control and 'Power Stone' pushbutton. When a fireball hits a castle wall
column3: it destroys one or more bricks
column4: depending on its speed.

column1: A castle not paid for is controlled by the computer
column2: with a Black Knight displayed in the appropriate castle. The Black Knights catapult fireballs at the players with increasing accuracy
column3: to provide challenge.

column1: Game play begins when any start button is pressed and the countdown has ended. The game ends when the last Warlord's castle (containing a crown) has been penetrated by a fireball. At this point a white cloud envelopes the crown
column2: and the latter disappears.

column1: During the countdown
column2: a dragon flies back and forth across the screen with a fireball in its mouth. At the end of the countdown
column3: a position activated by a start button has its Black Knight changed to a Warlord's crown. A position not activated remains as a Black Knight and is controlled by the computer. The dragon then spits the fireball from its mouth toward a Warlord's castle.

column1: The objective is to destroy the three other castles
column2: while protecting one's own castle with the moving shield. The LED pushbuttons have dual functions: in the ready-to-play mode they work as start switches
column3: and during game play they become 'Power Stones' to allow players to capture and catapult fireballs at opponents.

column1: The spinning fireballs released from a shield have more destructive force on a castle wall than a fireball simply deflected from another wall or the sides of the playfield. However
column2: players will soon find out that they cannot hold onto a fireball for long
column3: since it slowly destroys their own castle walls adjacent to the fireball.

column1: Additional fireballs appear at predetermined intervals or when a castle is destroyed
column2: whichever comes first. A maximum of four fireballs simultaneously appear on the screen.

column1: In 1- and 2-player games
column2: the Warlords' crowns will be accompanied by a zero
column3: to begin scoring. The point-scoring system is printed on each control panel (the Black Knights do not earn points).

column1: If a Black Knight has the surviving castle
column2: the game ends. However
column3: if a Warlord has the surviving castle
column4: that player receives bonus points
column5: all castles are rebuilt
column6: and the game continues with a new battle at a higher level. In a 2-player game
column7: both players continue in the game
column8: but only one player can get bonus points. If both Black Knights are eliminated first and only Warlords remain
column9: the level becomes a free-for-all between the two Warlords until one is eliminated. The other Warlord then gets the bonus points
column10: and the game begins again.

column1: The subsequent levels begin
column2: as mentioned before
column3: with the fireball thrown out by the dragon. In the higher levels
column4: Black Knights play more accurately and faster.

column1: 3- and 4-player games (available in the cocktail version only) are free-for-alls. No scores are kept
column2: and the game ends as soon as there is only one castle left."

4524;warpwarp;warpwarp;"Warp & Warp (c) 1981 Namco.
;The objective of the game is to pursue the mystery aliens by warping across 2 different worlds : the Space World and Maze World.  The player may choose when to warp to a different world
column2: so it is possible to continue playing in the same world throughout the game. In Space World
column3: the character uses a gun to shoot up enemy aliens
column4: and in Maze World
column5: aliens are killed using a time-delay bomb. The delay is controlled by the length of time the button is held down
column6: and the player loses if the character is caught in the resulting explosion.

column1: Power-ups may appear on some levels
column2: and allow the player to shoot exploding bullets or attach bombs directly onto enemy aliens. However
column3: the exploding bullets usable in Space World can only obtained in Maze World
column4: and the power-up to attach bombs onto enemies in Maze World only appears in Space World. Players must alternate turns on the screen in the multiplayer mode."

4527;warriorb;warriorb;Warrior Blade - Rastan Saga Episode III (c) 1991 Taito Corp.
;Warrior Blade is a fantasy-themed hack-and-slash game for one or two players
column2: featuring both horizontal and vertically scrolling levels. Unlike previous Rastan games that featured only Rastan himself
column3: players can now choose to play as one of three different warriors: Rastan
column4: Dewey (a hireling) or Sophia (a thief).

column1: Players must then fight their way through a multitude of enemy-packed levels set in a variety of different locations
column2: such as castles
column3: a forest
column4: a swamp and on board a sinking ship. Certain levels also have the players riding on animals
column5: such as horses and dragons. Coins and treasure items can be found in the numerous barrels and chests that litter the levels
column6: as well as being dropped by some defeated enemies. Bonus points and ""vitality"" - depending on the amount of treasure collected - are awarded upon the level's completion.

column1: As well as coins and treasure
column2: other bonus items can be found that give weapon and magical-weapon power-ups
column3: as well as extra vitality (health).

column1: Level progression through the game is not linear. After the very first level
column2: ""Depon Road""
column3: players are presented with a map of the Kingdom
column4: and can choose which of four different routes they wish to take next. The available routes are; Castle (Northwest)
column5: Tower (Northeast)
column6: Ship (Southwest) and Palace (Southeast)."

column1: 4528;waterski;waterski;"Water Ski (c) 1983 Taito Corp.
;In this timed abstract racing game
column2: a single player controls a water-skier who is being pulled along behind a power-boat. The objective is to complete the course in as fast a time as possible to reach the next course
column3: while avoiding rocks
column4: sharks
column5: motor boats
column6: wind surfers and numerous other obstacles.

column1: The player can move their skier left or right
column2: and can press buttons to either slow the boat's speed or to jump over obstacles. Small rocks are the most common obstacle and can either be avoided or jumped over. As well as the small rocks that litter each course
column3: there are also occasional large rocks; these cannot be jumped and must be avoided at all costs. Also
column4: players must be watchful of the direction their tow-boat takes them otherwise they risk being dragged into oncoming obstacles or having their tow-rope snapped on one of the large rocks.

column1: As well as obstacles
column2: each stage also contains one or more large jump ramps. To make a successful jump
column3: players must ensure they hit the bottom of the ramp with their ski-board facing directly forwards. At the top of the ramp players must press the JUMP button
column4: which will propel them from the end of the ramp to make a perfect landing in the water below. Making a successful ramp jump awards the player with bonus points
column5: but if a player fails to hit the bottom of the ramp properly
column6: they will crash and lose valuable seconds."

;A demanding yet superb sprite-scaling racing game from Konami
column2: based on the annual 'WEC Le Mans 24' race; a grueling event that
column3: as its name suggests
column4: takes place over a 24-hour period.

column1: 4603;wotw;wotw;"War of the Worlds (c) 1981 Cinematronics.

;This is one great looking game. You control a little tank that can move back and forth at the bottom of the screen, your enemies are martian walkers that advance on your position. Each martian takes several hits to destroy, as you are actually blasting their legs out from under them. You can protect yourself from their shots by using your shield button, but use it sparingly, as you only have a limited amount of shield time.
4604;wow;wow;Wizard of Wor (c) 1980 Midway.
;Welcome to WIZARD OF WOR! In this magical game
column2: you are a worrior descending into deep dungeon mazes
column3: battling invisible monsters
column4: cacodemons
column5: and maybe even the Wizard of Wor himself! Be of good cheer
column6: worrior
column7: for herein lie many of the secrets of the Wizard.

column1: Wizard of Wor is a game for 1 or 2 players. When the 2-player mode is selected
column2: both players control their worriors at the same time. Teamwork in the 2-player mode is very important (but not necessary to play).

column1: The object of Wizard of Wor is to descend as far into the dungeons of Wor as possible
column2: killing monsters
column3: beating the Wizard
column4: and earning as high a score as you can. The game ends when all the players' worriors have been destroyed.

column1: At the start of the game
column2: you are placed in dungeon one. It contains six blue Burwors. Using the joystick and fire button
column3: maneuver your worrior around the maze and shoot them. As you shoot the last Burwor
column4: a yellow Garwor will come out. Garwors and red Thorwors will turn invisible. The radar will show the positions of the invisible monsters. Invisible Garwors and Thorwors will become visible when they enter the same corridor that a worrior is in. As time goes by
column5: the monsters speed up. The longer it takes before you shoot them
column6: the faster they go. When you have destroyed the Thorwor
column7: the first dungeon ends.

column1: In the 2nd dungeon
column2: a different maze is randomly selected. Once again
column3: six Burwors are placed here. More Garwors and Thorwors will appear this time
column4: however. When the last Thorwor has been shot
column5: Worluk will come out and try to escape out one of the side doors. If you shoot him before he escapes
column6: all point values will be doubled in the next dungeon. After Worluk has been shot or has escaped
column7: the Wizard of Wor may then appear. He teleports closer and closer
column8: continuously firing lightning bolts. He continues to do so until either one worrior has been destroyed
column9: or the Wizard has been shot.

column1: After dungeon 3 or 4
column2: a bonus player is awarded (option switch selectable). You must then face the Arena. This is the toughest of the lower level dungeons. The Worlord dungeons begin at dungeon eight. They are very difficult to survive. At dungeon thirteen
column3: another bonus player is awarded
column4: and you must try to win your way through The Pit. The ultimate goal of Wizard of Wor is to survive The Pit without losing any worriors.

column1: In a 1-player game
column2: the other worrior (blue) is your friend. He will not shoot you unless you come between him and a monster
column3: then he will try to shoot the monster
column4: and you could be hit by his shot.

column1: In a 2-player game
column2: both players play at the same time. They do not take turns. The two players may elect to shoot each other. But
column3: if you wish to survive for long
column4: you must use teamwork!

column1: And now worrior
column2: go forth and do battle with the Wizard of Wor!"

;World Rally is a road rally-themed driving game. Licensed by Gaelco of Barcelona

column4: a high/low gear shifter assembly
column5: and an accelerator pedal.

column1: Players select 1 of 4 rallies to start
column2: each progressively more difficult than the one before. A rally is composed of three stages
column3: offering a variety of different track layouts and road surfaces. Asphalt
column4: dirt
column5: night driving and snow-covered roads require players to adjust their driving skills accordingly.

column1: Players maneuver their way through hairpin curves
column2: jumps
column3: bridges
column4: puddles
column5: and other obstacles. Completing each stage within the 60-second time limit allows players to advance to the next stage for free. After the finish of each stage
column6: and at the completion of all 12 stages
column7: players' times are displayed and compared with other top drivers."

You are the pilot of the mighty combat aircraft 'Solvalou' and must fly through vast zones full of enemies and armed with the classic weaponry the forward-firing gun for aerial targets

4630;xevious;xevious;Xevious (c) 1982 Namco.
;The player pilots a combat aircraft called a 'Solvalou' which is armed with a forward-firing gun for aerial targets
column2: and bombs for destroying ground-based targets. A red targeting square is situated in front of the Solvalou
column3: which allows the player to aim their bombs accurately. The enemy craft appears in a number of different guises; from the standard variety that arrive in large numbers but shoot slow-moving projectiles
column4: to exploding black spheres that shoot projectiles at high speed. There are also rotating shields that cannot be destroyed and must be carefully avoided. Ground enemies are a combination of both stationary bases and moving vehicles
column5: most of which fire slow-moving projectiles. A gigantic
column6: floating fortress (called 'Andor Genesis') appears in certain areas; this is defeated by knocking out its core.

column1: Xevious is actually divided into 16 different areas
column2: which are separated by an area of forest. If a player dies before less than 70% of an area has been completed
column3: play restarts at the beginning of the same area; should a life be lost AFTER 70% of an area has been completed
column4: however
column5: play restarts at the beginning of the next area. After Area 16 has been completed
column6: the game loops back to Area 7.

column1: - CAST OF CHARACTERS -
AIR UNITS :
These are the air units you will encounter during the game. A players skill will determine what air units they may face.
* Andor Genesis (mother ship) - the large ship in Areas 4
column3: and 14.

column1: * Bacura (resistor shield) - the large rotating floating walls which are indestructible.
* Brag Zakato (energy blaster) - medium black ball
column2: with a red dot
column3: that explode and send several shots at your Solvalou.

column1: * Bragza (crystal) - the crystal core of the Andor Genesis mother ship which escapes upon its destruction.
* Garu Zakato (energy bombarder) - large black ball that explode sending out a multitude of shots in all directions.
* Giddo Spario (energy blast) - small
column2: white crystal-like projectiles that come in diagonally at your Solvalou.

column1: * Jara (spinner) - looks like a UFO with a spinning gear in the middle.
* Kapi (deflector) - flat-looking fighter with two front projections that flies in
column2: fires multiple shots
column3: then escapes quickly.

column1: * Sheonite (escort) - small spinning diamond-shaped craft which escort your Solvalou for a bit and fly off.
* Terrazi (destructor) - flat looking
column2: diamond shaped fighter that flies in
column3: fires multiple shots
column4: then escapes quickly.

column1: * Torkan (scout ship) - ridged fighter that flies in
column2: fires one shot
column3: then escapes quickly.

column1: * Toroid (fleet) - ring-shaped fighter which is traditionally the first enemy you encounter.
* Zakato (energy launcher) - small black ball that explodes sending a single shot at your Solvalou.
* Zoshi (death squad) - the round spinning fighter which can sometimes attack from behind.
GROUND UNITS :
These are the ground units you will encounter during the game.
* Barra (energy station) - small pyramid-shaped buildings.
* Boza Logram (dome network) - a structure of four Lograms surrounding a Derota.
* Derota (defense site) - the small octagonal-shaped gun batteries that fire multiple shots at your Solvalou.
* Domogram (rover) - looks like a mobile Logram that travels along the roads and fires shots at your Solvalou.
* Garu Barra (energy base) - medium and large pyramid-shaped buildings.
* Garu Derota (mega site) - the large octagonal-shaped gun batteries that fire multiple shots at your Solvalou.
* Grobda (tank) - the tank-like vehicles that travel along the road. They can detect when your bombsight is on them and they will move out of the way.
* Logram (sphere station) - silver circular domes that fire single shots at your Solvalou.
* Sol (citadel) - underground structures which rise up when initially bombed.
* Zolbak (detector dome) - domes with red squares on top and around their base."

column1: 4643;xmen;xmen;"X-Men (c) 1992 Konami.
;X-Men is a side-scrolling beat-em-up for up to four players. The X-Men's mission is to find and rescue Professor X
column2: who has been captured by evil mutants and is now being held prisoner by Magneto.

column1: Each X-Man character has an 'Attack'
column2: 'Jump' and 'Mutant Power' button. The mutant power attack is a powerful special move unique to each X-Man. While it inflicts a lot of damage on the enemies
column3: the trade-off is that each usage removes 3 bars from the players health meter (a full meter has 10 bars). Each level ends with a face-off against a powerful mutant boss character.

column1: The game has six stages
column2: with the final one set on 'Asteroid M'
column3: Magneto's base. The defeated mutant bosses from the previous levels each make an appearance (albeit in a less powerful form) before the final encounter with Magneto himself.

column1: Players can chose from 6 X-Men characters
column2: they are:

column1: Cyclops
Colossus
Wolverine
Storm
Nightcrawler
Dazzler"

;The game centers around an unusual alien invasion against a colony planet in the year 2249—the aliens themselves are microscopic creatures that invade
column2: infect
column3: and kill the colonists. Scientists have deployed the microscopic fighter X-002 into the body of the hapless woman whose body has been invaded by the alien queen.

column1: The game itself is a side-scroller like R-Type
column2: albeit with a short vertical-scrolling area towards the end of the sixth level. Instead of the Force pod
column3: however
column4: the main power-up apparatus takes the form of two flexible tentacles. The tentacles are invulnerable to all enemy attacks
column5: and can be positioned with careful maneuvering of the X-002."
