4661;xybots;xybots;Xybots (c) 1987 Atari Games Corp.
;Xybots is a 3-Dimensional
column2: 3rd-person perspective shoot-em-up for 1 or 2 players. Taking on the role of either 'Major Rock Hardy' or 'Captain Ace Gunn' (in the 2-player game)
column3: players must shoot their way through a huge
column4: multi-level underground city - made up of a series of mazes - and destroy the evil 'Xybot' robot warriors that have invaded the planet and established their underground fortress. The players' on-screen counterparts walk 'into' the screen and players must manually rotate the maze's viewpoint left and right when changing direction in order to be able to look in the direction they are moving.

column1: Each level has at least one exit that must be reached in order to progress to the next (some levels have extra hidden exits that 'warp' players to later levels). Players can find energy pods to restore energy levels
column2: keys to open doors
column3: and golden coins. Some of the levels also feature transporters that connect different parts of the same level.

column1: At the end of each level
column2: players can enter a shop where supplies and power-ups can be purchased with any coins they have collected. Some supplies
column3: such as 'Shield' or 'Speed' are permanent
column4: whereas others are only temporary and must be replenished.

column1: A map of each level is displayed at the top of the screen. For some levels
column2: all enemies
column3: objects and walls are shown. On later levels
column4: however
column5: the map may only display the enemy robots and/or objects; with the maze walls and layout only becoming visible once a player has 'looked' at a wall section. Xybots' gameplay feels highly reminiscent of a 3-Dimensional ""Gauntlet"" (with good reason
column6: see TRIVIA for more details). The game also uses a split-screen display to allow for two-player simultaneous play; something of an innovation for 1987.

column1: Like the ""Gauntlet"" games on which Xybots is based; the game is endless and play will continue until all lives are lost and players no longer wish to use the 'Continue' option."

4673;yard;10yardj;10-Yard Fight (c) 1983 Irem Corp.
;It's 3rd and 10. The crowd is on its feet. Cheers fill the stadium. ""36-88-24. Hut-hut-hut."" The ball is snapped. You grip the hard
column2: cold
column3: pigskin and the game is in your hands. You scramble left to avoid a flying tackle and look downfield. A receiver is open. You pump a forward pass. It's complete for a 10 yard gain and a first down.

column1: That's the rush the player gets with 10-YARD FIGHT
column2: the 1- or 2-player video with the continuous play feature. The thrill of controlling the action. Of calling the plays and carrying the ball. Of a real Pro contest of America's # 1 Game.

column1: The player takes the field
column2: takes the ball and takes on as much action as he can handle. He must score a touchdown in the time allotted to go from high school and college all the way to the Pros and the Super Bowl
column3: with cheerleaders marking his progress-in-between.

column1: Each level begins with the player carrying the ball on the kick-off as far up the field as he can before getting tackled. Then he's in control as quarterback
column2: running with the ball or going for a forwards pass or a lateral to a receiver who let's him know he's open by waving his arms. If the pass is intercepted a 20 yard penalty is called. As in authentic Pro ball
column3: the clock is stopped when the player runs out of bounds. For bonus points after the referee signals a touchdown
column4: the player can kick the ball or run with it to score ""points after"".

column1: 10 YARD FIGHT
It lets YOU score like a Pro at the cashbox!"

4676;yiear;yiear;Yie Ar Kung-Fu (c) 1985 Konami Industry Company
column2: Limited.

column1: ;Yie Ar Kung Fu is a classic one-on-one fighting game that pits a single player against a procession of distinctive
column2: and often armed opponents. While somewhat limited in gameplay terms
column3: Yie Ar Kung-Fu introduced a major innovation to the beat-em-up genre as it was the first one-on-one fighter to offer a progression of truly different opponents for the player to defeat. This is something that would later be adopted by Capcom for its legendary Street Fighter series; as well as SNK and countless others. Many of Yie Ar's eleven opponents are armed with a wide variety of weapons
column4: such as a nunchuks
column5: throwing stars
column6: a chain
column7: a sword and a club.

column1: Yie Ar Kung-Fu is a game of reflexes and as such plays incredibly quickly
column2: with the player having to be constantly on the move to avoid getting 'pegged in' by some of the game's tougher opponents. The first five fights take place in front of an animated waterfall
column3: while the remaining six have the player battling in front of a picturesque
column4: oriental pagoda. There is no time limit set in which the opponent must be defeated and the player's character
column5: Oolong
column6: possesses a finite amount of health per stage. Should the player's health bar be fully depleted
column7: the match is lost."

4679;yosakdon;yosakdon;Yosaku to Donbei (c) 1979 Wing.
;In this title you play a little farmer guy
column2: who is attempting to shoot down the crows out of his tree. Gameplay is identical to that of ""Space Invaders"". A large bird replaces the UFO that goes over the top of the screen from time to time. While a lumberjack will chop out a section of the tree every time the birds reach the side of the screen (lowering them closer to the bottom). The only real gameplay difference is that the birds come in a pyramid pattern
column3: as opposed to the rectangle pattern of ""Space Invaders"". This serves to make the game much easier."

column1: 4687;zaviga;zaviga;"Zaviga (c) 1984 Data East Corp.
;A great vertical shoot'em up game.

You play as a futuristic jet fighter aircraft that can transform into a tank to descend and ascend. The planet is under attack by hordes of shape bugs robotics and other war machines. Your Aircraft are equipped with 2 laser cannons and bombs for a dual attack in air or land. The game scrolls infinitely of the levels are stopping for an occasional fight against a cannon mountain
column2: that you defeat by destroying a glowing weak spot. With each scroll through the game introduces new enemies and obstacles like flying rocks and underwater enemies."

column1: 4689;zaxxon;zaxxon;"Zaxxon (c) 1982 Sega.
;Zaxxon is an isometric scrolling shoot-em-up in which the player pilots an armed spaceship and must penetrate heavily-fortified enemy bases
column2: destroying enemy ships and installations before reaching the final confrontation with a giant armoured robot.

column1: The game consists of three different waves:
* Floating Fortress: Players must penetrate the fortress's defences
column2: destroying fuel tanks
column3: gun emplacements
column4: missiles and fighters. An altimeter constantly monitors the player ship's height
column5: necessary to navigate through the walls and electronic barriers that form part of fortress's defences. The player's ship carries a limited amount of fuel that is constantly depleting and can only be replenished by shooting ground-based enemy fuel tanks. If the ship's fuel runs out
column6: it crashes to the ground and a life is lost.

column1: * Fighter Fleet: This takes place in outer-space with the player attacked by waves of enemy fighters and rogue satellites. The player ship's fuel does not deplete during this wave.
* Enemy Headquarters: This is similar to the 'Floating Fortress' wave (with fuel depletion once again being an issue)
column2: but with the player facing much tougher defences. Upon completion of this wave
column3: the player enters into battle with a giant armoured robot. The robot fires fast-moving homing missiles and needs to be hit six times before it's destroyed. Upon completion of the third wave
column4: the game starts over with a higher level of difficulty."

column1: * Fighter Fleet: This takes place in outer-space with the player attacked by waves of enemy fighters and rogue satellites. The player ship's fuel does not deplete during this wave.
* Enemy Headquarters: This is similar to the 'Floating Fortress' wave (with fuel depletion once again being an issue)
column2: but with the player facing much tougher defences. Upon completion of this wave
column3: the player enters into battle with a giant armoured robot. The robot fires fast-moving homing missiles and needs to be hit six times before it's destroyed. Upon completion of the third wave
column4: the game starts over with a higher level of difficulty."

column1: 4691;zaxxonb;zaxxonb;"Jackson (c) 1982.
4692;zedblade;zedblade;Operation Ragnarok (c) 1994 NMK.
;Operation Ragnarok is a sideways scrolling shoot-em-up for one or two players. Players can chose from three different ships
column2: each with varying speeds.

column1: As well as ship choices
column2: there are three different selectable weapon systems available; one each for the front and rear firing weapons and one for projectile weapons (such as Homing Missiles).

column1: Some enemies and waves drop bonuses and weapon power-up items when destroyed. Hyper-Bombs (very powerful 'Smart Bombs') can also be picked up."
4693;zektor;zektor;"Zektor (c) 1982 Sega.
;Zektor is a one- or two-player game that tasks you with the liberation of eight cities that have been seized by the evil cadre of alien robots. In order to liberate a city
column2: you must defeat three attack waves of fighters and robo-probes. Fighters and Robo-probes are often shielded (in red)
column3: and each consecutive hit reduces the enemies shield strength
column4: until
column5: when the shield drops
column6: a hit will destroy it. In addition
column7: you will encounter three types of Moboids :

column1: * Green Moboids spin the players ship on contact
column2: and bounce enemy ships.

column1: * Blue Moboids bounce all ships.
* Red Moboids destroy all un-shielded ships (including the players ship).
After defeating three attack waves
column2: the Alien Robot holding that city will reappear within rotating protective rings
column3: through which a 'slot shot' neutralizes that Robot
column4: awarding the player a bonus ship and advancement to the next round."

column1: 4694;zerohour;zerohour;"Zero Hour (c) 1980 Universal.

;Maneuver your spaceship and destroy meteorites and enemy ships falling from the top of the screen. Shooting a red meteorite awards a quadruple score. After all enemy ships have been destroyed, a landing pad will appear where you must carefully land your ship. Bonus points are awarded for a successful landing.

;Shoot oncoming planes and ground targets using your gun. Land on the air strip for extra points between stages. The game is an X and Z axis vertical shooter.
4706;zodiack;zodiack;Zodiack (c) 1983 Esco Trading Company
column2: Incorporated.

column1: ;A challenging
column2: vertical scrolling shooter.

column1: On deep space you must fly the 'Zogram' (your spaceship fighter) and destroy hordes of enemies
column2: while dodge space objects.

column1: Destroy eight 'Mitiohro' around the 'Goke' (the enemy base) for takeoff and landing of 'Ahro' (the enemy's fighter). After destroying all the 'Mitiohro'
column2: return to the 'Battlestar-asat' base.

column1: The color of 'Mitiohro' on the picture changes when the gates for takeoff and landing of 'Ahro' opens. It is the time to attack!
As you destroy 'Ahro'
column2: 'Mitiohro' becomes to leave the 'Goke's' body
column3: but you cannot destroy those 'Mitiohro' with your laser beam.

column1: You can get a higher score depending of the precision landing of your spaceship at nearer spot to the center of the 'Battlestar-asat' base.
When you score 20
column2: 000 points
column3: you can get one more Zogram and at 50
column4: 000 points you can get another Zogram."

column1: 4707;zombraid;zombraid;"Zombie Raid (c) 1995 American Sammy.
;Welcome to the extraordinary world of Zombie Raid. Players use specially designed sawed-off shotguns with pump action reload to fight their way through the graveyard
column2: through castles and dungeons and even through the mad scientist's laboratory. Battle all kinds of ghastly creatures
column3: like zombies and other frightful beings. You may feel like you're lost in a horror movie!

column1: A myriad of secrets have been programmed into the game for added dimension. Can you discover how to get extra life? Can you find a way to escape the forces? Can you defeat the evil? The challenges are endless!"
4708;zookeep;zookeep;"Zoo Keeper (c) 1982 Taito America Corp.
;Zoo Keeper is a superb
column2: fast-paced arcade game in which the player takes control of Zeke the zookeeper. Many of the animals at Zeke's zoo are running wild and have captured Zeke's girlfriend
column3: Zelda. Zeke must recapture as many animals as possible and rescue his sweetheart from the animals' clutches.

column1: Zoo Keeper features two different
column2: alternating play fields
column3: with each level having its own task to complete; as well as a final 'bonus screen'. The three levels are as follows :

column1: On the first play field
column2: players must move Zeke around the outside of an animal enclosure
column3: constantly re-building the enclosure wall that the animals are set on destroying. Any wild animals that are loose must be jumped over or the player will lose a life. The level's timer is represented as a fizzing fuse
column4: and along this fuse are a number of bonus items such as beer or a net for catching escaped animals. When the timer's fuse reaches an item
column5: it will appear on screen and can be picked up. Once the timer makes it to the word 'End'
column6: the current level is completed and play moves on to the next level. The bonus items that occasionally appear include mugs of beer
column7: ice cream sundaes
column8: clover clubs
column9: watermelons
column10: etc.

column1: If Zeke manages to pick up a net
column2: he will be able to capture the animals and put them back into the Zoo. The net will eventually disappear and the captured animals will try to escape once more by breaking through the enclosure wall. Zeke will have to continue building the wall around the Zoo until the time is up. At the end of the level
column3: bonus points are awarded for every animal inside the wall. Animals found on this level are snakes
column4: moose
column5: camels
column6: rhinos
column7: elephants
column8: and a lion.

column1: On the second
column2: more difficult play field
column3: Zelda is tied to a palm tree and Zeke must rescue her by jumping to the top of the screen via a series of moving platforms; dodging the coconuts thrown by a mischievous monkey. On each of the platforms
column4: various foods and drinks can collected to earn extra points. Sometimes
column5: one of the ledges will have a 'Free Game' sign that will grant the player a free credit. While Zelda is tied up
column6: she says 'save me'
column7: and whenever Zeke gets knocked out by one of the deadly coconuts
column8: she says 'Oh
column9: no!' If Zeke makes it all the way to the top and rescues her
column10: she says 'My Hero' and a bonus of 5
column11: 000 points is awarded.

column1: The first and second screens are alternated before the player finally reaches the third and final 'bonus screen'. Here
column2: Zeke must jump over the herds of charging animals that are running from a cage at the foot of an escalator. Zeke must reach the escalator behind the animals' cage and make his way up to the next floor
column3: where a second escalator - replete with more charging animals - awaits. Zeke must reach the top of the second escalator to rescue the trapped Zelda.

column1: After Zeke has rescued Zelda on the final screen
column2: the game begins again with an increased level of difficulty."

column1: 4711;zunkyou;zunkyou;"ずんずん教の野望 (c) 1994 Sega Enterprises
column2: Limited.

column1:
;(Zunzunkyou no Yabou)
4712;zwackery;zwackery;Zwackery (c) 1984 Bally Midway.

;Zwackery was a sword-fighting and spell-casting game in which the player controls a cartoony wizard Zak Thwacker on a quest to restore an enchanted frog back into the buxom princess she once was. A platform-style exploration game, the world that Zak explores is actually dozens of different screens which the player exits and enters through doorways and tunnels in search of spell and other powerups that will help him defeat the Evil Ghoulum. The Sword can be used to stab, or it can be spun around the player. The Shield, which can be wielded in the same manner, provides protection. Spells include Bouncing Boots, Shooting Swords, Invisibility Potions, Magic flutes, and a Dragons Egg, which put Leapin Fungoes to sleep and allows safe passage through the Dragon's Lair.
4713;zzyzzyx2;zzyzzyxx2;ZZYZZYXX (c) 1982 Cinematronics.

;Perseverance will be overwhelming emotion game players as they move ZZYZZYXX up and down horizontal rows of alternating moving bricks to gather presents which will satisfy his love. Lola -- whose affection is not easily captured. ZZYZZYXX's vulnerability increases (as he collects gifts
column2: as well as points) not only because of Lola's untouchable attitude
column3: but because of obstacles such as rattifers trying to put an end to ZZYZZYXX's quest for Lola's love and affection.

column1: Intelligent as the rattifers may be
column2: there are 2 defenses ZZYZZYXX can use to outsmart the destructive creatures. ZZYZZYXX can brick himself within a brick when he sees an approaching rattifer or ZZYZZYXX can move into the space where there is a gold helmet. The gold helmet intensifies ZZYZZYXX's goal to reach Lola by allowing ZZYZZYXX to use the helmet to enclose a rattifer or break through one brick which is obstructing ZZYZZYXX's course towards Lola.

column1: As irreproachable as Lola appears. Lola is overjoyed by ZZYZZYXX's success to retrieve enough presents and she whistles resoundingly to let ZZYZZYXX know. After ZZYZZYXX's triumphant deed for love. ZZYZZYXX becomes invincible
column2: enabling him to elude the rattifers by imprisoning them within their spaces.

column1: Other dangers testing ZZYZZYXX's skillful maneuvering are falling bombs
column2: rising missiles and cracked bricks
column3: each capable of disintegrating ZZYZZYXX.

column1: As an added attraction
column2: when a game player completes each level
column3: there are animated cartoons depicting ZZYZZYXX's passionate desire to impress his love for Lola. Also delightful music throughout the game leaves the players humming and their foot tapping."
